Title: Data-analist
Description:
Mission context

Business and data-analyst within the Market & Customer Analysis team
Plays a role in close collaboration with other team members and internal stakeholders in translating business needs into hypotheses which can be verified by using client data being available
Having a good knowledge of the business context combined with a strong analytical mind
Being critical (i.e. being able to translate the research needs into relevant hypotheses, covering relevant data variables, being able to focus on what's key in the outcome of the analysis)
Being able to grasp the relevant data (knowing which data is required, which variables, format, data sources,...) and to transform and analyze it in order to support business in their existing needs or client-data related questions




Function description

Gather, transform and analyse rough data using sourcing techniques.
Deliver business impact in order to improve customer approach.
Deliver to the point stories in ppt with key conclusions & recommendations based on data




Language requirements

Dutch - Fluent
French - Fluent
English - Fluent




Education

You have a Master’s degree in economics or a Master’s degree in another academic background with substantial knowledge and experience in data and analytics in a business context.

Required experience / knowledge

You have at least 6 years of relevant experience in Data Analytics.




Technical experience

Mandatory

Data analysis is part of your DNA, i.e. very good knowledge of data analytics tools such as SAS, Python, SQL, R, Power BI, Tableau...
Your data analytics tools knowledge doesn't impose any problems in setting up ad hoc queries, reports,...
Being eager to get grip on the most relevant data , to understand it well and to analyze it in that way that it answers the business questions and relevant conclusions & recommendations can be set
Good to very good knowledge of PowerPoint in order to bring the story based on data in an appealing way




Business experience

Mandatory

Good knowledge of bank & insurance products (having experience in this sector is an asset)
Good knowledge of RPB - Retail & Private Banking (having experience in this sector is an asset)




Soft skills

Team player
Quick self-starter, pro-active attitude
Good Communication and Influencing skills
Good analytical and synthesis skills
Autonomy, commitment and perseverance
Ability to work in a dynamic and multi-cultural environment
Customer Oriented
Critical
Flexible

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Business Data Analyst ⚡

European Union




Our client is a world-leading luxury marketplace. They serve high-net-worth individuals in some of their most important transactions. These transactions include luxury real estate, luxury cars, yachts, private jets, and hard-to-find luxury watches, among other high-priced items. With over a million users spread across countries like the United States, UK, France, and Germany, they have a constant catalog of over 200,000 listings. They are in a phase of rapid growth, thanks to strong investors, and are looking for a Business Data Analyst to join them remotely in this phase.




Responsibilities:




Working with internal teams and data to provide visibility into their business functions, activity, trends and performance.
Working closely with their engineering team to establish and communicate data transformation and storage needs.
Partnering with their business leaders to develop and execute projects to help accelerate business growth and improve processes.
Compiling data from different tables in their DWH, preparing the data for analysis, visualising in Tableau dashboards, and feed insights to other business functions.

Requirements:




5+ years of experience in analytical positions
Strong analytics conceptual and problem-solving abilities
Fluent in English
Proficient in – SQL, Tableau, Python and DQuery

Why Apply?




Global work environment and international team
Competitive compensation plus equity
Work from anywhere and flexible working
Opportunity to work with CTO
Unlimited holiday




🌎 European Union - Remote

📧 Interested in applying? Please click on the ‘Easy Apply’ button

⚡ Storm5 is a specialist RetailTech recruitment firm with clients across Europe, APAC and North America. To discuss open opportunities or career options, please visit our website at storm5.com and follow the Storm5 LinkedIn page for the latest jobs and intel.

Business Data Analyst ⚡

European Union


Our client is a world-leading luxury marketplace. They serve high-net-worth individuals in some of their most important transactions. These transactions include luxury real estate, luxury cars, yachts, private jets, and hard-to-find luxury watches, among other high-priced items. With over a million users spread across countries like the United States, UK, France, and Germany, they have a constant catalog of over 200,000 listings. They are in a phase of rapid growth, thanks to strong investors, and are looking for a Business Data Analyst to join them remotely in this phase.


Responsibilities:


  • Working with internal teams and data to provide visibility into their business functions, activity, trends and performance.
  • Working closely with their engineering team to establish and communicate data transformation and storage needs.
  • Partnering with their business leaders to develop and execute projects to help accelerate business growth and improve processes.
  • Compiling data from different tables in their DWH, preparing the data for analysis, visualising in Tableau dashboards, and feed insights to other business functions.

Requirements:


  • 5+ years of experience in analytical positions
  • Strong analytics conceptual and problem-solving abilities
  • Fluent in English
  • Proficient in – SQL, Tableau, Python and DQuery

Why Apply?


  • Global work environment and international team
  • Competitive compensation plus equity
  • Work from anywhere and flexible working
  • Opportunity to work with CTO
  • Unlimited holiday


🌎 European Union - Remote

📧 Interested in applying? Please click on the ‘Easy Apply’ button

⚡ Storm5 is a specialist RetailTech recruitment firm with clients across Europe, APAC and North America. To discuss open opportunities or career options, please visit our website at storm5.com and follow the Storm5 LinkedIn page for the latest jobs and intel.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Do you want to work at a company with real social impact? On top of that you value a healthy work-life balance? Say no more! I have THE right place for you ;)


The Data Analyst takes ownership of the monitoring and reporting of the systems installed with our customers. They ensure that the client systems are in good working order, data trends are clear, and that business can be steered according to the data we manage. They propose improvements and develop process and procedures that continuously improve the level of service.


Your tasks


  • Ensure data collection, integrity and consistency;
  • Transform data into information: propose and develop dashboards and analysis that help supporting production and continuous improvement;
  • Ensure monitoring of the production systems;
  • Define, implement and maintain dashboards and monitoring/reporting tools ;
  • Analyse events and issues, resolve them and support clients in that process ;
  • Feed back and contribute to the improvement of the solution from an incident and customer support point-of-view ;
  • Contribute to the deployments of new clients and solutions by creating and deploying new systems and tools;


Your profile


  • University degree in science, engineering, economics or management;
  • Experience with data monitoring and analysis; ability to structure and present data;
  • Knowledge of relational DBs / SQL;
  • Python and ML are an asset;
  • You speak French/Dutch and English;


We're offering


  • A fixed contract within a high-growth scale-up;
  • The opportunity to grow within the role and the company;
  • Plenty of opportunity to learn.
  • A competitive salary supplemented with extra legal benefits (hospitalization insurance, group insurance, company car, teleworking, etc.).
  • Diversity & inclusion - We are passionate about the inclusion and support of individuals of all groups; we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, or disability status.


Want to know more?

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a Data Analyst to pick up and deliver new data driven cases by analysing the requirements and data involved.

The goal of the project is to build a new IT Data Lake on AWS with IT related data feeds, both batch and online and the exploitation of that data with automated reports and AI cases to support the IT organization and its processes.

What skills do you need to meet the requirements of our team?


You are capable to define qualitative data selections queries based upon the requirements
You are used to join in with the feasibility study to determine what data the company need, define the work to be done and by whom
You will be the guard quality of the data and verify the integrity, think ahead to define possible issues
You have a good knowledge of GDPR and how to deal with it in a data driven context


What functions will help you advance?


You have at least 3 year experience in (big) Data Projects
You have data analysis, data definitions and data modelling skills
You have knowledge of the Agile method with Safe
You have a strong written and verbal communication, who can listen and understand
You are a real team player: who like helping and coaching
Having an Experience with IT processes regarding development, operations or security is an asset.


Does this sound like a challenge for you? Then don't hesitate to apply and join our team!

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
*The position is based in Hanover / Germany, but can also be managed remotely from another city in Germany or from one of our EU / UK locations.*




*Feel free to apply in English or German.*




As a Data Analyst, you are part of a cross-functional team that delivers all the data products for the Hotel division from conception to operation. You will collaborate with Data Engineers, Data Analysts and most important your peers in the business domains to clearly define, document and communicate requirements that will enable implementation of new changes and enhancements to our data platforms in an agile manner.




About The Job




You’re responsible for evaluating solution options, consulting with stakeholders, providing data driven answers and collaborating with your team to implement productive data driven services and to shape the future of the Hotel division of TUI Hotels & Resorts.
Working with a varied set of technology and business stakeholders, you define and document new business, user, and system requirements, considering impacts to upstream/ downstream services.
You support the requirement lifecycle from planning through to elicitation, testing, delivery, and business acceptance.
As a Data Analyst you understand the data specific business needs and using your excellent collaboration skills you and your team deliver the best data driven solutions. You will use our Self-Service BI Tools (Tableau, Matillion) to maintain and create new valueable analysis.
You will prioritize your work and create a Roadmap together with the Business for delivery.
You love to work in an international, multi-cultural team. You challenge constructively and have high expectations of yourself and others. You always drive for excellence, ownership and self-organisation at team and personal level.
You love to learn and acquire new skills and keep up to date with latest developments in your focus areas. You’re an active member in the Analytics community.




About You




Strong analytical skills to break down complex problems, identify relevant data sources and split tasks into manageable steps in order to enhance or create data products
Good communication skills in order to discuss with technical and non-technical stakeholders
Good knowledge of cloud databases, enterprise data warehouse structures, data pipelines and strong SQL skills
Good knowledge of Tableau
Experience in creating data driven dashboards to answer questions raised by the business
Customer centric, passionate about delivering great data products and services
Passionate about continuous improvement
Open minded, inquisitive, life-long learner
Comfortable with ambiguity, highly autonomous




About Our Offer




Working in the leading global tourism group: We stand for intercultural cooperation and offer the opportunity to work in international projects and teams.  
Mobile working and flexible working hours: We believe that work is something you do, not where you go. Our offer: newWork@TUI (hybrid working) & TUI Workwide (Working from abroad) 
Development and career opportunities: We promote the potential of our employees with a wide range of (digital) training opportunities and international career opportunities.  
Personal benefits: We offer attractive remuneration with holiday bonus, generous travel benefits, extensive health & wellbeing offers and much more.  




We love to see your uniqueness shine through and inspire the future of travel. If you would like to read more about what Diversity & Inclusion means to us simply visit Our DNA.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
As a data analyst, you will play a central role in developing a data-driven culture at skeyes and contribute to the continuous optimisation of skeyes’ performance, on the basis of all the data and indicators pertaining to skeyes activities.


What does a skeyes Data Analyst do?

Together with a young and dynamic team of data, process and business analysts, you will analyse and transform data into a valuable and intelligent business element that can be easily read, interpreted and used by skeyes management for the operational, business, strategic developments and control activities. You will constantly strive to ensure managers are supported by our data feeds and are easily able to plug them in as an extra dimension that reinforces their work and brings it to the next level.


Your day-to-day job will include the analysis of large amounts of data to transform it into information to ease business analytics and data-driven decisions. Your technical expertise will ensure the quality and accuracy of that data. You will work on the data processes and quality assurance. You will build accessible & intuitive dashboards and visualizations that accelerate insight generation.


Your data and automation skills will contribute to drive efficiency through process automation.


Your knowledge of skeyes’ business and areas of expertise will allow you to make meaningful analyses and draw relevant conclusions, namely in the Air Traffic Management domain.


Concretely, you will be required to:

  • Interpret data, analyse results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
  • Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
  • Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
  • Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
  • Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
  • Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
  • Locate and define new process improvement opportunities


What makes you the perfect candidate ?


  • You preferably hold an engineer’s degree or a Master’s degree in statistics, information management, mathematics or a related subject involving maths, such as economics or computer/data science;
  • You have analytical skills and a sharp critical mind;
  • You are able to collect, organize, analyse, model and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy;
  • You are adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings;
  • You are able to explain complex ideas or structures in a simple way;
  • You are solution-oriented;
  • You are able to plan your work and meet tight deadlines;
  • You are able and motivated to learn new technologies rapidly;
  • You are a team worker;
  • You possess written and verbal communication skills in English and preferably also in Dutch or French;
  • You are familiar with the business of an Air Navigation Service Provider (flight operations, air traffic services, airspace management, round the clock shifts organisation, …) .


You have experience in one or more of the following areas:

  • Manipulating large excel sheets, pivot tables and complex macros;
  • Power BI, Microsoft’s Power platform and DAX, or other BI tools and platforms;
  • Data visualisation
  • SQL and an understanding of relational database design;
  • Data architecture and building data pipelines;
  • A scripting language (python, java, …);
  • Automation of data storage;
  • Air traffic (flow) management, Air traffic services, Airspace design, airport operations

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Mission




Ce département a comme objectifs :




Surveiller de bout en bout la Quality of Experience du client à l'aide d'indicateurs de Qualité & Performance sous-jacents sur tous les systèmes et activités de la TECH.
Designer, développer et maintenir les tableaux de bord nécessaires au pilotage de la TECH par des décisions data-driven.
S'assurer que tous les KPI Q&P TECH restent dans la zone optimale en générant les alertes adéquates et en corrigeant tous les problèmes à leur source.
Effectuer des analyses de données assistées par de l'IA pour améliorer la qualité et les performances de la TECH.
Mise en place d'une maintenance préventive : identifier proactivement des problèmes sous le radar et les stopper avant qu'ils ne créent des incidents.
Mettre en place une Quality Assurance sur toutes les activités/livrables de la TECH (DevOps, CI/CD).
Sensibiliser et inculquer la culture de la qualité dans chaque action de la TECH.
Diriger tous les projets qualité (Lean) Six Sigma à la TECH




Mission proposée




Produire des indicateurs End 2 End (à partir d'informations provenant des différents départements de la TECH) de qualité et de performance visuels (KPI) du réseau, des systèmes et des services fournis par le département TECH, contribuer à leur analyse et proposer des leviers d'amélioration continue.
Grâce à la réflexion, à la prise de hauteur et l'initiative, favoriser le développement de nouvelles perspectives de rapports ou de croisements de données en apportant aux business leaders un regard différent sur leur qualité et leur performance.
Jouer un rôle moteur grâce à son implication auprès de tous les départements de la TECH en interaction avec les Business Analyst afin d'être proactif et force de proposition et de mise en oeuvre.
Automatiser les reporting opérationnels nécessaires au pilotage des départements de la TECH et s'assurer que les KPI restent dans la zone optimale.




Profil




Diplôme d'Ingénieur commercial, master en sciences éco ou IT, data analyst/scientist.
3 à 8 ans d'expérience comme analyste data.
Une expérience en tant qu'analyste business est un plus et à défaut, de bonnes aptitudes à la définition et compréhension de besoins fonctionnels est requise.
La connaissance d'outils de la chaîne BI est nécessaire (DB/SQL, ETL - Matillon, Tableau).
Un encrage fort dans la culture de la qualité et du sense making.
Compétence méthodologiques liées à l'analyse de données et aux processus opérationnels.
Certification Six Sigma (yellow ou green belt) et data sciences sont des atouts.

Title: Data Analyst - Process
Description:
SGK is a global packaging and brand experience company. From idea to implementation, we deliver packaging solutions and brand experiences that give brands the freedom to speak louder, scale faster and grow stronger. We simplify marketing and amplify brands to deliver value. SGK is a Matthews International company.




Role Summary




We are recruiting for a Data Analyst to join our team on a 12 months fixed term contract basis. This role can be worked on a hybrid basis from any of our EMEA locations.




Working closely with our client you will be responsible for analysing multiple sources of data, manipulating this data to turn into KPIs, developing dashboards and translating complex data into functional tools. You will also use this analysis to come up with tools to further improve internal company processes.




Responsibilities




Develops processes and workflows to standardize multiple processes.
Develops tools and documents for data collection as well as enhances and streamlines the analysis process and standards.
Obtains related information to upload in various databases.
Gathers and compiles accurate data for reports and completes data analysis for material requirements and capacity planning.
Prepares reports and documents clearly summarizing the results of data analysis.
Collaborates with various stakeholders to provide plans to meet expected service levels for all services.
Analyses and maintains data collected.
Leads projects as assigned.
Additional duties as assigned.




Qualifications/Skills




High degree of proficiency in Excel, MS Office Suite, Outlook & Internet applications
Able to translate complicated formulas into readable, presentable data to be shared with multiple stakeholders
Strong analytical, verbal and written communication skills (including analysis, interpretation, & reasoning)
Solid understanding and application of mathematical concepts
Ability to develop and maintain collaborative relationships with peers and colleagues across the organization, as well as, internal and external clients
Ability to work well autonomously and within a team in a fast-paced and deadline-oriented environment.
Ability to work with and influence peers and senior management
Self-motivated with critical attention to detail, deadlines and reporting




Matthews International endeavors to make our employment website and application process accessible to all users and applicants. In doing so, Matthews International provides reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. If you have a disability and require a reasonable accommodation or assistance completing the application process, please contact a member of our Human Resource Team.




At Matthews International, what makes us different is what makes us great. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

Title: Data Analyst M/F
Description:
LittleBigCode is a digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by co-building useful applications with our customers for the Society of the future, particularly on subjects related to health, mobility or the environment. For this, we deliver turnkey projects and also work on consulting assignments while developing our own solutions. Finally, we combine Cloud technologies, AGILE methods and DevOps culture to facilitate industrialization and scaling up.




Our big success so far:

A community of more than 50 enthusiasts of Data Science & Data Engineering domains
International presence & missions – we are launching our new office in Belgium!
Workshops, Innovation contests, customers challenges taken up




As such, we are looking to build our technical team in Belgium ! Join us !




What will be your tasks with us ?




You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data and analysis. You will be working in the following areas:

Business case study with business teams, understanding of business requirements
Design of Data solutions
Analysis of customer data and processes in order to study their valuation
Elaboration of Data Analysis solutions
Support Data Scientists & Data Engineers on deployment of AI applications
Creation of dashboards & visualization solutions in order to bring business teams valuable & dynamic insights
Support your customers in the use of the applications you developed
Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations




Who are you ?




You have a Master in Engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics…) and you have some experiences as a Data Analyst
You have bases in the realization of dashboards/reporting, the development of Data solutions models and applications starting from-scratch
You are comfortable working with both technical & business stakeholders, thanks to your nice communication skills!
You are fully proficient in Python, SQL and DataViz tools
You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)
Note that we are also big devotees of DevOps so the more you are comfortable with it, all the better!
Fluent in English + in Dutch and/or French

Title: Clinical Data Analyst
Description:
AIXIAL is an International Contract Research Organization (CRO), a member of the ALTEN Group, providing complex services in clinical trials (phase I-IV) and non-interventional studies. Our offices are located in France, Belgium, Switzerland, Germany and Czech Republic.




We are currently looking for a Clinical Data Analyst.




Your responsabilities will include (but are not limited to):

Contribute to the development of visualization and reporting to support the clinical trial activities (medical safety review, analytical risk-based monitoring, data review, etc)
Creating reports using the clinical data and partnerign with Clinical Teams and stakeholders
Participate in the optimization of user management, content management, performance management and lifecycle management related to reporting and metrics
Takes a leadership role with development and delivery of reports, templates and metrics and related activities




Desirable Work Experience, Qualifications and Knowledge:




Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Science or Computer Science
Minimum 5 years of experience as a Business/Data Analyst working within Data Warehouse platforms and BI tools in a regulated industry within a clinical trial environment
Strong knowledge of Python, R, SAS and similar scripting languages is preferred
Knowledge of SDTM data structure
SQL knowledge
Knowledge of Tibco Spotfire (preferred) or similar BI software tool (Tableau, QlikView, Microsoft Power BI,..)
Experience in pharmaceutical & life sciences industry is preferred
Good planning, organizational and project management skills.
Ability to prioritize multiple projects simultaneously.
Good communication skills




Langage skills:

Strong level in English would be required
Show more Show less
HTML:
AIXIAL is an International Contract Research Organization (CRO), a member of the ALTEN Group, providing complex services in clinical trials (phase I-IV) and non-interventional studies. Our offices are located in France, Belgium, Switzerland, Germany and Czech Republic.


We are currently looking for a Clinical Data Analyst.


Your responsabilities will include (but are not limited to):

  • Contribute to the development of visualization and reporting to support the clinical trial activities (medical safety review, analytical risk-based monitoring, data review, etc)
  • Creating reports using the clinical data and partnerign with Clinical Teams and stakeholders
  • Participate in the optimization of user management, content management, performance management and lifecycle management related to reporting and metrics
  • Takes a leadership role with development and delivery of reports, templates and metrics and related activities


Desirable Work Experience, Qualifications and Knowledge:


  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Science or Computer Science
  • Minimum 5 years of experience as a Business/Data Analyst working within Data Warehouse platforms and BI tools in a regulated industry within a clinical trial environment
  • Strong knowledge of Python, R, SAS and similar scripting languages is preferred
  • Knowledge of SDTM data structure
  • SQL knowledge
  • Knowledge of Tibco Spotfire (preferred) or similar BI software tool (Tableau, QlikView, Microsoft Power BI,..)
  • Experience in pharmaceutical & life sciences industry is preferred
  • Good planning, organizational and project management skills.
  • Ability to prioritize multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Good communication skills


Langage skills:

  • Strong level in English would be required

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Als Data Analyst bij Ordina help je onze klanten bij het oplossen van complexe data-vraagstukken. Je verzamelt gegevens van verschillende bronnen, optimaliseert datasets voor visualisatie en ontwikkelt inzichtelijke en gebruiksvriendelijke dashboards. Jij bent de brug tussen business en IT.

In je takenpakket zit onder anderen het verlenen van diensten op het gebied van data-analyse en process mining om klanten te helpen bedrijfsproblemen op te lossen, waarde te creëren en strategie en inzicht te verkrijgen uit gegevens. Je geeft mee vorm aan oplossingen die de klanten helpen om data gedreven beslissingen te nemen en zakelijke uitdagingen te helpen oplossen. Zo draag je ertoe bij dat onze klanten klaar zijn voor de uitdagingen van de toekomst en dus ‘ahead of change zijn’. Met behulp van je eigen expertise en de Ordina design-thinking methodologie verhoog je de kwaliteit van de analyses en visualisaties bij onze klanten. Daarnaast draagt je input bij aan de visie en ontwikkeling van onze unit.

Wie we zoeken


Je bent gepassioneerd door data, data storytelling en business processen
Analyseren en oplossingen bedenken in co-creatie met business stakeholders, zijn je absolute sterktes
Je hebt een grondige kennis van SQL en minimum één visualisatie tool zoals Power BI, Tableau of Qlik Sense; je kan dit aantonen aan de hand van je portfolio of door certificatie
Kennis van python en web technologie (D3.js, React, etc.) is een pluspunt
Je hebt een probleemoplossend vermogen
Samen met je collega’s successen boeken motiveert je
Een flexibele, zelfstandige en collegiale instelling is wat we zoeken
Goede communicatieve vaardigheden, klantgerichtheid en nauwkeurigheid zijn ook een must
Je past je makkelijk aan wanneer een situatie wijzigt en blijft gefocust op het beste resultaat behalen


Wat we bieden


Je bent een sleutelfiguur in projecten bij Belgische topbedrijven
Je werkt in een hightech omgeving met de focus op kennis en innovatie
Je kennis blijft up-to-date dankzij workshops, conferenties, trainingen en je wordt voortdurend door je collega’s
Een gezonde balans tussen werk en privéleven
Je kan mee richting geven aan je carrière en blijven groeien
Je collega’s zijn down to earth en hebben een no-nonsense houding, er is ruimte voor eigen initiatief
Je kan deelnemen aan leuke business- en teambuildingsactiviteiten
Je geniet van voordelen zoals een bedrijfswagen, laptop, gsm-vergoeding, maaltijdcheques, verzekering etc.
Je kan je netto salaris optimaliseren dankzij onze IP-reward
Je kan de volgende DataViz-Wizard worden in ons team. Wie wil er nu geen wizard zijn?
Dit jaar gaan we de kaap van 40 wizards doorbreken, ben jij nummer 40? Dan win je een mooie prijs!


Iedereen is welkom om te solliciteren. Want we geloven in de kracht van diversiteit en hechten veel waarde aan inclusie. De beste ideeën en slimste oplossingen ontstaan immers in diverse teams. Precies daarom besteden we zoveel aandacht aan de samenstelling van onze high performance teams. Zodat jij je op je plek voelt en het beste uit jezelf kan halen.

Title: Digital data analyst
Description:
Job Description

Your role

You work together with product owners, scrum masters and business stakeholders and ensure that they can make data-driven decisions. You translate their business objectives into measurable KPIs both in the context of projects and for daily activities.
You make data transparent for your stakeholders to support their strategic decisions. You collect, analyse and visualise data within a digital omnichannel context.
You create and automate digital reporting and manage the quality of the data and reports (within the predefined data management architecture, in close consultation with IT & business intelligence teams). You ensure continuous improvement of both the methodology and the dashboards and data themselves with a view to refining insights.
The digital analytics expert trains, supports and advises business stakeholders on the preparation of simple digital analytics reports, the formulation of business requirements and the interpretation of digital analytics reports. You are always on the lookout for improvements and make recommendations in this respect.
You work closely with various internal teams to provide a coherent picture of the digital 'end-to-end' customer experience and the digital path the customer follows. You proactively monitor data to identify pain points and suggest improvements. You enable business stakeholders to analyse digital customer behaviour across all digital touchpoints.
You aggregate and organise data from different sources (Adobe Analytics, search, advertising, CRM, etc.).

Your profile

You have several years of experience in digital (customer) data analysis.
You have knowledge/experience of digital marketing, e-commerce and e-care, including web analytics, social media and conversion marketing.
You have experience with the use of analytical tools (preferably Adobe Analytics).
Knowledge of tag management, Adobe Experience Manager and Adobe Audience Manager is a strong asset.
You are fluent in PowerPoint and Excel and have a basic knowledge of web technologies.
You have good analytical skills. You are a critical thinker and a good problem solver.
You are a real team player who can work well with colleagues from different teams, both from a business and a more technical background.
You have strong communication and presentation skills. You love to make data transparent for business and enjoy taking on less experienced colleagues.
You are willing to further develop skills in a team-oriented, fast-changing environment.

How we make a difference for you!

Start a new adventure in the beating heart of our data-driven organisation, where we work extremely flexibly, whether from home or from our open and trendy collaborative office spaces, and collegiality is more than just a word. We keep an eye out for talent, ambition and eagerness to learn. We coach you, train you and make you part of our story. What's more, you'll enjoy a salary and benefits package that will make you a winner. We're talking meal vouchers, group and health insurance, an annual bonus and discounts on Telenet products. Come and experience it for yourself, our passion is contagious.

Title: Data-analist
Company: if-ic (Instituut Functieclassificatie - Institut de Classification de fonctions)
HTML:
Wie zijn wij?

IFIC (Instituut voor Functieclassificatie) is een paritaire beheerde organisatie die moderne en innovatieve functieclassificaties en loonmodellen ontwikkelt voor de non-profitsectoren - voornamelijk voor de gezondheidszorg. Ons enthousiaste team bestaat uit consultants, economen/data-analisten evenals de staff en directie.


Dataverwerker

Gecontroleerde en kwaliteitsvolle gegevens vormen de noodzakelijke basis voor onderbouwde analyses en betrouwbare kostenramingen. Als dataverwerker sta je voornamelijk in voor de kwaliteitscontrole, volledigheid en coherentie van gegevens aangeleverd door de instellingen van de non-profitsector in het kader van loonstudies of financieringsrapporten die de impact van de uitwerking van een nieuwe sectorale functieclassificatie moeten evalueren.


Meer bepaald help je de instellingen bij het invullen van het Exceldocument voor de rapportering van loongegevens/financieringen, volgens duidelijke instructies door te antwoorden op hun vragen. Je bent ook verantwoordelijk voor de kwaliteitscontrole van de gerapporteerde gegevens en je contacteert organisaties om bijkomende informatie te bekomen wanneer dit noodzakelijk is. Je rapporteert regelmatig de stand van zaken aan het team van data-analisten.


Profiel

  • Je bent georganiseerd, nauwkeurig en beschikt over een kritische geest;
  • Je kan vlot omgaan met Excel;
  • Je kan zowel mondeling als schriftelijk vlot communiceren;
  • Je hebt geen schrik om vragen te stellen;
  • Je bent Nederlands- of Franstalig, met een goede kennis van de andere taal;
  • Je bent stressbestendig;
  • Kennis van loongegevens is een bijkomende troef.


Meer info?

Aarzel niet om onze website te raadplegen en ons aanbod te ontdekken https://www.if-ic.org/nl/dataverwerker/aanbod of een belletje naar 02 540 80 58

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DE JOB

Meten is weten! Digitalisatie vormt één van de hefbomen van het strategisch plan van Infrabel en dankzij onze geleidelijke digitalisatie hebben we vandaag al veel gegevens. Als Data Analyst help je onze organisatie deze data te vertalen naar waardevolle inzichten, bijvoorbeeld met krachtige visualisaties in een PowerBI dashboard.

Je speelt als Data Analyst een sleutelrol in het team van Asset & Business Performance waarin je:

geen schrik hebt data uit verschillende bronnen (SAP PM, excel, csv, xml, sql) te analyseren naar aanleiding van bepaalde problemen.
nauw samenwerkt en in interactie gaat met heel wat verschillende gesprekspartners binnen Infrabel om waardevolle data te identificeren en zo de juiste indicatoren naar voor te schuiven.
verschillende databronnen verwerkt en vertaalt naar krachtige visualisaties in PowerBI.
de kosten visualiseert en de rationaliseringsmogelijkheden in verschillende afdelingen analyseert.
mee nadenkt over wat je uit de gegevens kunt leren en hieruit verbetervoorstellen formuleert.
een onderscheid maakt tussen wat relevant is voor de organisatie.
Initiatieven neemt om de gegevenskwaliteit te verbeteren in samenwerking met de eigenaars van de data.
af en toe op het veld gaat om betrokken zijn bij het verzamelen van de data.

JOUW PROFIEL

Je hebt een masterdiploma (ingenieur, wiskunde, IT, statistiek…) dat relevant is voor de functie.
Of een bachelor in ICT met relevante werkervaring in de sector.
Je weet businessvraagstukken te vertalen naar een data-analyse en bijhorende rapportering.
Je hebt een uitgesproken interesse in IT/ICT, waaronder een basiskennis in programmatie (SQL).
Je beschikt reeds over ervaring met tools voor datavisualisatie zoals Qlikview, Tableau of PowerBI.
Kennis van of interesse in SAP PM is een pluspunt.
Je spreekt en schrijft vloeiend Frans of Nederlands en durft je uitdrukken in de tweede landstaal.
Je hebt uitstekende relationele en communicatieve vaardigheden.
Je beschikt over een analytische geest en oog voor detail.
Je kan makkelijke de silo’s doorbreken en timmert dagelijks aan een transversale samenwerking.
Je bent een echte ambassadeur voor de “Future Operations” afdeling en je kan mensen meenemen.
Je bent een leider op jouw gebied en toont empathie in jouw omgang met anderen.
Je werkt graag in teamverband.
Je kan je aanpassen aan verschillende situaties en ziet verandering als een kans.

Infrabel wil de maatschappelijke diversiteit weerspiegeld zien in haar medewerkers. Jouw talenten en enthousiasme, daar draait het om, niet om je geslacht, leeftijd, origine of beperking.

ONS AANBOD

Een boeiende en afwisselende job
Bij een stabiel bedrijf dat bijdraagt aan een duurzame mobiliteit voor de samenleving
Talrijke opleidings- en doorgroeimogelijkheden: jij bent ondernemer van je eigen carrière
Veel flexibiliteit, zodat je zelf de balans tussen werk en privé kan bepalen
Een aantrekkelijk loonpakket met verschillende aanvullende voordelen
Gratis reizen met de trein

DE WERKOMGEVING

Infrabel bouwt, onderhoudt en vernieuwt de spoorweginfrastructuur in België. Met zo’n 10.000 medewerkers werken we aan een betrouwbaar en modern spoorwegnet: om de mobiliteitsbehoeften van onze samenleving mee te ontwikkelen en bij te dragen aan een duurzame samenleving.

De doelstellingen van de afdeling “Future Operations” zijn de volgende :

De organisatie voorzien van statistieken en analyse-instrumenten om de doeltreffendheid en de efficiëntie te controleren en deze waar nodig te analyseren en aan te passen.

Wij willen de gegevensverwerking zoveel mogelijk automatiseren.

WELKE STAPPEN DOORLOOP JE?

Solliciteer online > cv-screening > Wij nemen contact met je op > Selectiegesprek > Welkom bij Infrabel!

Heb je een beperking en kunnen redelijke aanpassingen je een vlotte sollicitatie ervaring garanderen? Laat het ons dan weten.

VRAGEN OVER DEZE VACATURE?

Ludovic Myttenaere | Talent Acquisition Specialist | Tel: +32 2 432 57 89| E-mail: ludovic.myttenaere@infrabel.be

Vergeet niet een profiel aan te maken via “Mijn Profiel”. Je kan er niet alleen je gegevens aanvullen, maar ook “job alerts” aanmaken volgens jouw interesses. Zo krijg je de nieuwe jobs die bij jou passen als eerste in je mailbox.

Title: Real time data analyst with Customer at heart
Description:
About The Role




Do you love finding the missing pieces of the puzzle in a swimming pool full of data!




Do you want to use your drive to make the life of customer better, easier and happier?




You are truly passionate about making things better for our customers. You like to use your creativity and data expertise to find friction points and solve them with data. You are curious and explore how real time data can bring us new insights to make the employee or customer experience better.




You like to translate Business requirements and answer business use cases with real time data insights. You enjoy working with different people in different areas of the company to achieve (Customer) success together.




You are truly getting excited about using data to speak for the customers and help the organisation to make the right decisions in a real time fashion!




What to expect




You will work in the awesome Voice of the Customer team with creative and talented individuals from all parts of the world. Your team is spread out over multiple locations and the stakeholders you work with are global, allowing you the opportunity to truly work in an international environment.




The team itself has the unique position of being able to bring the customer’s voice towards the organization by using the customer and the data speak for itself. This consists of using data from direct feedback (what the customer tells us) and to combine this with indirect (what they say about us) and inferred (what the systems show us). Especially on the inferred part you will be active in looking at real-time data from our customers!




In this role you will be able to:




Shine bright like a diamond, by showing how data can speak for itself (if brought together in the right way)
Define data analysis use cases together with stakeholders within the whole organisation
Prepare data insights to be used and linked to the customer journey insights
Link real time data to the digital experience of the customer and the self service experience to drive actions to improve
Drive consumption of the operational and real time data
be an ambassador for our Customers and Customer Experience and have an eye on how to reduce frictions
Be your full self in an environment which promotes diversity and inclusion.
Explore new innovations and evolutions, stay aware of business trends and developments in the Customer autonomy space and see how they can contribute to our ambitions.
Launch yourself into training to further expand your skillset
// WORK/Train business analysts/champions/users
Learn the underlying flows and data structures that support SWIFT’s and customer’s business.





What will make you successful?




We are seeking professionals with extensive experience in the following:




Min. 3 of experience as a data engineer or data analyst
University degree or equivalent


Able to listen to stakeholders to concisely capture and document business requirements and use cases
Knowledge of:
SQL, Hadoop, Kafka
Data visualisation tools: Kibana, Tableau
Programming language Python, R
Understanding of data structures, data bases
Knowledge of SWIFT main message flows and related data structures is a big plus (support, prof services, platform & operations…)
OASIS knowledge is a plus
Data science skills are a nice to have


Soft skills:

Collaborative mindset on achieving results that matter for our customers
High drive to make things better for our employees and customers
Innovative and creative mindset
Strong English communication and networking skills (both written and oral)
Planning and organising (leading a project to a successful end)
Take accountability for delivering results
Adaptability and responsiveness to change
Passionate about data analysis, data engineering and science.
Excellent analytics skills on large data sets and have the ability to synthesis into key findings
Learning!!


About SWIFT

SWIFT is constantly evolving and innovating. Working at the intersection of finance and technology is a very exciting place to be right now.

SWIFT is transforming cross-border payments, making them faster and more transparent than ever before. We are the way the world moves value — every instant of every day, in almost every country.

We are proud that what we do has a critical impact on the global financial community and touches almost every aspect of the financial world. So, what you do at SWIFT has real impact too — an impact that matters every day. Which is why you matter to us.

Joining SWIFT gives you unparalleled exposure to knowledge, expertise and technologies. If you have what it takes, you’ll be able to take on different career paths and have the opportunity to work in teams, departments and disciplines in countries around the world.

SWIFT is unique. There is no other organisation like ours in the world driving the long-term future of the financial ecosystem. You’ll be surrounded by bright, customer-focused and intellectually curious people in a collaborative, friendly, open and inclusive environment.

At SWIFT we are trusted every instant. Everything we do has an impact that matters. And as a member of our team, you are trusted to make your impact every day.

What We Offer

We put you in control of career
We give you a competitive package
We help you perform at your best
We help you make a difference
We give you the freedom to be yourself

We give you the freedom to be yourself. We are creating an environment of unique individuals – like you – with different perspectives on the financial industry and the world. An environment in which everyone’s voice counts and where you can reach your full potential regardless of age, background, culture, colour, disability, gender, nationality, race, religion, sexual orientation, or veteran/military status.
Show more Show less
HTML:
About The Role


Do you love finding the missing pieces of the puzzle in a swimming pool full of data!


Do you want to use your drive to make the life of customer better, easier and happier?


You are truly passionate about making things better for our customers. You like to use your creativity and data expertise to find friction points and solve them with data. You are curious and explore how real time data can bring us new insights to make the employee or customer experience better.


You like to translate Business requirements and answer business use cases with real time data insights. You enjoy working with different people in different areas of the company to achieve (Customer) success together.


You are truly getting excited about using data to speak for the customers and help the organisation to make the right decisions in a real time fashion!


What to expect


You will work in the awesome Voice of the Customer team with creative and talented individuals from all parts of the world. Your team is spread out over multiple locations and the stakeholders you work with are global, allowing you the opportunity to truly work in an international environment.


The team itself has the unique position of being able to bring the customer’s voice towards the organization by using the customer and the data speak for itself. This consists of using data from direct feedback (what the customer tells us) and to combine this with indirect (what they say about us) and inferred (what the systems show us). Especially on the inferred part you will be active in looking at real-time data from our customers!


In this role you will be able to:


  • Shine bright like a diamond, by showing how data can speak for itself (if brought together in the right way)
  • Define data analysis use cases together with stakeholders within the whole organisation
  • Prepare data insights to be used and linked to the customer journey insights
  • Link real time data to the digital experience of the customer and the self service experience to drive actions to improve
  • Drive consumption of the operational and real time data
  • be an ambassador for our Customers and Customer Experience and have an eye on how to reduce frictions
  • Be your full self in an environment which promotes diversity and inclusion.
  • Explore new innovations and evolutions, stay aware of business trends and developments in the Customer autonomy space and see how they can contribute to our ambitions.
  • Launch yourself into training to further expand your skillset
  • // WORK/Train business analysts/champions/users
  • Learn the underlying flows and data structures that support SWIFT’s and customer’s business.


What will make you successful?


We are seeking professionals with extensive experience in the following:


  • Min. 3 of experience as a data engineer or data analyst
  • University degree or equivalent

  • Able to listen to stakeholders to concisely capture and document business requirements and use cases
  • Knowledge of:
    • SQL, Hadoop, Kafka
    • Data visualisation tools: Kibana, Tableau
    • Programming language Python, R
    • Understanding of data structures, data bases
    • Knowledge of SWIFT main message flows and related data structures is a big plus (support, prof services, platform & operations…)
    • OASIS knowledge is a plus
    • Data science skills are a nice to have

    Soft skills:
    • Collaborative mindset on achieving results that matter for our customers
    • High drive to make things better for our employees and customers
    • Innovative and creative mindset
    • Strong English communication and networking skills (both written and oral)
    • Planning and organising (leading a project to a successful end)
    • Take accountability for delivering results
    • Adaptability and responsiveness to change
    • Passionate about data analysis, data engineering and science.
    • Excellent analytics skills on large data sets and have the ability to synthesis into key findings
    • Learning!!

    About SWIFT

    SWIFT is constantly evolving and innovating. Working at the intersection of finance and technology is a very exciting place to be right now.

    SWIFT is transforming cross-border payments, making them faster and more transparent than ever before. We are the way the world moves value — every instant of every day, in almost every country.

    We are proud that what we do has a critical impact on the global financial community and touches almost every aspect of the financial world. So, what you do at SWIFT has real impact too — an impact that matters every day. Which is why you matter to us.

    Joining SWIFT gives you unparalleled exposure to knowledge, expertise and technologies. If you have what it takes, you’ll be able to take on different career paths and have the opportunity to work in teams, departments and disciplines in countries around the world.

    SWIFT is unique. There is no other organisation like ours in the world driving the long-term future of the financial ecosystem. You’ll be surrounded by bright, customer-focused and intellectually curious people in a collaborative, friendly, open and inclusive environment.

    At SWIFT we are trusted every instant. Everything we do has an impact that matters. And as a member of our team, you are trusted to make your impact every day.

    What We Offer

    We put you in control of career
    We give you a competitive package
    We help you perform at your best
    We help you make a difference
    We give you the freedom to be yourself

    We give you the freedom to be yourself. We are creating an environment of unique individuals – like you – with different perspectives on the financial industry and the world. An environment in which everyone’s voice counts and where you can reach your full potential regardless of age, background, culture, colour, disability, gender, nationality, race, religion, sexual orientation, or veteran/military status.

Title: Freelancer Data Analyst - Adobe Launch/Analytics
Description:
ABOUT US

We are a fast-growing, close-knit, dynamic, and successful Digital Services Company that specializes in providing support to large multinational companies for SEO, Product & Web Content Management, Social Media Management, Performance Marketing, E-Commerce Management, CRM & E-Mail Marketing Automation, DX & Development, Data Management & Analytics, Project Management, Digital Consultancy, and Recruitment.







As a multinational Dutch company, we have offices in Amsterdam, Istanbul, Lisbon, Kuala Lumpur & Portland. With our exceptionally talented & diverse team, and our A+ client portfolio, the world is our oyster!







We are currently looking for a Freelancer Data Analyst with Tagging experience to join our team.







RESPONSIBILITIES

Building 1st and 3rd party analytic solutions
Diving into the code to investigate possible issues and fixing them where necessary
Responding to tagging & analytics related queries from business and the team
Understands data and translate them into meaningful presentations with actionable insights
Conduct detailed data analysis on data used across business units to evaluate business processes and improve on/create new features from tagging perspective.
Always in close contact with the customers to understand their needs and manage their expectations.
Assist with the development of various data processes when assigned
Provide data solutions, tools, and capabilities around web tagging.










QUALIFICATIONS

Experience in configuring Adobe Analytics, and Adobe Launch (report suites, processing rules, traffic and conversion variables, classification builder, rules, data elements, extensions, digital Data Array Structure, App Measurement, etc.)
Excellent written and oral communication skills in English (additional languages is a plus) with a commitment to precision and detail
Proven experience in building JavaScript & JQuery solutions and troubleshooting
Good understanding of cross-domain tracking.
Good understanding of business needs and their translation to data requirements.
Experience with digital marketing tagging and technologies (Floodlight, Google Ads, Facebook, LinkedIn, Affiliate Partners, etc.)
Experience with Adobe Mbox configuration.







WHAT WE OFFER

Remote working**
Free company subscription to the Wellbeing & Meditation App ‘’Insight Timer’’
Free company subscription to Mental Health & Support partner ‘’OpenUp’’
No Dress Code – Dress to impress!
NMQ Referral Program – Friends2Work - encourages our employees to refer their friends followed by a cash award once they are hired
Access to numerous online courses and training in our own in-house training platform NMQ Academy
Access to our exclusive Mentorship Program provided by our brilliant Senior peers
Being part of our fun, diverse, and dynamic team
The chance to expand your career horizon. To learn more about future possibilities, check out our website https://www.nmqdigital.com/
Last but not least, the experience of working with world-class talents as one being yourself to be a part of a global success story!










*Within the COVID-19 precautions, we work remotely and all of our hiring processes are carried out virtually.







NMQ Digital is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.







Don't be discouraged if you feel that you don’t fully meet every single one of the requirements for a particular role, there is always room for growth in NMQ!

Title: Junior Data Analist - Regio Mechelen
Description:
Beschrijving onderneming




Geïnteresseerd in onderstaande vacature? Laat je gegevens achter of benader me rechtstreeks via i.rottier@madison.be of +32 498 76 11 66.




Voor onze klant, een wereldwijde leverancier van professionele informatie en softwareoplossingen, zijn we momenteel op zoek naar een Data Analist die hun team te Mechelen kan versterken.




Takenpakket:




Je begeleidt collega’s van alle afdelingen met relevante en impactvolle datagedreven inzichten en acties.
Je zorgt ervoor dat de organisatie meer datagedreven wordt, in nauwe samenwerking met de business.
Je biedt relevante datagedreven inzichten obv data analyses, gebruikmakende van visualisatie tools zoals Tableau en Qlik.
Je begrijpt wat de business nodig heeft en weet dit te vertalen naar acties die zij nodig hebben om hun doelen te bereiken.
Je denkt mee na over de juiste oplossingen in functie van de behoeften en noden van verscheidene departementen zoals marketing, sales, content & product development,...




Profiel:




Je behaalde een Bachelor of Master in een economische of IT gerelateerde richting.
Een eerste ervaring is mooi meegenomen, maar geen must.
Kennis van Tableau of Qlik is een plus.
Je bent analytisch en communicatief ingesteld.
Uitstekende kennis van Nederlands en Engels is vereist. Kennis van Frans is een plus.




Aanbod:

Bovenop een (meer dan) competitief salaris kan je ook een uitgebreid pakket aan extralegale voordelen verwachten. Denk hierbij aan:




Maaltijdcheques
Groeps- en hospitalisatieverzekering
Ecocheques
Benefits for work (korting bij verschillende bedrijven)
Een uitgetekend groeiplan met verschillende opleidingen
Thuiswerk
36 vakantiedagen

Title: Internship in Data Analytics
Description:
Line of Service

Assurance

Industry/Sector

Technology

Specialism

Assurance

Management Level

Intern/Trainee

Job Description & Summary

We guide. We support. You grow.

Want to help build trust in society? As a part of PwC Assurance, you’ll provide decision makers with the information they need to achieve better governance, transparency and accountability. Join our multidisciplinary team that uses cutting-edge technologies to make a difference for our clients and our communities, both at home and across the globe.

Fascinated by numbers the tech side of business? Want to work on various missions and turn business data into meaningful intelligence? Data’s a key source of value creation, yet companies are struggling to use it to impact their projects and their business. The fast-paced audit environment’s no exception, so PwC’s Data Analytics team is helping auditors use data in meaningful ways.

We’re looking for a talented Intern to join our Data Analytics team supporting the Assurance department as part of our Financial Audit team.

What you’ll learn and do

As an intern, you’ll be involved in a wide variety of tasks:


Analyse and transform source files
Automate manual processes to improve efficiency
Link and visualise datasets into dashboards
Support clients in analysis of key business drivers
Play with tools like Alteryx, PowerBI and Tableau
Basic coding in R and Python
Explore new solutions and ideas for advanced analysis


Who you are


Specialisation or an interest in data analytics/data science
Interest in deep business understanding
Knowledge in at least one of the following software platforms: Tableau, Spotfire, Alteryx, R, Python, Power BI
Team player with a sense of initiative and a critical, analytical mind
Communicative, eager to learn and you are looking to develop and grow
Fluent in Dutch and/or French and English
Your school can provide a certificate confirming that this internship is a substantial part of your education


What we offer


Reimbursement of transportation costs and daily food allowance
Continuous learning
Huge growth potential
Full support and guidance of a team of Data Analytics professionals
Valuable professional experience in the ‘best business school in the world’
The opportunity to start a career with PwC
And much more!


Looking for an internship where you’ll really make a difference? Then we look forward to meeting you!

Degrees/Field of Study preferred:

Required Skills

Optional Skills

Desired Languages (If blank, desired languages not specified)

Travel Requirements

Not Specified

Available for Work Visa Sponsorship?

No

Government Clearance Required?

No

Job Posting End Date

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
Job Title - Insights Analyst
Reports Into - Insights Manager
Location - Remote/Anywhere




A Little Bit About Kwalee….

Kwalee is one of the world’s leading multiplatform game developers and publishers, with well over 900 million downloads worldwide for mobile hits such as Draw It, Teacher Simulator, Let’s Be Cops 3D, Airport Security, and Makeover Studio 3D. We also have a growing PC and Console team of incredible pedigree that is on the hunt for great new titles to join TENS!, Eternal Hope, Die by the Blade, and Scathe.




What’s In It For You?

We want everyone involved in our games to share our success, that’s why we have a generous team profit-sharing scheme from day 1 of employment
Creative Wednesdays! (Pitch and make your own games every Wednesday)
Great work-life balance with flexible working hours
Quarterly team building days - work hard, play hard!
Monthly employee awards




Are You Up To The Challenge?

As an Insights Researcher, you’ll be planning and carrying out player research to help guide our games.




Your Team Mates

The Casual Games team is a global crew whose passion for our products drive us to craft first-class gaming experiences the best we can. This goes double for gameplay, aesthetics, and marketing. We're entrepreneurial in spirit and have a collaborative mindset, so your voice is always heard.




What Does The Job Actually Involve?

Plan and conduct market and user research activities for stakeholders across the company.
Manage relationships with key products stakeholders, creating a research roadmap to run alongside product development
Plan and suggest research to support product development, all the way through the product lifecycle, from idea to hard launch and beyond
Identify research opportunities that will impact player understanding, product design, and quality
Use a variety of quantitative and qualitative research methodologies to answer the questions proposed by stakeholders
Collaborate with cross-functional teams such as Digital Marketing to support broader analytics and insights work that drive business impact




Your Hard Skills

3+ years of relevant job experience working in areas of consumer research
Experience in the interactive entertainment industry (e.g., video/mobile gaming, video/entertainment platforms)
Excellent knowledge of quantitative and qualitative research methods
Excellent survey writing skills
Experience in data manipulation and statistical software (e.g., SPSS, R/Python or any other)
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau
Degree in psychology, HCI, social sciences, or a related field
Effective written, storytelling, verbal, and presentation skills;
Fluent in English
A passion for gaming




Your Soft Skills

Kwalee has grown fast in recent years but we’re very much a family of colleagues. We welcome people of all ages, races, colors, beliefs, sexual orientations, genders, and circumstances, and all we ask is that you collaborate, work hard, ask questions and have fun with your team and colleagues.




We don’t like egos or arrogance and we love playing games and celebrating success together. If that sounds like you, then please apply.




A Little More About Kwalee

Founded in 2011 by David Darling CBE, a key architect of the UK games industry who previously co-founded and led Codemasters, our team also includes legends such as Andrew Graham (creator of Micro Machines series) and Jason Falcus (programmer of classics including NBA Jam) alongside a growing and diverse team of global gaming experts.

Everyone contributes creatively to Kwalee’s success, with all employees eligible to pitch their own game ideas on Creative Wednesdays, and we’re proud to have built our success on this inclusive principle.




We have an amazing team of experts collaborating daily between our studios in Leamington Spa, Lisbon, Bangalore, and Beijing, or on a remote basis from Turkey, Brazil, Cyprus, the Philippines, and many more places around the world. We’ve recently acquired our first external studio, TicTales, which is based in France.

We have a truly global team making games for a global audience, and it’s paying off: - Kwalee has been voted the Best Large Studio and Best Leadership Team at the TIGA Awards (Independent Game Developers’ Association) and our games have been downloaded in every country on earth - including Antarctica!

Show more Show less

Title: Data & Analytics Analyst Engineer (M/X/V)
Description:
Back




Geef je carrière vleugels!




Als luchthavenbeheerder zit Brussels Airport Company aan de stuurknuppel van de grootste luchthaven in België, in het hart van Europa: Brussels Airport.




Het voorbije jaar kende de vlucht van Brussels Airport flink wat turbulentie, maar nu zitten we weer op koers. Wij geloven in een mooie, duurzame toekomst voor onze luchthaven en hebben de ambitie om van Brussels Airport de beste luchthaven in Europa te maken. Zin om aan boord te komen en de luchthaven van morgen mee vorm te geven?




Jouw bestemming?




Om ons departement Digital & Experience te versterken, zijn we voor het Digital & Data Analytics departement op zoek naar een Analytics Translator (M/V/X).




Voel je je comfortabel bij het uitvoeren van demand voor alsmaar meer vooruitstrevende businesses? Ben jij een natuurlijke koortdanser op het snijvlak van business en data? Ben jij in staat om ideeën van business om te zetten in een data en AI-strategie en deze vervolgens ook uit te voeren? Word jij enthousiast van het starten van een nieuw dataproject in samenwerking met het data science en engineering team? Ben je gepassioneerd om producten in productie te brengen en inzichten te creëren in data? Dan willen wij jou!




Als Analytics Translator (AT) is het jouw taak om de "So what?" kwestie van AI en data uit te klaren. Om dit te doen, spreekt een AT meerdere talen: business, data en tech. Afstemming van deze drie elementen is vereist om ervoor te zorgen dat dataprojecten echte, tijdige en mensgerichte voordelen opleveren. Ben jij er klaar voor om dit te realiseren?




Jouw vluchtinstructies




Wat is jouw impact? Als Analytics Translator bij Brussels Airport adviseer je onze business en onze community stakeholders over hoe dataproducten waarde toevoegen aan hun organisatie en help je hen bij het ontwikkelen van deze dataproducten. Dit betekent dat je datastrategieën uitwerkt, use cases onderzoekt met belanghebbenden, experimenten ontwerpt en uitvoert om de waarde van een model te bewijzen, de verantwoordelijke kant van data en AI beoordeelt en implementeert alsook complexe dataproducten levert samen met onze squads van dataengineers en data scientists . Analytics Translators doen hun werk door verschillende rollen in projecten te vervullen, zoals strategisch data-adviseur, data-project / productmanager, data-ethicus en data-evangelist.




Jouw paspoort
Minstens 3 jaar ervaring in digital- of dataconsultancy met een duidelijke aanpak van data-driven projecten.
Masters diploma in business en/of tech
Teamplayer met sterke communicatie- en storytellingskills
Business-Savvy en een sterk stakeholder management
Je hebt ook sterke business en data-analyse skills
Je technische skills zijn:
Data wrangling
Basis SQL
Visualisatie skills (bij voorkeur kennis van Tableau)
Een sterk netwerk binnen de data community is een plus
Kennis over de luchtvaart- of transportsector is een meerwaarde
Je beheerst het Nederlands of het Frans. Je hebt een goede passieve kennis van de tweede landstaal en je spreekt vlot Engels

Onze service aan boord

Bij Brussels Airport werk je in een wereld op zich, vol nieuwe kansen en boeiende uitdagingen. Je komt terecht in een unieke en inspirerende omgeving, die jouw talenten vleugels geeft.

Bye bye files! Brussels Airport is vlot bereikbaar met trein, bus en fiets! Verder geloven we in een ‘hybrid way of working’ waarin we thuiswerk afwisselen met werken op kantoor en geniet je van flexibele werkuren. Zo vind jij moeiteloos de juiste balans tussen werk en privé.

De check-in

Zin gekregen om jezelf te overstijgen en met ons mee te reizen?

Stuur jouw CV en motivatiebrief via de daarvoor bestemde link. En wie weet, verwelkomen we je heel binnenkort wel aan boord!

Meer info?

Heb je toch nog vragen? Contacteer dan gerust Joachim De Rouck op joachim.de.rouck@brusselsairport.be
Show more Show less
HTML:
Back


Geef je carrière vleugels!


Als luchthavenbeheerder zit Brussels Airport Company aan de stuurknuppel van de grootste luchthaven in België, in het hart van Europa: Brussels Airport.


Het voorbije jaar kende de vlucht van Brussels Airport flink wat turbulentie, maar nu zitten we weer op koers. Wij geloven in een mooie, duurzame toekomst voor onze luchthaven en hebben de ambitie om van Brussels Airport de beste luchthaven in Europa te maken. Zin om aan boord te komen en de luchthaven van morgen mee vorm te geven?


Jouw bestemming?

Title: Data Analyst - Flanders Digital
Description:
Cegeka blijft groeien! Binnen onze software afdeling Applications hebben we een nieuwe divisie opgericht voor een boeiend langdurig project bij de Vlaamse Overheid. Heb jij zin om mee te bouwen aan een digitaal Vlaanderen en heb je een passie voor data gedreven oplossingen? Dan ben jij misschien onze nieuwe Data Analyst! Je kan meewerken aan projecten die impact hebben op verschillende aspecten in je dagelijkse leven.

Aan de hand van je analytisch inzicht help je mee aan de transformatie van ruwe data tot inzichtelijke informatie.
Je analyseert de noden van de klant en vormt de brug tussen business users en data engineers.
Je voorziet de klant van nieuwe inzichten door eenvoudig te begrijpen data visualisaties uit te werken.
Je doet aanbevelingen op basis van de inzichten die je ontdekt en ondersteunt hiermee de strategische besluitvorming
Je zorgt ervoor dat relevante data structureel wordt vastgelegd om verdere analyse en rapportage te vergemakkelijken


Wat breng jij mee?

Je bent gepassioneerd door data gedreven oplossingen.
Je hebt een sterke kennis van statistische methoden en machine learning algoritmes.
Je bent bekend met zowel traditionele data (DWH) & big data omgevingen (Hadoop, Spark, Cloud).
Je hebt een grondige kennis van SQL en visualisatietools zoals Power BI
Je hebt ervaring met data analyse en data visualisatie in Python.
Je beschikt over een probleemoplossend vermogen.
Een flexibele, zelfstandige en collegiale instelling is vereist.


Wat hebben wij jou te bieden?

Intensief teamwork in een open en dynamische sfeer waar nieuwe frisse ideeën en initiatieven opgestart kunnen worden.
Begeleiding van de Peoplemanager: Je wordt begeleid doorheen je professionele carrière door onze peoplemanagers. Op deze manier heb je een aanspreekpunt, een persoonlijke coach en een sparring partner omtrent je carrière en ontwikkeling.
Bijleren en kennisdeling staan centraal, we bieden hiervoor dan ook tal van initiatieven aan: innovation centers, leesgroepen, knowledge sharing meetings, hackatons, deelname aan conferenties en externe opleidingen.
Afhankelijk van je eigen interesses en initiatieven, biedt Cegeka verschillende horizontale en verticale carrièrepaden.
Naast het brutosalaris, een premium bedrijfswagen met tankkaart, maaltijdcheques, interessante groeps-en hospitalisatieverzekering, gsm-abonnement, forfaitaire onkostenvergoeding en krachtige laptop, bieden we flexibele werkuren en een mooie work/life balans. Stel zelf je verloningspakket samen dankzij ons Flex Reward Plan.
Afhankelijk van jouw woonplaats kan je werken in onze kantoren te Hasselt, Leuven, Gent of Antwerpen. Deel thuiswerk is ook mogelijk. Daarnaast is het mogelijk dat je tewerkgesteld gaat worden op locaties van onze klanten, afhankelijk van het project.

Title: Data Analyst
Company: Millennium Space Systems, A Boeing Company
Description:
Company Overview

Millennium Space Systems, A Boeing Company delivers affordable, high-performance space systems for exacting customers. At Millennium, you will be part of a close-knit team working on exciting technological problems. We work in an open environment where ideas are shared across all disciplines, and there are ample opportunities for advancement based on excellence. Superstars are welcome.

At Millennium, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity, and inclusion are core values. We're committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that's welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.

Job Summary

The Data Analyst will collect data, lead analyses, and develop strategies to drive efficiency at Millennium Space Systems. As a member of a small, agile team, they will have opportunities to contribute directly to projects that will help Millennium Space Systems achieve its long term manufacturing goals. Potential applications include identifying methods for measuring and monitoring core company metrics; analyzing data to optimize current manufacturing/supply processes; constructing and maintaining data pipelines from multiple systems; and utilizing historical manufacturing data to help generate forward forecasts.

This position’s internal job code is Business Intelligence Analyst. Our team is currently hiring for level range of 2-3.

Job Responsibilities

Collect, validate, and analyze data to support internal stakeholders and Millennium’s customers
Create and manage data workflows in order to increase data accessibility and streamline company reporting capabilities
Leverage data to support the development and continuous improvement of manufacturing processes
Develop Key Performance Indicators and report them periodically to stakeholders
Develop models of processes, and use those models to inform decision-making at Millennium
Build forecasts to aid Millennium in planning and executing our work


Minimum Qualifications

Two years of professional experience in analytical roles
Knowledge of Transact-SQL (and SQL Server)
Working knowledge of at least one programming language for data analysis, such as R, Python (including NumPy, pandas, and scikit-learn), or Julia
Familiarity with statistical methods, including time series forecasting and regression analysis
Experience interacting with and manipulating relational datasets
Experience leading at least one data-driven project with multiple stakeholders
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Detail oriented and highly organized
Self-starter and a team player


Preferred Qualifications

Five or more years of professional experience in analytical roles, including but not limited to Operations Research or Data Science; or Master’s Degree in Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Statistics or a related field
Experience working with API interfaces
Knowledge of multiple programming languages
Familiarity with optimization techniques and experience in formulating optimization problems
Experience working in an advanced manufacturing environment and/or government contracting


Please note that the salary information shown below is a general guideline only of what is reasonably expected to be paid for the position. Salaries are based upon candidate experience and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations.

Summary Pay-Range

Level 2: $75,650 - $111,250
Level 3: $94,350 - $138,750


Benefits And Perks

Millennium Space Systems, A Boeing Company offers a very competitive benefits package to include medical, dental, vision, and 401k plan.

Before applying, please note:

Millennium is DDTC-registered, ITAR-compliant Company. This position is located at a facility that requires special access. Applicants MUST be U.S. citizens and eligible for a security clearance. Additionally, applicants must be willing to apply for and maintain a security clearance. We are proud to be an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. We encourage veterans, disabled veterans and disabled individuals to apply for any open position for which they feel they are qualified.

Applicant Privacy Policy

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description Will work with the management team to design and maintain effective reporting, analyses and presentation of performance data. The successful candidate will be able to listen to business needs and create systems to identify and track business trends across multiple systems and put them all together. The data analyst will provide regular performance and production information in detailed format for internal review and analysis and in dashboard form for stakeholder review and overview.

Responsibilities

Acquires and presents data from all collected data sources
Designs and schedules reports in Chronicall, Crystal Reports and additional proprietary software
Develops and implements data analyses, data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Works with management team and board staff to develop and implement automated quality control plans
Monitors performance and quality control plans to identify areas for improvement and reports exceptions
Develops measurement plans and dashboards, monitors metrics
Collaborates with management team on ad-hoc analysis to uncover root cause of trends to help predict future resource needs
Responds to management requests to extract data, design and produce reports

Required Skills

Expertise with SQL queries and Crystal Reports Designer
Proven work experience as a data analyst
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets
Experience with the following preferred: Excel, Crystal Reports, Crystal Dashboard, MSSAQL, SSRS, Chronicall, DocuWare and Relational Database Management Systems
Professional certification: MCSA: SQL would be a plus
Excellent written, verbal skills and math skills

BS in Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics. Equivalent experience in addition to relevant certifications may be used in lieu of degree.
