Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The ideal candidate will use their passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users.

Responsibilities

Analyze existing SQL queries for performance improvements
Suggest new queries
Develop procedures and scripts for data migration
Provide timely scheduled management reporting




Qualifications

At least 2-3 years’ experience with Microsoft SQL Server technologies including SSRS, SSIS, SSAS & Azure data services
Strong understanding of T-SQL programming

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Must-haves

- Experience as a Data Analyst

- Proficient in excel (functions, v-lookups)

- Desire to learn new technologies and improve processes

- Excellent communication skills and follow-up skills/responsiveness

- Self-motivated with ability to completely own a process/product

Plusses

- Proficient in SQL (queries, joins, unions, select, delete, insert, stored procedures, etc.)

Day-to-Day

A data analytics company is looking for a Data Analyst in the Oklahoma City, OK area. This person will be joining the Data Quality team responsible for auditing various data sources and data products. This person will be specifically responsible for auditing their Bankruptcy Data Product, and will perform daily, weekly and monthly processes to populate tables. They'll work heavily with SQL (queries, joins, unions, select, delete, insert, stored procedures, etc.), excel (functions, vlookups, etc.), and Kettle (to run Kettle jobs). This person will be trained by a cross-trained teammate and learn the entire auditing process. They'll be expected to own their entire audit process from start to finish, learn the Kettle tool really well, and overtime, work to improve processes, inefficiencies, fill gaps in the process and automate tasks as needed. We're seeking a self-starter with excellent follow-up skills to join a fast-paced environment and growing organization.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
TruConnect is on a mission to bridge the digital divide in the United States by delivering premium wireless services to underserved communities. We have connected millions of Americans over the past decade and experiencing substantial growth as the government places significant resources to help bridge the digital divide.

The ideal candidate is an excellent communicator, well-organized, creative, empathetic, and proactive. You build trust & strong relationships at all levels. You are confident and can influence without formal authority, pushing back when appropriate. You earn respect and respect contributions of others.

 




DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

 

Demonstrable experience of using relational databases and Cloud Data environments via writing performant queries in SQL against multi-terabyte and billion row datasets in AWS Redshift/Spectrum, MS SQL, and MySQL
Transform data-based observations and insights into hypotheses through analytical rigor, leading to use cases that will confirm or deny those hypotheses and ultimately improve the quality of data
Demonstrate critical thinking around business rules and logic especially as it pertains to compensation models and other analytic models
Design appropriate data structures by gathering data from primary and secondary sources for reporting consumption
Troubleshoot, research, and identify discrepancies specifically around data such as inventory, compensation, claims/reimbursements, general sales activity, and other such related data
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Create structured data marts for current and historical reporting
Detail oriented and deadline driven to meet monthly filing deadlines
Assist in data governance, meta data management and quality control of the completeness and accuracy of data
Work with end users to follow through with associated action items and execute in a timely manner
Design and document process and data flows for establishing data pipelines to support detailed analyses and accuracy in reporting
Present analyses, translate findings in the data into solutions, and perform root cause analysis in a concise manner which is easy to interpret and understand

 

 

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:

Bachelor’s degree is required. A degree in economics, finance, computer science, statistics, or other data related field preferred
Experience working with ETL tools such as Matillion, AWS Glue, SSIS, etc.
Working knowledge of BI reporting tools such as Tableau or similar tools
Strong product development mindset and focus on actionable analytics
Ability to clearly communicate with cross functional teams
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Translate business requirements into technical requirements
Work with business stakeholders to assess potential risks
Minimum of 2 years of BI/reporting/data analysis experience
Detail-oriented with excellent organizational skills
Analyze problems and provide automated solutions whenever possible
Working knowledge and experience with Agile/Scrum methodology and iterative practices in a service delivery lifecycle
Experience with online collaboration tools such as Slack, JIRA, or MS Teams is a plus
Consistent demonstration of organization, prioritization, self-motivation, and problem resolution skills
Ability to navigate between multiple projects, meet deadlines, and process ad hoc requests
Ability to deal with ambiguity and influence change in a rapidly changing business environment
Great interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to provide insights to support key business decision making
MUST be able to work from the Los Angeles Office 3-4 days/week

 

BENEFITS:

401(k) matching
Medical insurance, including PPO & HSA
Dental insurance
Vision insurance
Flexible Spending Account(s)
Free Life & Long-Term Disability Insurance
Free Identity Theft Protection & Travel Assistance
Access to corporate discount program
Flexible schedule
Paid time off (sick, bereavement, and Flex PTO)
Parental leave

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description Summary




Data analyst serves critically in upcoming and ongoing project’s planning process by preparing and analyzing detailed reports related to overall management in sales and operations. As a Data Analyst you will develop reports using our database allowing us to better manage the business. These reports will be used as a management tool to identify and manage the complete business process.




Job Description




Responsibilities:




Developing and executing processes for monitoring, maintaining, and improving and restoring quality of our database
Creating or upgrading reports by integration of new data sources in cooperation with other teams
Define data requirements, gather missing data, and reconcile existing data accordingly
Utilized Excel, R, Python, SQL in capturing, analyzing, managing and forecasting sales
Assisting various team or cross-functional projects to build more efficient processes through innovations
Researching leading software/solution tools to leverage our company’s operation
Develop ad-hoc reports per managers’ requests




Knowledge/experience, Skills, Ability & Attitude




Bachelor’s degree in fields such as data science, computer science, business analytics.
Experience of working with large data sets using a range of statistical and segmentation techniques.
Good mastery of data analysis, data forecasting and database management
Strong technical skills in using Excel, R, Python or SQL
Strong skills using data processing & data visualization software (Microsoft Excel, Python, or PowerBI)
Strong attention to detail and time management skills
Ability to write detailed instructions based on practical use cases
Taking initiatives, passion to work, and posses good analytic concepts

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
General Description




Under the direct supervision of the Senior, Manager Compliance, the Data Analyst is responsible for ensuring the quality and accuracy of pension members’ accounts. The Data Analyst audits pension data so that disbursement of benefits is completed in a timely manner.




Key Accountabilities




As the Data Analyst, you will have the opportunity to work on some challenging projects which include, but are not limited to, the following:




Analyzing data for completeness and accuracy, interpreting the results and providing written summary of the recommendation
Preparing reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information into a visual layout
Reviewing, researching and collecting data to assist with development and analyst
Identifying inconsistency in data pattern and reviewing the anomalies
Retaining adequate supporting documents for operational functions
Performing data analysis of key problem areas to assist in the root cause analysis
Auditing documentation for completeness, accuracy and proper execution in compliance with legal and fund requirements
Documenting each initiative with the background information, identified issue and proposed solutions
Performing data reconciliation to identify data irregularities
Cross-referencing multiple systems to validate and document information




Job Requirements




Bachelor’s degree from a four-year college or university preferred. A commensurate combination of education and related experience will be considered
Previous experience with pension administration and/or auditing of financial data required
Demonstrated critical thinking and problem solving skills
Demonstrated ability to plan and manage complex projects, ability to work effectively with team members and senior leaders under tight deadlines
The ability to communicate effectively orally, and in writing, including the use of correct spelling, grammar, and punctuation
Experience implementing corrective actions
Strong attention to detail
Excellent organizational and time management skills and the ability to meet deadline
Ability to maintain professionalism and lead by example
Strong experience in the MS Office products, particularly Excel




Education And Experience




Bachelor’s Degree required with 1-3 years of experience.
Knowledge and experience with the Fund’s pension software.
High level of proficiency in relevant computer applications such as Microsoft Office and Microsoft Excel.




Physical Requirements




While performing the duties of this job, the employee will likely sit for long periods of time, with some standing and repetitive physical activity.
The employee may occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds.




Environment




This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment (i.e., computers, phones, and photocopiers).




Disclaimers




This job description reflects management’s assignment of essential functions; nothing in this document restricts management’s rights to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Coriell Institute for Medical Research is currently seeking an energetic and organized Data Analyst to join our IT team and successfully support a wide variety of projects in support of our biobanking operations. The successful applicant will merge, process, clean, validate and make available data and data reports collected for biobanking efforts at Coriell, including demographic data, clinical data, sample processing data, sample inventory data, and sample distribution data for thousands of participants.

The successful applicant will have 3-5 years of experience with data management, data cleaning, and data processing in a scientific environment. In particular, three years of SQL Server and R programming experience and experience in maintaining source code in code repository tools are desired. Experience with Shiny is a plus. Applicants should also have excellent written and oral communication skills and the ability to interface with an interdisciplinary team of IT professionals, scientists, and support staff.

If you are interested in applying for this opportunity, please email a cover letter and resume to careers@coriell.org. Please note, the cover letter must include a detailed description of your relevant experience as well as highlight your applicable background.

Founded in 1953, the Coriell Institute for Medical Research is a nonprofit research institute dedicated to improving human health through biomedical research. Coriell scientists lead research in personalized medicine, cancer biology, epigenetics, and the genomics of opioid use disorder. Coriell also hosts one of the world's leading biobanks—comprised of collections for the National Institutes of Health, disease foundations and private clients—and distributes biological samples and offers research and biobanking services to scientists around the globe. To facilitate drug discovery and disease study, the Institute also develops and distributes collections of induced pluripotent stem cells. To learn more, visit www.coriell.org. EOE

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Summary: Our client is seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join their hybrid team in Chicago, IL. The client is revamping their cybersecurity protocols surrounding their application vulnerabilities to identify and remediate current and future risk/threat potentials. So, the Data Analyst’s responsibility is to identify in datasets any and all vulnerabilities, risks, threats to all applications. They will analyze, clean, and build reports from data to identify areas of potential vulnerabilities/threats to applications. They will provide findings to the project team(s) to build and execute solutions to remediate those threats.




Duties:

Collect, transform, and interpret large data sets
Pull, clean and analyze data from various databases, systems and platforms monitoring the performance and health of utilized applications
Build functions in Excel
Maintain proficiency in Excel and running functions
Visualize and create visualizations for individuals




​​​​​​​Desired Skills/Experience:

Expert knowledge of Microsoft Excel (VLOOKUPs, HLOOKUPs, and the ability to quickly clean and merge large data sets)
Ability to write own function and macros to clean large data sets
Ability to extract business value from the information they are seeing for the business user
Experience with visualization tools such as Spotfire, Tableau, PowerBI
Cybersecurity experience (preferred)
Qualys, Vericode experience (preferred)




Benefits:

Medical, Dental, & Vision Insurance Plans
401K offered

Title: Data Analyst (Power BI, SQL)
Description:
Job Description:

Create and maintain Power BI reports and Dashboards upon gathering the requirements from various stakeholders.
Make changes to the existing Power BI Reports and Dashboards on a regular basis as per requests from Business.
Work in a Power BI environment to create dashboards like daily, weekly, monthly reports using Power BI desktop and publish them to server.
Create complex Stored Procedures, triggers, cursors, tables, views, SQL joins and statements for applications by using T-SQL.
Ensure data completeness, data quality by validating that all records, all fields and the full contents of each field are loaded.
Design Cubes with Star Schema using SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS). Created several Dashboards and Scorecards with Key Performance Indicators (KPI) in SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS).
Work on troubleshooting ADF pipeline issues when needed

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
** LOCAL CANDIDATES ONLY**




Position Overview:

We are looking for a motivated, organized, and analytical thinker to join our Operations Team. The ideal candidate must be comfortable corresponding daily on the phone and through professional emails with people in municipal departments. You must have strong attention to detail, communication, and reading comprehension skills. You must be results driven, growth oriented, and able to balance multiple projects at any given time. You must be able to think quickly and be an active problem solver. If you are experienced with real estate taxes, assessment, valuation, or real estate in general – this is the role for you!




Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

● Engage in daily phone and email correspondence to obtain information from government bodies across the country as well as foster working relationships with those people

● Engage in persistent and professional follow-up with necessary parties and maintain working relationships

● Review, analyze, and archive meta-data points from commercial contracts, public records, and information gathered from correspondence with government bodies

● Search public records and online databases for property information, building permits, tax bills, and information related to clients and contracts

● Participate with executive Management Team on company growth strategy

● Prepare and present reports and to the Management Team

● Be a direct support to our Sales Team

● Be creative and have an analytical thinking mentality

● Work collaboratively with all departments to reach company targets

● Participate in regular training and success meetings




Qualifications:

● ● Bachelor’s degree or appropriate job-related experience

● Minimum of 2 years’ professional experience with a preference to those within the commercial real estate industry or experience with property assessments and/or real estate taxes (New college graduates with applicable Intern or co-op experience may be considered)

● Confident and comfortable speaking with others by phone/email

● Able to work independently as well as in a team environment

● Experience with research and data analysis

● Basic skills in Excel and Microsoft Office applications

● Strong organizational, communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills

● Proven project management skills and experience handling concurrent projects with attention to detail and accuracy.

● Professional demeanor with a high degree of business acumen

● Creative, persistent, fast learner, and quick thinker - Problem Solver Mentality

● Must be able to handle rejection and overcome work obstacles




Compensation:

Commensurate with experience. Competitive Benefits Package including: 100% paid health insurance, dental, and vision coverage. Flexible Time Off and 401K contribution.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What You’ll Be Doing:




Our Torq Insights practice is looking for superstars who will fill a key role by working with our clients to support all aspects of analytic initiatives from conception to completion. Your passion, knowledge and confidence will fuel a powerful experience that drives meaningful impact for our clients. Below are some of the key things you’ll need to excel in:




Build strong relationships with customer organization team members and cross-functional partners to provide strategic advice on data trends and requirements.
Be intellectually curious and have a passion for proactively digging into data
Develop KPIs and metrics within interactive visualizations that allow stakeholders to easily process and take action.
Simplify data into a compelling story that will be presented to stakeholders, including high-level executives and leaders.
Lead in all aspects of the BI lifecycle from gathering requirements to data validation, data analysis, report analysis, and understanding of business processes.
Account for the overall management of analytic projects; including timeliness, quality, and client value; QA/QC data and report outputs to ensure accuracy.
Promote data literacy and a self-serve culture across the enterprise through training & coaching business users on BI tools.




What You’ll Bring to the Table:




Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Business Information Management, Computer Science, Math, Statistics, or related discipline
2 to 3 years of applied experience in Consulting, Data Analysis, Business Intelligence, or a related field
Ability to manage in an environment of ambiguity with diverse stakeholders
Strong quantitative, analytical, and conceptual problem-solving skills
Demonstrated ability to analyze data and develop visualizations that lead actionable insight
Experience with Power BI, Tableau, or other data visualization tools
Experience with SQL or other querying languages




Bonus Skills (not required but a plus!)




Web Analytics and Tagging platforms like Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics a plus
Python, R, SAS, or statistical analytics tools
Data Governance and Master Data Management standards and frameworks, specifically Informatica




Benefits And Other Fun Stuff




We ask our consultants to be superstars, so we treat them like it. Even better, our perks are designed for employees by our employees. We do this because we believe in delivering a compelling benefits package that puts you at the heart of our rewards.




Competitive Salary – your bank account will be smiling
Unlimited PTO – we’re serious about that work-life balance thing
Best-in-class health/vision/dental benefits – your health is our priority
Generous 401K options – take care of your future with us
Opportunity to be a key player at a highly reputable, fast-growing consulting firm
High degree of internal mobility and diverse project opportunities




Torq is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.




Note: No visa sponsorship is available for this position, all applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States for any employer.

Title: Data Analyst (remote)
Description:
Job Description

Job Summary

Molina provides Medicare (typically for people 65+), Medicaid (typically for low income and disabled people), and individual or family healthcare.gov Marketplace products (typically for low to middle income people). Because many of our members come from the most in-need populations, our work can have tremendous impacts on improving member health and wellbeing. Molina has a strong culture of using data and analysis to guide our decisions. We use data to ensure that our members can access and maintain a consistent regimen for the most effective, and often life-changing, prescription drugs.

This Data Analyst will work within the Pharmacy/Rx Analytics team to support pharmacy managers and teams across our 20 states and growing! They will use tools such as SQL, Excel, and Tableau to compile and analyze data from multiple sources and answer questions about the pharmacy drugs utilized by our members.

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities

Working knowledge of compiling data using SQL, either from professional experience, college coursework, internships, or academic/research experience. Knowledge of other coding tools such as Python, Java, R, or SAS would be a plus.
Ability to collect, clean, and organize data from a variety of sources including text files, database tables, spreadsheets, and others
Aptitude for defining requirements and understanding business problems
Very organized and capable of developing intricate methodologies used for reports, dashboards, data processes, collaboration, and documentation
JOB QUALIFICATIONS

Required Education

Associate's Degree or equivalent combination of education and experience

Required Experience

1-3 years

Preferred Education

Bachelor's Degree or equivalent combination of education and experience

Preferred Experience

3-5 years

To all current Molina employees: If you are interested in applying for this position, please apply through the intranet job listing.

Molina Healthcare offers a competitive benefits and compensation package. Molina Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) M/F/D/V.

Salary Range: $49,929 - 97,362/year*

Actual compensation may vary from posting based on geographic location, work experience, education and/or skill level.

Molina has a strong culture of using data and analysis to guide our decisions. We use data to ensure that our members can access and maintain a consistent regimen for the most effective, and often life-changing, prescription drugs.

This Data Analyst will work within the Pharmacy/Rx Analytics team to support pharmacy managers and teams across our 20 states and growing! They will use tools such as SQL, Excel, and Tableau to compile and analyze data from multiple sources and answer questions about the pharmacy drugs utilized by our members.

Title: Data Analyst-Entry level.
Description:
Responsibilities




Work hand-in-hand with the business side of an organization to help in process improvement.




Working primarily on design and analysis in the areas of organization, planning cum information technology.




Works as the middle man between the technical team and business team so as to assist in the development of requirements needed for the business.




He/ She will be responsible for documenting customer requirements as outlined by the business users.




The analyst’s role also includes making sure that the designs meet the company’s technical standards.




Qualification And Experience




Entry Level / Fresh Graduates / Engineers - BS / MS in Business/Data Analytics, Management Information systems, Computer Science ,Software engineering, IT, Industrial Engineering/Engineering management.
Prior experience is a "plus" but not required.
Candidates with strong communication/presentation skills, strong aptitude to learn and interest in Software programming, Testing or Business Analysis.
Work Authorization: Must be authorized to work in the US.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our client is one of the leading automotive retailers in the United States. With over 300 locations and more than 10 million vehicles sold, they aim to transform the automotive industry through its innovation and bold leadership. They are looking to take on a SQL Data Analyst who will provide best practice recommendations related to SQL maintenance procedures. This is a hybrid position based in White Plains, NY.




SQL Data Analyst’s Responsibilities and Duties

Writing SQL scripts, queries, and stored procedures to extract data
Develops complex advancement reports using SQL, Microsoft Office and other utilities or languages as necessary
Performing ad hoc and structured data analysis
Generating quality reports
Identify data issues proactively and flag them to respective stakeholders




SQL Data Analyst’s Qualifications and Skills

Bachelor's or master’s degree in Business, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Must be fluent in writing scripts, and queries and must know other Programming Languages as well
Excellent communication skills both written and verbal is a must with ability to convey complex information to key stakeholders

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Global Hires is looking for an ALL-STAR Data Analyst for our client in the packaging industry. Their mission is to collaboratively craft innovative, high-quality packaging solutions that balance the needs of their clients with the ever-evolving needs of their consumers. Caring for their business also means the internal teams are equally important - physical & mental health, integrity, team collaboration and sustainability!




The organization knows that data is the foundation to making smart decisions and requests an ALL-STAR Data Analyst to identify and communicate data-driven insights to maximize efficient operations and other initiatives. You will turn raw data into information, information into insight, and insight into business decisions.




The ideal team member should be passionate about finding insights in large datasets, synthesizing, and communicating results to drive business results and growth. You will work cross-functionally with Product Management, Engineering, Plant Quality, Sales, and Finance Departments. This position requires successful candidate to be a self-starter, managing and providing consistent and reliable reporting and analysis, in addition to utilizing primary and secondary research methods.




This role is an onsite, full-time position based out of the Modesto, CA office.




Job Functions & Core Responsibilities:

Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code patterns.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends and patterns in complex data sets.
Acquire data from primary and secondary data sources and maintain databases and data systems.
Provide analytical, statistical, and programming to identify key market trends focused on insights, user growth and content by performing market and competitive analyses.
Work with the management team to prioritize business data and information needs.
Monitor performance and quality controls plans to identify improvements.
Perform other tasks as assigned.




Skills:

Technical expertise regarding data models, databases design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
Strong knowledge of reporting packages (business objects etc.), databases (SQL etc.), programming (SML, JavaScript, or ETL frameworks).
Strong knowledge of statistics and statistical packages for analyzing datasets using visualization tools such as Python, R, Excel, and Tableau.
Extensive knowledge of programming language.
Strong data analytic skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of raw data into reports.
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings.
High attention to detail and accuracy.
Creative and critical thinking skills.
Strong problem-solving, presentation and graphical skills.
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills required.
Excellent organizational and project management skills.
Great interpersonal and communication skills, both oral and written.




Education/Experience & Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Information Technology, or related field required.
Master’s degree in Analytics or Data Science preferred.
3-5 years proven work experience as a data analyst or business data analyst.
Proven experience in data extraction, data cleaning, data loading, statistical data analysis, exploratory data analysis, and predictive modeling.
Experience using SPSS, SAS, Power BI, and Tableau.
Show more Show less

Title: Service Data Analyst
Description:
Ivy Energy is hiring for a Service Data Analyst within the Service Operations department. The role will have endless opportunities to use command line analysis, build and optimize reusable queries, and transform data with code. The role itself will not be measured based on new code productivity but more the ability to pay attention to important details that influence customer satisfaction. As a Service Data Analyst you will be responsible for verifying the quality of processed data through validation analysis while also having exploration and practice as part of your work. This role will also be responsible in managing data driven support tickets and communicating with 3rd parties about a solution or timeline for fixes. This position will be well suited for someone who wants to grow their data analysis skills, work in a high growth industry, and be part of an energetic culture.

Requirements

Notable education in fields related to data science, business, or analytics.
You have at least one year of work experience or related academic project work as a data analyst.
You have experience working with Python and SQL/Postgres.
You are investigative and curious, you can find or create leads in data, and follow through on clues to create hypotheses which you seek to answer.
You can understand the business challenges of stakeholders, and work both independently and collaboratively to answer relevant questions.
You have a strong drive to continue learning (new platforms, technologies, etc.) and teach what you know.
You are a skilled communicator and understand the importance of creating relationships.


Benefits

Health Insurance
PTO
Sick Pay
Great Office Environment
Monthly Electric Vehicle & Fitness Stipends


About Ivy

We are a team that is on a mission to evolve the way that shared buildings create, use, and think about energy.

We connected as a team with the firm conviction that we can use technology and innovative problem solving to fix the problems that exist for distributed energy asset growth in a shared building environment. Our team comes from a variety of different backgrounds including real estate development, energy monitoring software, and solar industry operations.

Hit Go - Team Values

Harmony - "Enjoy what you protect."

Innovation - "Did I create today?"

Transparency - "Embrace open dialogue."

Growth - "Seek beyond your comfort zone."

Ownership - "Know your value, own your value."
Show more Show less

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – 100% remote

We are seeking a Data Analyst with 2+ years of SQL experience and excellent critical thinking skills to join an exceptional team within our Fortune 100 client.




This Data Analytics specialist will support Workforce Strategy teams to transition their data infrastructure (views, tables, and workflows) in Snowflake from source HR SAP data to Workday HR source data. This role will include a lot of SQL as well as documentation on the difference in field definition between systems, and stakeholder communication, and focus on the creation, maintenance, and documentation of data sources rather than the visualization of the data.




Requirements:

2+ years of SQL coding experience, preferably in an enterprise organization
Experience documenting data definitions and infrastructures, and knowledge of relational databases
Experience working with HR or sensitive data is preferred, as well as knowledge of Agile/Scrum methodology
Ability to assist in recreating views and tables in SQL that power reporting for Workforce Strategy teams
Experience investigating discrepancies or errors in the data
Comfortable communicating with partner teams to track down source data and data definitions
Ability to operate independently, navigating complex environments, and reaching out to stakeholders in different teams
Alteryx, Airflow, and Python skills are nice to have







Mainz Brady Group is a technology staffing firm with offices in California, Oregon, and Washington. We specialize in Information Technology and Engineering placements on a Contract, Contract-to-hire, and Direct Hire basis. Mainz Brady Group is the recipient of multiple annual Excellence Awards from the TechServe Alliance, the leading association for IT and engineering staffing firms in the U.S.

Mainz Brady Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to Diversity & Inclusion and incorporate non-discrimination best practices in all of our staffing processes. Mainz Brady Group does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, disability or any other protected class.

Title: Treasury Data Analyst
Description:
Company

Jefferies Group LLC, the largest independent, global, full-service investment banking firm headquartered in the U.S. focused on serving clients for 60 years, is a leader in providing insight, expertise and execution to investors, companies, and governments. We offer deep sector expertise across a full range of products and services in investment banking, equities, fixed income, asset and wealth management in the Americas, Europe and the Middle East and Asia. Jefferies Group LLC is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Jefferies Financial Group Inc. (NYSE: JEF), a diversified financial services company.







Role

Joining the Treasury Technology team and based in London. The team currently has a presence in London and New York and is responsible for providing software and data solutions to enhance and support Cash Management, FX Funding, Treasury Analytics and Liquidity.

Working closely with Global Treasury, Traders and Operations to analyse and load data into SQL Server databases and build/maintain SSAS Tabular models to meet Treasury’s reporting and analytics needs. Would be involved in all aspects from initial requirement gathering, to specification and proto typing. A good understanding of Treasury’s function, as well as Equities and Fixed Income products, including REPO and Stock Lending is desirable.

Responsibilities:

The key responsibilities are:




Work with other teams to source and ingest data in a variety of forms
Working with Treasury to gather requirements, analyse data and present data solutions
Collaborate with a team of developers using dev ops tools like GIT and CI
Ingest data into a data warehouse with ELT processes using T-SQL
Develop and maintain OLAP databases and SSAS cubes
Create reports and dashboards in Power BI and SSRS
Writing performant and maintainable code to provide value from data
Adhere to project deadlines







The following skills and experience are required for this role:

Excellent technical aptitude – T-SQL, DAX, SSAS Tabular, etc.
Strong analytical & problem-solving skills with a logical approach
Knowledge of data warehousing and data processing concepts
A Self-Starter, able to work collaboratively
Excellent data analytical skills – Data mining / discovery
Good communication skills, able to covey concepts to technical and non-technical people
Good business knowledge of Fixed Income and Equities, Repos and STBL
Good understanding of Treasury







The salary range for this role is $125,000 to $155,000.




At Jefferies, we believe that diversity fosters creativity, innovation and thought leadership through the infusion of new ideas and perspectives. We have made a commitment to building a culture that provides opportunities for all employees regardless of our differences and supports a workforce that is reflective of the communities where we work and live. As a result, we are able to pool our collective insights and intelligence to provide fresh and innovative thinking for our clients.




Jefferies is an equal employment opportunity employer. We practice equal opportunity for all, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, religion, gender, pregnancy, age, physical or mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, genetic information, reproductive health decisions, or any other factor protected by law. We are committed to hiring the most qualified applicants and complying with all federal, state, and local equal employment opportunity laws. As part of this commitment, Jefferies will extend reasonable accommodations to individuals with qualified disabilities, as appropriate, under applicable law.




All employees must follow Jefferies’ COVID-19 protocol policy, which is subject to change.

Title: Data Visualization Consultant (Power BI Consultant)
Description:
Located in more than 37 offices globally, our client is global leader in technology services, digital transformation and consultancy services.




We are looking for a Data Visualization Consultant (Power BI Consultant) to help clients in their digital transformations.




Responsibilities:

Create and design reports and dashboards
Interpret business requirements and translate them, through functional analysis, in a good technical solution
Define and execute test scenarios
Coordinate User Acceptance Testing (UAT)




Your skills:

Excellent domain of English (French or Dutch a plus)
Good presentation skills
You are customer focused, eager to connect with end users and capture their requirements
You have knowledge of visualization techniques
You have relevant experience and/or certificates in one or more of the following technologies: Microsoft Power BI, Qlik, Tableau, MicroStrategy, SAS Visual Analytics, SAP Business Objects




Relevant Certificates

PL300 – Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst
Tableau Desktop Specialist, Tableau Certified Data Analyst
Any certificate linked to Data Visualization and Business Intelligence




NB: Driving license is required for this role




What we offer:

2 extra months of payment in June and December

Hybrid work environment

Competitive salary

32 holidays

Meal vouchers

Mobile subscription

Lease car or mobility budget

Additional bonus based on experience and performance

Title: Intern in Data engineering
Description:
Company Description

Our mission is to build cultures of innovation at companies by transforming the way they work, by modernising their IT infrastructure & apps, and by elevating their customer experiences. As a Premier Google Cloud partner, we do this by implementing innovative Google Cloud solutions and by leveraging cutting-edge AI & Machine Learning technologies. 
 
Devoteam G Cloud’s certified Cloud engineers build disruptive solutions on Google Cloud Platform to give organisations a competitive advantage. We migrate and modernise legacy applications & IT infrastructure using Cloud Native solutions such as Kubernetes, Anthos and Serverless solutions.
 
We help our customers with their hybrid- and multi-Cloud strategies and to get to actionable business insights faster, by accelerating their data & analytics. Together we create scalable, future-proof & secure data journeys. And we build AI & ML solutions on top of this data to help customers to create better customer experiences. Next to that, we give the workplace of the future shape with solutions like Google Workspace. 


Job Description

As an Intern in Data Engineering at Devoteam G Cloud, you will assist the Data Engineers with transforming the way companies work by building solutions on Google Cloud.
Are you willing to work in a dynamic environment, learn a bunch of stuff, and make the difference in our organisation? Apply now for this Data Engineering internship!


Qualifications


Pipeline development with Python, Golang or Java
Knowledge of SQL
Learning how to work with Google Cloud
Development of ETL/ELT stream/batch data pipelines
Structure, model, secure & manage data in Google Cloud
Activate data with ML models or BI visualizations

Title: Young Graduate - Data Associate
Description:
Studeer jij af in de zomer van 2023, heb jij een aanstekelijk enthousiasme voor data én wil je graag meewerken aan de meest innovatieve data oplossingen van de toekomst? Drie keer ja? Dan is een positie als Data Associate in ons Data Solutions team een uitgelezen kans om je carrière te lanceren!

Als Data Associate neem je deel aan projectteams bestaande uit ervaren consultants en andere data associates & werk je aan data & AI projecten bij klanten die actief zijn in verschillende sectoren.
Je zal de ervaren consultants ondersteunen bij het verzamelen en analyseren van gegevens, het ontwikkelen van rapporten en dashboards, en assisteren bij presentaties en workshops. Samen met je team, help je onze klanten met het bouwen van schaalbare cloud data-platformen.
Je levert technische/functionele documentatie om de ontwikkelde oplossing te ondersteunen.
Hierdoor krijg je inzicht in verschillende Data, AI & IoT-technologieën-technologieën, leer je soft-skills zoals communicatie en probleemoplossing, en ontwikkel je een begrip van verschillende bedrijfsprocessen.
Je krijgt de kans om je kennis & expertise uit te bouwen én te vernieuwen door Microsoft en Databricks certificaten te behalen.
Innovatie en kennisdeling staan bij ons hoog op de agenda. We zijn altijd op zoek naar vernieuwing en verbetering bij onze klanten. Je krijgt volop kansen om hierin actief deel te nemen.
De combinatie van opleiding en praktijkervaring bereid je voor op een succesvolle carrière als data engineer, data analyst of data scientist.
Je komt terecht in een hecht, gedreven en gepassioneerd team waarin het aangenaam én leuk werken is. We hebben zelfs een eigen Data Solutions fun team!


Wat breng jij mee?

Je bent bachelor of master, bij voorkeur op het gebied van Informatica of Business IT & Management of een hieraan gerelateerde studierichting.
Je bent gepassioneerd door data gedreven oplossingen.
Heb je een eerste ervaring met Microsoft Azure, Databricks, Python, SQL en/of Power BI? Dat is een grote plus!
Niet alleen jouw kennis is belangrijk, we vinden je motivatie, inzicht en attitude minstens even belangrijk.
Je brengt een flexibele, zelfstandige en collegiale houding met je mee.
Goede communicatieve vaardigheden, klantgerichtheid en nauwkeurigheid zijn tevens zeer belangrijk in deze rol.
Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal. Frans is een pluspunt.
Een bepaalde flexibiliteit naar verplaatsingen is vereist aangezien er regelmatig van bij de klant wordt gewerkt. Als je aanwezigheid bij de klant niet vereist is dan kan je in het Cegeka-kantoor dichtst bij je woonplaats werken (Antwerpen, Gent, Hasselt of Leuven) of vanuit je home-office.


Wat hebben wij jou te bieden?

We vragen heel wat (talenten) van jou. Gelukkig krijg je er ook heel wat voor terug! Een krak zoals jij verdient immers het allerbeste!
Competenties en karakter zijn voor ons essentieel, naast ervaring en ambities. Cegeka investeert voortdurend in talent management opdat elke medewerker zijn potentieel kan realiseren.
Innovatie en kennisdeling staan bij ons hoog op de agenda. We zijn altijd op zoek naar vernieuwing en verbetering bij onze klanten. Je krijgt volop kansen om hierin actief deel te nemen.
Je komt terecht in een hecht, gedreven en gepassioneerd team waarin het aangenaam én leuk werken is. We hebben zelfs een eigen Data Solutions fun team.
Begeleiding op maat! Jij geeft aan waar je interesses liggen. We bieden verschillende carrièrepaden aan, en kijken samen hoe we je verder kunnen helpen ontplooien.
Naast het competitief brutosalaris, een (elektrische) bedrijfswagen of mobiliteitsbudget, maaltijdcheques, ecocheques groeps-en hospitalisatieverzekering, gsm-abonnement, forfaitaire onkostenvergoeding en krachtige laptop, bieden we jou flexibele werkuren en een mooie work/life balans.
Dankzij ons Flex Reward Plan kunnen we een verloning op maat aanbieden.

  • Dankzij ons Flex Reward Plan kunnen we een verloning op maat aanbieden.

Title: Job | Data Analyst – Risk & ICM Data Delivery | Brussel
HTML:
Bedrijf : Belfius Bank

Solliciteren

Wat doe je precies?

Bij Belfius geloven we dat data de basis vormen van onze digitale transformatie. Of het nu gaat om digitale marketing, het leveren van producten en diensten op maat, het nemen van tactische en strategische beslissingen, het verbeteren van de procedures of het monitoren van onze prestaties, data spelen in dat verband een cruciale rol.

Elke dag opnieuw vinden miljoenen verrichtingen plaats in de systemen van Belfius, wat telkens data oplevert. In het Risk/ICM Data Delivery-team moeten wij die gegevens begrijpen en ze vertalen in insights en tools ontwikkelen ter ondersteuning van de beslissingen en de strategie van de metiers.

Heb jij een passie voor datamanagement, innovatie en het oplossen van complexe problemen? Wil jij begrijpen hoe wij die data vertalen in diverse indicatoren inzake rentabiliteit en risicobeheer? Is dat het geval, dan ben jij de ideale kandidaat om te komen werken bij ons Risk/ICM Data Delivery-team!

Wat houdt de functie in?

Wij zijn op zoek naar iemand die ons kan ondersteunen in onze activiteiten inzake reporting en kwaliteitscontrole. In die functie hebt jij twee expertisedomeinen:
  • Producten die provisieloon opleveren (rekeningen, fondsen, beleggingen enz.);
  • De kosten, en dat voor alle activiteiten van de bank.
In die context krijg jij twee hoofdtaken toebedeeld. Aan de ene kant voer je analyses uit van de maandelijkse resultaten en zorg jij ervoor dat die de nodige kwaliteit hebben. Je stelt je analyses eveneens ter beschikking van de diverse stakeholders zodat zij hun beslissingen kunnen nemen. Aan de andere kant bekommer jij je eveneens om de follow-up van de evoluties in het domein (impact op de berekening van de rentabiliteit bij de lancering van nieuwe producten, het veranderen van tariefstructuur enz.) om de potentiële impact op onze activiteiten te analyseren.

In welk team kom je terecht?

Binnen de afdeling Data & Analytics maakt het Risk/ICM Data Delivery-team deel uit van Data Transformation Risk & ICM en is het verantwoordelijk voor het exploiteren van de data van het domein Risk & ICM voor het berekenen van de rentabiliteit en de positie van de risico’s van de klanten, segmenten, producten, metiers enz. Het team identificeert transversaal en gecentraliseerd de behoeften van de diverse betrokken partijen in termen van de visualisering en architectuur en is verantwoordelijk voor diverse taken:
  • Ontwikkeling van cockpits: visualisering van het financieel/commercieel rendement en van de positie van Risk voor de segmenten/klanten/producten;
  • Verslagen opstellen en bestaande verslagen automatiseren: die worden opgesteld op basis van definities afkomstig uit geharmoniseerde gegevensbronnen;
  • Ad-hocanalyses: bijvoorbeeld op een categorie van klanten, een bepaald product enz
De afdeling omvat multifunctionele teams met o.m. data engineers en data analysts.

De Data Analyst is in de eerste plaats een aanspreekpunt in het domein van de kosten en de provisielonen en de aanwending van de gegevens daarrond. Hij/zij is verantwoordelijk voor:
  • Een grondige follow-up doen van de maandelijkse resultaten aangaande de fees en de kosten in de P&L. In dat opzicht voert hij/zij analyses uit en stelt hij gestandaardiseerde verslagen op voor de stakeholders ;
  • Het op de voet volgen van de evoluties in zijn domein (evenementen, nieuwe producten, evoluties van de pricing enz.) en de impact ervan op zijn activiteiten en op de P&L van de bank ;
  • Een aanspreekpunt zijn voor onze stakeholders om hun behoeften te begrijpen, een afdoende analysebenadering uit te werken en dat toetsen aan de bestaande verslagen.
  • Eventueel:
  • De resultaten van zijn analyses op een gestructureerde en begrijpelijke wijze toelichten ;
  • Kwaliteitscontroles en de Data Governance Standards in zijn activiteiten omschrijven en implementeren;
  • Proactief verbeterpunten in zijn activiteiten identificeren ;
  • De visualisering van de gegevens ondersteunen. De Data Analyst speelt potentieel een belangrijke rol bij het digitaliseren van zijn gegevens in een dashboarding-tool. Er wordt verwacht dat de Data Engineer proactief verbeteringen kan voorstellen.
De Data Analyst maakt deel uit van de Data Visualisation community en bepaalt en deelt in die hoedanigheid de best practices op het gebied van datavisualisatie.

Wat mag je van ons verwachten?

Chez Belfius, nous voulons être Meaningful & Inspiring pour la société belge et vous pouvez nous aider à faire la différence.

Nous accordons une grande importance à ce que chaque collaborateur puisse combiner au mieux vie privée et vie professionnelle. Ainsi, notre culture d’entreprise est avant tout basée sur la confiance et l’autonomie, et nous avons mis en place un mode de travail hybride, appelé « Home Based », qui repose sur un sain équilibre entre télétravail et présentiel. En tant que nouveau collaborateur, vous serez automatiquement engagé sous ce statut.

Concrètement, vous travaillerez à domicile pendant la majeure partie de votre temps de travail, et combinerez ce télétravail avec une présence sur le lieu de travail, notre siège central ou un siège régional, en fonction des besoins du service et dans le but de maintenir, entre autres, une bonne collaboration avec votre responsable, collègues, contacts transversaux…

Le siège central comme les sièges régionaux sont facilement accessibles en transport en commun. Vous vous rendez sur site ? Débutez votre journée au siège central par une session d’entraînement au Belfius Workout, la salle de sport made@belfius, profitez le midi d’un lunch sain dans un de nos restaurants d’entreprise, où vous pouvez également organiser des réunions informelles entre collègues, tout en buvant un café ou en mangeant une petite collation.

Prenez votre carrière en main et bénéficiez des possibilités de développement personnel offertes par la Belfius Academy. En tant qu’employeur, nous investissons dans le développement du leadership et la diversité et l’égalité des chances sont des valeurs importantes à nos yeux.

Nous vous offrons par ailleurs un package salarial attrayant que vous pouvez constituer en partie selon vos propres besoins, avec en outre de nombreux avantages extralégaux tels qu’une assurance groupe, une assurance hospitalisation, des chèques-repas, un abonnement aux transports en commun, une réduction sur les produits bancaires et d’assurance, etc.

Wat verwachten we van jou?

Individuele vaardigheden :
  • Je toont grote belangstelling voor data management en wordt geïnspireerd door de diverse problemen rond gegevensbeheer in een constant evoluerend gediversifieerd technologielandschap ;
  • Je besteedt aandacht aan het stakeholder management en aan het afstemmen van de behoeften ;
  • Je bent vlot in de omgang en je bent een teamspeler, maar je kan ook autonoom en zelfstandig werken ;
  • Je gaat georganiseerd te werk en levert kwalitatief hoogstaand werk af. Je stelt je flexibel op in onze dynamische omgeving ;
  • Je werkt resultaatgericht en aarzelt niet om je kennis voortdurend bij te schaven ;
  • Je combineert ervaring met een grote belangstelling voor de bank, de ICM & Risk-afdelingen, de klantenrentabiliteit, het risico, de reporting en technische ICT-competenties ;
  • Je moedertaal is Nederlands of Frans en je hebt op zijn minst een passieve kennis van de andere landstaal en van het Engels.
Technische vaardigheden :
  • Je behaalde een master informatica-, ingenieurs- of businesswetenschappen. Of je beschikt over gelijkwaardige kennis door ervaring ;
  • Je hebt ervaring met beheerscontrole en/of marketing (product / segment) ;
  • Je hebt ervaring met Oracle SQL ;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van gegevens, bij voorkeur in QlikSense, is een groot pluspunt ;
  • Je hebt ervaring met Office-programma’s (Excel, PowerPoint, Access, Word enz.).
Belfius, Meaningful and Inspiring for Belgian Society. Together.

Belfius is een 100% Belgische bank die maximaal investeert in nuttige en duurzame projecten in België. Gesterkt door onze waarden zoeken we proactief naar creatieve en innoverende oplossingen die zinvol zijn voor onze klanten en voor de grote uitdagingen van de samenleving van morgen.

Belfius, een inclusieve werkgever

Bij Belfius gaan we radicaal voor de kracht van diversiteit. Het maakt ons niet uit wat je gender, seksuele geaardheid, afkomst, geloof, leeftijd of handicap is. Als we je kiezen, doen we dat voor je kwaliteiten en vaardigheden. Bovendien zorgen we ervoor dat je je vaardigheden en talenten bij ons optimaal kan ontwikkelen en benutten.

Solliciteer snel

Solliciteer nu en ga aan de slag bij een 100% Belgische bank die maximaal investeert in zinvolle en duurzame projecten op eigen bodem.

Solliciteren

Title: Financial Data Analyst, EMEA APAC
Description:
We are currently recruiting for a Financial Data Analyst EMEA APAC for our Heart Failure division to be based in our EMEA & APAC HQ in Zaventem, Belgium




The Data Analyst position is a critical role to enable the commercial and financial leadership to drive systematic data support and data-based decision making for all topics having a direct impact on the financial success of the business unit.




It includes sales- and margin reporting, SG&A cost reporting & analysis, consolidation of large & complex data sets, ad-hoc data analysis as well as systematic data support.




In addition, the Analyst acts as a true business partner to the regional finance teams, helping them develop & maintain adequate reporting, including creation of new standards, that drive financial analysis & insights for them as well as for the commercial leadership teams.




Job Responsibilities




Review existing reporting and provide proposal for centralisation, simplification & optimisation which meets the needs of the financial & commercial leadership teams
Implement reporting & data solutions that help predict, improve and measure the success of key business outcomes with Abbott’s preferred tools: Power BI & Excel among others
Supporting HQ & regional finance teams on consolidation of data & data analytics
Maintenance of the reports & data systems in place and be the person of contact for data questions of stakeholders
Based on the reporting solutions in place provide analysis, insights & points of attention to regional and global management
Provide training to support the adoption and maintain documentation on processes and rules
Drive data accuracy, transparency, and standardization to support the business on forward-looking decision making
Active participation in improvement projects
Work with large, complex data sets to support consolidation and implementation of data solutions




Your Profile




University degree preferably in Finance, Business administration or Economics.
Highly proficient in Excel and PowerBI
Good experience with SAP ERP and Hyperion Planning/Essbase systems preferred.
You like working with large, complex data sets
High accuracy, thoroughness, and attention to detail.
Proven analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong Business Partnering skills
Self-motivated and pro-active, setting high standards for success.
Finance understanding is a plus
Related experience in the medical device or life sciences industry advantageous
Fluency in English




Abbott is offering an attractive salary package combined with good opportunities to learn and grow while working in a truly international work environment.




If you recognize yourself in this profile and you would like to know more about the opportunity, please apply online.
Show more Show less

Title: Senior data-analist
Description:
Jouw nieuwe functie

Als Senior data analyst zal je terechtkomen in het Data & Analytics team dat ondersteuning biedt bij het nemen van beslissingen. Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de verzameling, analyse en interpretatie van interne en externe gegevens uit verschillende systemen. Verder verwerk je deze tot inzichten en aanbevelingen die je op een visuele manier weet over te brengen en ondersteun je verschillende afdelingen bij de interpretatie van de resultaten. Hiernaast kan je de interne processen en programma’s doorgronden en kan je verbeteringen voorstellen. Een laatste aspect van jouw job is het ondersteunen van jouw collega’s bij de ontwikkeling en implementatie van Power BI rapporten.







Jouw profiel

Je beschikt over een diploma in een analytische richting. Daarnaast heb je reeds 5 jaar relevante ervaring in een data gerichte functie. Hiernaast wordt er van jou verwacht een goede kennis te hebben van Python en SQL en kennis van Databricks en/of Power BI is zeker een pluspunt. Verder kan je je vlot uitdrukken in het Nederlands en Engels. Je bent een teamplayer met oog voor detail, maar kan ook zelfstandig werken. Indien je ervaring hebt in een retail omgeving is dit een troef.




De arbeidsvoorwaarden

In ruil voor jouw job als Data Analyst zal je vergoed worden met een aantrekkelijk loonpakket. Je krijgt meerdere extralegale voordelen, een grondige opleiding en een uitdagende functie. In het pakket zit ook een bedrijfswagen met tankkaart inbegrepen.







Over de organisatie

Het bedrijf heeft bijzonder hoge anciënniteitscijfers en een heel laag verloop. Sterke idealen, collega’s die elke dag uniek maken, een dynamische werksfeer en een heel aangename bedrijfscultuur maken het bedrijf tot wat het vandaag is.

In ruil voor jouw job als Data Analyst zal je vergoed worden met een aantrekkelijk loonpakket. Je krijgt meerdere extralegale voordelen, een grondige opleiding en een uitdagende functie. In het pakket zit ook een bedrijfswagen met tankkaart inbegrepen.



Over de organisatie

Het bedrijf heeft bijzonder hoge anciënniteitscijfers en een heel laag verloop. Sterke idealen, collega’s die elke dag uniek maken, een dynamische werksfeer en een heel aangename bedrijfscultuur maken het bedrijf tot wat het vandaag is.

Title: Business Data Analyst - any Galapagos location
Description:
Pleased to meet you, we are Galapagos, a dynamic fast growing Biotech company. We’re in the business of changing lives.




Galapagos’ mission is to make a lasting positive contribution to society through discovery of innovative therapies for diseases with large unmet medical need. The company’s ambition is to become a leading global biopharmaceutical company, focused on the discovery, development and commercialization of innovative medicines to improve patients’ lives.




We are looking for a Business Data Analyst to join our Compliance & Ethics Team.




Scope of the job




With the commercialization of our first medicine in 2020, the Compliance & Ethics Team took off on its mission to equip the organization with value based principles and efficient processes to guide them in their interactions with Healthcare Professionals (HCP), Healthcare Organisations (HCO) an Patient Organisations (PO), thereby empowering teams to make sound ethical decisions.




As we grow, we gather more and more data on activities and built-in controls across systems and platforms. This function will structure, manage and bring that data to life, draw insights from it to share and support the markets and the organisation in getting assurance, in identifying and managing risks and opportunities.




Your role




Structure and shape our C&E data management, perform quantitative and qualitative analysis, and translate them into relevant insights for our team and our internal customers
Coordinate the external reporting requirements of transfers of values, this means collaborating with teams across the countries for the output while securing the accuracy of input with other departments such Finance, Procurement, ITS, Customer Insights
Maintain and shape output of C&E own process tools such as Fair Market Value, Declaration of Interest, Training log and contribute to the development of other future applications
Extract, clean and sample data to get suitable output for further analysis
Summarize all above in compliance metrics and KPIs and executive reports maintained and distributed regularly
Collaborate on cross-functional optimization of processes




Who are you?




You have a proven track record with
Datawarehousing (PowerBI/Qlik or similar),
Data Visualisation concepts
Data Reading Capabilities (cleaning & transformation)
MS Power Apps, Advanced Excel




in order to analyse data, identify trends and spot issues, to translate complex information into meaningful visual data and insights




You work on finding the root causes and have a structured approach to problem solving
You enjoy working closely with cross-functional stakeholders at multiple levels, helping them understand how data is relevant to their business and you have an end-user perspective mindset in how setting up solutions
You stay up to date in regards to data mining, optimisation, modelling, data-extraction, data validation and reporting
You have an interest in compliance & ethics matters in the pharmaceutical industry
You are fluent in English
You are a hands-on self-starter with the ability to work in a fast paced and growing organisation.
You will establish the roadmap and deliver quick wins where possible




What’s in it for you?




You will be part of a fast growing and amazing company. As ‘make-it-happener’ you will get all the support you need to make your job successful. At Galapagos we aim to recruit the best people, who stand out among their peers, with integrity and excellent interpersonal and organizational skills. Our employees are the strength behind Galapagos, a highly motivated team, eager to maintain Galapagos’ leading position and achieve breakthroughs in pharmaceutical research. Galapagos offers a competitive remuneration package and a dynamic work environment.




We are Galapagos : together we can make it happen…!

Title: Functional Analyst Data
Description:
About the Company: Who we are




Our client is a Belgian InsurTech company. Their mission is to combine their profound business knowledge and deep technology expertise to invent, build and integrate tailored digital solutions for companies in the insurance sector. They also provide technology-related consulting and project management services, thus helping their clients stand strong, and even get stronger, in a sector currently undergoing a complete transformation..




Job Summary




Passionate with data and analysis? Do you enjoy working on big digital transformation projects?




How about you join our high-performing team to deliver exceptional value through analytics and insights that will support and execute our projects for Life outcome.




We are looking for an enthusiastic Functional Analyst who will thrive in our data core team. We guarantee that you won't have time to get bored and you will certainly find interesting projects that suit you.




As a functional data analyst, you will be:




As a functional analyst, you serve as a liaison between the business and IT. You gather and analyze business requirements and needs to deliver functional analysis.




Responsible for analyzing business requirements, describing, and translating them into solutions for data migration projects
Convert these requirements into functional and non-functional requirements using user stories or use cases, and logical data models.
Work closely with business analysts and engineers to arrive at a supported and realistic solution.
Troubleshoot analytical and design issues to ensure the stability and proper operation of the applications.
Contribute to clarifying the priorities of the various requirements.




Are you someone who




Has a strong passion for data and functional analysis in the insurance sector - Data modeling, data migration, data warehousing, data analysis, and SQL business oriented are your greatest talents.
Has a full understanding of the processes of data migration, data quality, data cleansing, and data transformation
Is brimming with ideas and enjoys discussing them with colleagues.
Is communicative and, and have a very thorough knowledge of Dutch or French, and English
Enjoys working in an agile team




What can you expect from us?




A dynamic company on a human scale within which you can quickly make a mark.
Accessible management, close to the workforce and a warm working atmosphere.
A team full of highly skilled and qualified insurance experts who will support you throughout your career
A permanent employment contract with an exceptional annual compensation & benefits package, consisting of an above-market salary and a motivating bonus scheme
A job-relevant training: we strongly believe in a human approach and we consider your development very important. We offer you numerous courses to support you in your growth and ambitions throughout your career.
A harmonious balance between professional and private life thanks to generous holidays, flexible working hours and 2 to 3 days of homeworking a week.
An opportunity to join a fast-growing management consulting firm and grow together with us
Looking for an entrepreneurial spirit, that takes fun seriously, and an organisation with a human face, then you have come to the right place!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Python Predictions, a Tobania Company, is currently looking for an experienced Data Engineer.

In this role, you will need to be able to adapt quickly to new technologies, applications and environments. You will operate with our current clients on a medium to long-term basis.




As a Data Engineer, you will help our clients with building a variety of data applications in the cloud. This includes a broad range of competences, from understanding the requirements, setting up the proper cloud architecture all the way to developing and deploying the application.




More specifically, the responsibilities include:

Design complex analytics solutions with large data sets on distributed systems including the design of data lakes and (data) ingestion pipelines.
Identify design and implement process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-design infrastructure for greater scalability etc
Develop micro-services to serve data from the data lake or to expose machine learning models’ predictions to customer-facing products




Who are we looking for?

Required

Master’s degree or PhD in Computer Engineering, Information Technology or related field
At least 2 years of experience as a Data Engineer or in software engineering in a data context
Programming experience with one or more languages: Python, Scala, Java, C/C++, …
Knowledge of relational database technologies/concepts and SQL is required
Experience building, scheduling and maintaining data pipelines (Airflow, Data Factory, ...)
Understanding of Linux
Practical experience with at least one cloud provider (GCP, AWS or Azure). Certifications from any of these is considered a plus.
Knowledge of Git and CI/CD
Able to work independently, prioritize multiple stakeholders and tasks, and manage work time effectively.
Proficient in English, knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus.

Bonus

Experience with containers and container orchestration
Experience with big data technologies such as Apache Spark, Hadoop, etc
Interest in Data warehousing, Business Intelligence, Data Quality and Governance
Interest in Data Science and Machine Learning Engineering
Experience with streaming and incremental data pipelines




What do we have to offer?

Python Predictions is a Brussels-based service provider specialized in data projects with business impact
In January 2020, Python Predictions joined Tobania – a leading Belgian business & technology consulting firm that guides their clients through digital business transformation
Great variation in job content due to missions in different industries, different domains and different environments
In-company training adapted to your personal needs
Continuous learning in monthly team meetings and personal development time
A great team of colleagues with shared values
A workstation at one of our customers’ offices, at Python’s Brussels office but also at any Tobania’s location!
Show more Show less

Title: SQL Developer
Description:
Job Description

As an SQL Developer, you will develop MS-SQL queries and procedures, create custom reports, and modify ERP user forms to enhance organizational productivity. You will also be responsible for designing databases and ensuring their stability, reliability, and performance.

Responsibilities

· Develop high-quality database solutions.

· Use T-SQL to develop and implement procedures and functions.

· Review and interpret ongoing business report requirements.

· Research required data.

· Build appropriate and useful reporting deliverables.

· Analyze existing SQL queries for performance improvements.

· Suggest new queries.

· Develop procedures and scripts for data migration.

· Provide timely scheduled management reporting.

· Investigate exceptions with regard to asset movements.
