Title: HR Data Analyst & Product Owner (m/w/d)
HTML:
DEAR HR Controller & Product Owner,

welcome to our global ecosystem…


We believe that collaboration betters the world! If you want to go far, go together!

We are ordinary people doing extraordinary things!

We're in the people business. Our team is committed to collaboration and creating ambitious, world-class experiences for our clients and meaningful impact.

Our Manifesto: We put people in the center, we are positive by choice, we are winning through collaboration, we are unlocking education!


Join us on our way to something great!


What you will be doing:

AS HR Data Analyst you will be responsible for the 3 key missions HR data analysis, our HRIS and Compensation & Benefits.


HR data analysis:


  • You define HR KPIs in conjunction with the CBTW HR Leader and local HR Leaders and create reports accordingly;
  • You Set up, generate, and automate a variety of reports or queries using appropriate reporting tools - including Excel, Power BI and NAV (ERP);
  • You verify data integrity
  • You assist in maintaining data integrity in HR systems (Talentsoft & Nav) by analysing data.
  • You support newly merged companies in the group in the use and maintenance of their data


HRIS - Talentsoft


  • You propose, implement, support the evolutions of the HRIS and ensure its maintenance; · You manage the day-to-day functional and data administration of the system
  • You are the point of contact with the key users; · You collaborate with internal and external functional and technical teams to coordinate patches and improvements to the application;
  • You execute tests to ensure the proper functioning of the system, including the development of test plans;
  • You actively participate in change management (documentation updates, training, etc.)
  • You review and audit user access;
  • You extract and manage data analysis.


Compensation & Benefits


  • You analyse data on compensation, performance, job ratings in cooperation with local HR teams;
  • You conduct analyses for performance review and career committee ;
  • You conduct compensation benchmarks.



Who we are looking for:

  • You have proven experience of 3-5 years within the field of HR data analysis;
  • Your favorite utile is Excel;
  • You are familiar with Power BI, knowledge of Talentsoft is a plus;
  • You bring good skills in synthesis & reporting;
  • You are capable of joggling several projects at the same time;
  • You strive in a dynamic work environment;
  • You are outstanding in rigor, autonomy and proactivity;
  • You are business fluent in English and French



What we promise:

  • We offer evolution to our coworkers. Your track is adjusted individually according to your strength. It includes a structured integration period, 360 Feedback, Performance Plans and People Development Plans ;
  • We offer a culture that enhances entrepreneurship, solution orientation and collaboration. Transparency on all levels is key.
  • We think sustainable: with our social projects we want to create impact. By 2025, we will invest 1% of our revenue in global and local education
  • We have fun together: Afterwork events, sport events, annual Christmas parties and Career Committees.

Title: (Senior) Consultant Data Analyst/Data Scientist
Description:
Your Story




Can’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.




Your journey with us




Gather, clean and sample data to get suitable for further analysis.
Develop and demonstrate improved analysis methodologies and educate fellow team member and stakeholders
Act independently to identify opportunities for improved analysis or improved efficiency through better use of statistical tools
Be an in-between the data science team and the data engineering team, keeping in mind the challenges on both sides
Make big amounts of data tell stories and create change the client’s organization
Deliver analytically-informed, issue-based solutions that help clients make faster, smarter decisions
Work in a multidisciplinary team on projects in diverse industries, with a distinct interest for the business value of the data and the business context
Excel by delivering qualitative results and maintaining strong client relationship.




Let’s Talk About You




PhD in a relevant field like statistics, computer science or applied maths, physics or relevant subjects; or MSc with 4+ years of experience in computer science, applied mathematics, or other quantitative/computational discipline.
Strong background in statistical concepts and calculations
Comfort in manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources
Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis and analytic approaches in a clear, precise, and actionable manner
One or more of the following: R, Python or other; big data tools like Apache Spark or Hadoop; experience with UNIX operating systems and bash shell; familiarity with relational databases and SQL-like query languages; experience with performant geospatial analysis and geospatial visualization.
Experience with managing data analytics projects and steering teams;
You are a creative person, result-oriented and quality-driven and you have good communication skills;
Thanks to your good social, communication and presentation skills you know how to adapt to different types of environments and audiences.
You are a team player, but can also work independently;
You are fluent in English andspeak Dutch and/or French;
Consulting experience is an asset;
Prepared to travel up to 30% of your time.




Our Story




Our Risk Advisory practice is a global leader in helping clients manage risk and uncertainty from the boardroom to the network. We provide a broad array of services that allow our clients around the world to better measure, manage and control risk to enhance the reliability of systems and processes throughout their organization.




Our IT Risk Consulting and Internal Audit team aims to go beyond traditional compliance audits and acts as a truly trusted business advisor ready to deliver added value to its clients, whether it’s in the private or public sector, nationally or internationally. Through our audit and advisory services in Technology and Digital Risk Consulting, we help clients realize successful digital transformations, manage technology, and mitigate digital risks.




Who is Deloitte? World-leading professional services firm, we offer value added services in audit & assurance, risk advisory, accounting, tax & legal, consulting and financial advisory.




+6.000 dedicated professionals, active in +10 offices throughout the country, take great pride in supporting our clients with multidisciplinary expertise, industry knowledge, and innovative solutions. We offer services to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.




Why Deloitte?




Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.




Never stop growing! Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.




We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.




Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:




My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities
Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte
Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents@Deloitte
Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities




Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangements remains essential in today's reality:




Hybrid workplace: combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).
Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime




Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

Title: IT Analyst - Digital Workplace
Description:
Workplace Services Solutions Lead - IT Analyst




At AXA Belgium, the mission of the Workplace Services teams is to enable our Workforce with reliable Workplace capabilities to ensure efficient (hybrid) collaboration where and whenever they need it and this in a secured environment.




The Workplace Services team aims to deliver, support and make evolve a range of Workplace, Building Facilities and IT4IT solutions used by AXA Belgium Employees.

The Workplace Services team works in close collaboration with various AXA teams (IT, Business and AXA GO) and external suppliers to ensure the best quality of service.




The activities delivered by the Workplace Services teams are covering the following solutions: Physical and virtual workstations, software packaging and licensing, workforce collaboration solutions (Office 365, secure data exchange, …), telephony services, Meeting Rooms, Office Printing, Translation Services, , Network connectivity, Enterprise backlog, timesheeting & ITSM Management solutions, …




We are currently seeking to reinforce the team by appointing a Workplace Services Solutions Lead.




Your responsibilities as Workplace Services Solutions Lead :




You actively contribute to the delivery of Epics / Features to improve Workplace Services solutions and processes to achieve a better Employee Experience.

You actively participate in the feature / product team backlog and makes sure it’s aligned with the IT strategy and provided roadmap.

You contribute to requirements definition (what) and refine the user / customer needs in more detail

You actively participate in the governances in place with the partners including the continuous improvement process.

You identify structural improvements (e.g. recurrent incidents) and helps to identify structural solutions

You influence the roadmap and contribute to the continuous process improvement of the security and quality of the services we deliver to our customer.

You drive QoS situations where expert knowledge is required: understanding-challenging the problem, bringing solutions, supporting teams in the implementation and share lessons learned afterwards to improve overall.

You co-create plans (per Delivery Iteration / Sprint) and estimate size & complexity of work.

You ensure proper communication of identified risks to the Product Lead and Feature Manager




Your profile:




· You like to question current processes and propose alternatives a response;

· You dare to challenge based on value, dare to take risks, dare to take commitments.

· You are a role model and promote cultural change inside the team: empowerment, learning / growth culture

· You have an Agile mindset, carry it out via behaviour and take full benefit of it

· You stress prioritization on customer value to have value-driven governance

· You have a good understanding of Workplace Services tools / environments

· Very good knowledge of English (knowledge of French or Dutch is an asset)




Your skills:




· Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Business, IT or other related field or equivalent training

· Minimum of 10 years of industry experience in IT services

· Extensive written and oral communication skills (English)

· Analytical, communication and coordination skills are required to understand and document the requirements from the customers

· Capacity to perform impact analysis and to understand / document what needs to be done (slicing features, user stories, estimations … )

· Experience in coordinating with different (internal / external) suppliers.

· Software background skills required as the daily activities cover building, collaboration and IT4IT applications.

· Experience with ServiceNow ITSM and Broadcom solutions is a plus

· Experience with identifying & investigating reoccurring issues and working with responsible support groups on addressing them (e.g. Network, Software packaging & distribution, Security, Service Desk, Onsite Support)

· Knowledge of ITIL Processes and Agile methodology.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Join Ascent and help us do extraordinary things with data for our customers!




About The Role

This role is currently open in Bulgaria, Malta, and Portugal.

As a Data Engineer at Ascent, you get to work at the heart of our customer businesses to understand their data problems, identify needs and develop solutions to help them. You’ll join our practice of market-leading data professionals and work typically as part of a cross-functional team on customer projects, supporting their journey through digital transformation, or helping them do existing things in a much better way.




What You’ll Do

As a Data Engineer, you’ll work to design and create pipelines that transform data in a scalable and repeatable way. Producing efficient code that automates the process of ingesting and cleaning the data, you then develop and apply appropriate mechanisms so that data flows toward target data sources as required.

Depending on the project, your daily responsibilities could be quite varied, but typically our Data Engineers:

Understand, build and develop ETL and data integration solutions using a wide array of technologies and data sources
Work with big data components and migration strategies
Work with cloud-based infrastructure (Google, AWS, and Azure) for hosting data solutions and applications.

You’ll also get called on from time to time to support Ascent marketing colleagues, pre-sales teams, and key partners with some subject matter expertise in data engineering. We’re adding to a strong team of data experts in our business, so this is a great time to join us as we’re growing in our core locations across the UK, Malta, Bulgaria, Portugal, and Spain.




Skills And Experience Required

We’re looking for people with good data engineering skills, and you’ll ideally bring with you:

Proven role experience in developing ETL and data integration solutions
Good knowledge of the Azure data engineering stack - Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse, Azure Data Lake, Azure Blob, Cosmos DB
Capability in using Databricks, Snowflake, and/or Spark
Good experience in general programming – ideally Python

You’ll have experience working with data warehouse solutions, extracting and processing data in various ways using off-the-shelf tools and open-source tools. You’ll also be really familiar with working with Linux or Windows operating systems and version control systems (Git).

We work in Agile methodologies as a preference, so being comfortable working in this way is important. You should be comfortable in a customer-facing situation where you’ll need to communicate clearly and effectively in English – often with people who might not be as technically experienced, so good written and verbal English skills are important. You should be someone who is passionate about team collaboration and knowledge sharing, with the passion and drive to achieve goals and targets. We value empathy in our colleagues, and it’s important you bring a growth mindset and a willingness to learn and adapt.




Working at Ascent

We choose hybrid working, where you balance time at the office or with your customers with working at home. You'll earn a competitive salary, with a good range of benefits. Our offices are places to connect and collaborate with colleagues, with socials and regular get-togethers. We take your development and growth seriously, with plenty of opportunities to acquire skills and get certified.




Ascent is an equal opportunities employer. We take intentional steps to ensure inclusion and belonging are something real here, not just something we talk about. No person will be treated less favorably because of their gender, pregnancy, maternity status, marital or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, race, nationality, ethnic origin, age, religion or belief, or disability status. Please let us know when you apply if you require any reasonable accommodation.

If you have any questions contact our Talent Acquisition team at recruitment@ascent.io.

Title: Data Compliance Analyst Pharma
Description:
USG Professionals Science is verantwoordelijk voor het ondersteunen van klanten in de farmaceutische en biotechnologische sector. Voor één van onze klanten, internationale farmaceutische speler zijn we op zoek naar een Project Engineer voor het Data Integrity Projects Team.




Je komt terecht in het Data Integrity Projects Team waar je aan de slag gaat als Project Engineer.

In dit team staat ownership vanboven en staat teamwerk centraal. De projecten waar je verantwoordelijk voor bent hebben een invloed op de hele site waardoor je veel zal samenwerken met verschillende collega’s.




Jouw takenpakket bestaat uit het volgende:




· Grote projecten tot stand brengen: planning, training geven, rapporteren en stakeholder management.

· Je bent het aanspreekpunt voor je team.

· Je zorgt voor een compliance gap analyse (met hulp van een risk-based approach)

· Je schrijft procedures en werkinstructies uit.

· Je zorgt ervoor dat elk project voldoet aan de afgesproken budgetten en deadlines.

· Je vormt een netwerk van contactpersonen zodat je jouw projecten succesvol kan volbrengen met je team.




Jouw profiel




Je hebt een Master diploma in farmaceutische wetenschappen / bio ingenieur/ industrieel ingenieur/ apotheker/ informatica of gelijkwaardig door ervaring.
Ervaring met productie/laboprocessen/computer systemen
Ervaring bij voorkeur in een GMP omgeving
Je werkt georganiseerd en accuraat
Je bent communicatief sterk, strategisch en zeer stressbestendig.
Je bent een echte teamplayer en werkt graag met verschillende klanten
Zeer goede beheersing van het Nederlands en Engels (zowel mondeling als schriftelijk).
Sterke kennis van MS Office




Aanbod

USG Professionals biedt een contract van onbepaalde duur inclusief:

Optie tot firmawagen met tankkaart (ook voor privé gebruik).
Hospitalisatie-en groepsverzekering.
Maaltijdcheques 8eur.
Dagvergoeding afhankelijk van jouw ervaring.
GSM vergoeding.
13e maand, ecocheques, sport-en cultuurcheques.




Bovendien vinden we het belangrijk om te investeren in onze consultants. Zowel door het aanbieden van verschillende opleidingen als het aanbieden van events en teambuildingactiviteiten.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We’re looking for Data Engineers who like to THINK BIG.




At Big Industries, we have the ambition to become the number one trusted advisor in data solutions. We offer expert consulting for Architecture definition, cloud and classic Data Lake deployments and advanced Data Engineering. If you want to work with data, we’re the best place to start!




Right now, we’re looking for Data Engineers who are as passionate as we are about new technology. Thanks to our wide variety of clients and big projects, you will always be able to keep growing as a professional. And whether you’re working on a project by yourself or with another Big Industries colleague, you can always count on your teammates for support!




So, what exactly will you be doing?




You will be implementing complex and large scale data projects.
Collecting, parsing, managing, analyzing and visualizing large data sets.
Turning raw data into insights using multiple toolsets, techniques and cloud based platforms (we partner with cloud providers AWS and Microsoft Azure and "Best of Breed" vendors like Cloudera and Confluent).
Occasionally, you will develop and implement various statistical and machine learning models and you are in charge of controlling the performances of your models output.







What do you need to do a stellar job?




Some solid background to take on big projects. We’re thinking in terms of a degree in Computing or about 3 years of relevant experience within systems integration teams.
A thorough understanding of Java and SQL and a solid grasp of best practices in software development.
Experience using big data and related technologies (like Spark, Python, Scala, Kafka).
Willingness to become AWS or Confluent Certified Developer.
Very good knowledge of Linux Systems and shell scripting.
A positive attitude and willingness to feed our family feel, share your wisdom and help your colleagues grow (like they will do for you).




We’ll think you're extra cool if you…




Are good at coming up with memes (or posing for them).
Own a 1989 Gameboy and are willing to share it, ‘cause we’ve lost ours.




What’s in it for you?




At Big Industries, we want you to become the professional you want to be. That’s why you’ll always have your team of experienced colleagues to help you and all the tools you need to do an amazing job.




Money and stuff…

A nice salary package with extra benefits, such as home office allowance, eco vouchers,...
A car you will want to show off to your family (with Benelux fuel card).
A nice phone (of your choice) and laptop (Apple by default) to share funny memes with your colleagues.
A lunch allowance (if bullies steal it, don’t come crying to us).
A health and pension plan, to keep you happy and healthy now and when you’re in diapers!




But at least equally important:

Membership of our Big Industries Academy to keep learning any way you want.
A personalized training plan and a budget to register for the training courses you need.
Monthly check-ins to see how you’re doing (we’ll provide the tissues if it’s bad).
Regular team events to keep connected with your colleagues as well as spontaneous, informal drinks.
An awesome team that will always have your back, in person or via Slack!

Title: Functional Analyst Data
Description:
À propos de l'entreprise : Qui sommes-nous ?




Notre client est une société belge d'Insurtech. Leur mission est de combiner leur profonde connaissance Business et leur profonde expertise technologique pour innove, construire et intégrer des solutions Tech sur mesure pour les entreprises en secteur assurance. Ils fournissent également des services de conseil et de gestion de projets liés à la technologie, aidant ainsi leurs clients à rester forts, et même à devenir plus forts, dans un secteur qui subit actuellement une transformation complète....




Description du poste




Vous êtes passionné par Data et les analyses ? Vous aimez travailler sur de grands projets de transformation Tech?




Et si vous rejoigniez notre équipe très performante pour fournir une valeur exceptionnelle grâce à des analyses et des informations qui soutiendront et exécuteront nos projets pour le résultat de la vie.




Nous sommes à la recherche d'un analyste fonctionnel enthousiaste qui s'épanouira dans notre équipe centrale de données. Nous vous garantissons que vous n'aurez pas le temps de vous ennuyer et que vous trouverez certainement des projets intéressants qui vous correspondent.




En tant qu'analyste de données fonctionnel, vous serez :




En tant qu'analyste fonctionnel, vous assurez la liaison entre l'entreprise et l'informatique. Vous recueillez et analysez les exigences et les besoins de l'entreprise afin de fournir une analyse fonctionnelle.




Vous êtes responsable de l'analyse des exigences commerciales, de leur description et de leur traduction en solutions pour les projets de migration de données.
Convertissez ces exigences en exigences fonctionnelles et non fonctionnelles en utilisant des user stories ou des cas d'utilisation, et des modèles logiques de données.
Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les analystes commerciaux et les ingénieurs pour parvenir à une solution soutenue et réaliste.
Dépanner les problèmes d'analyse et de conception afin d'assurer la stabilité et le bon fonctionnement des applications.
Contribuer à clarifier les priorités des diverses exigences.




Êtes-vous quelqu'un qui




A une forte passion pour les données et l'analyse fonctionnelle dans le secteur de l'assurance - La modélisation des données, la migration des données, l'entreposage des données, l'analyse des données et le SQL orienté métier sont vos plus grands talents.
Comprend parfaitement les processus de migration des données, de qualité des données, de nettoyage des données et de transformation des données.
Déborde d'idées et aime en discuter avec ses collègues.
Est communicatif et a une connaissance très approfondie du néerlandais ou du français et de l'anglais.
Aime travailler dans une équipe Agile




Que pouvez-vous attendre de nous?




Une entreprise dynamique à taille humaine au sein de laquelle vous pouvez rapidement vous faire une place.
Un management accessible, proche des salariés et une ambiance de travail chaleureuse.
Une équipe composée d'experts en assurance hautement qualifiés et compétents qui vous soutiendront tout au long de votre carrière.
Un contrat de travail à durée indéterminée assorti d'une rémunération annuelle et d'un ensemble d'avantages exceptionnels, comprenant un salaire supérieur au marché et un système de primes motivants.
Une formation adaptée au poste : nous croyons fermement à une approche humaine et nous considérons votre développement comme très important. Nous vous proposons de nombreux cours pour vous accompagner dans votre croissance et vos ambitions tout au long de votre carrière.
Un équilibre harmonieux entre vie professionnelle et vie privée grâce à des vacances généreuses, des horaires de travail flexibles et 2 à 3 jours de travail à domicile par semaine.
Une opportunité de rejoindre un cabinet de conseil en management en pleine croissance et de grandir avec nous.
Vous recherchez un esprit d'entreprise, qui prend le plaisir au sérieux, et une organisation à visage humain, alors vous êtes au bon endroit !
Show more Show less

  • Comprend parfaitement les processus de migration des données, de qualité des données, de nettoyage des données et de transformation des données.
  • Déborde d'idées et aime en discuter avec ses collègues.
  • Est communicatif et a une connaissance très approfondie du néerlandais ou du français et de l'anglais.
  • Aime travailler dans une équipe Agile


Que pouvez-vous attendre de nous?


  • Une entreprise dynamique à taille humaine au sein de laquelle vous pouvez rapidement vous faire une place.
  • Un management accessible, proche des salariés et une ambiance de travail chaleureuse.
  • Une équipe composée d'experts en assurance hautement qualifiés et compétents qui vous soutiendront tout au long de votre carrière.
  • Un contrat de travail à durée indéterminée assorti d'une rémunération annuelle et d'un ensemble d'avantages exceptionnels, comprenant un salaire supérieur au marché et un système de primes motivants.
  • Une formation adaptée au poste : nous croyons fermement à une approche humaine et nous considérons votre développement comme très important. Nous vous proposons de nombreux cours pour vous accompagner dans votre croissance et vos ambitions tout au long de votre carrière.
  • Un équilibre harmonieux entre vie professionnelle et vie privée grâce à des vacances généreuses, des horaires de travail flexibles et 2 à 3 jours de travail à domicile par semaine.
  • Une opportunité de rejoindre un cabinet de conseil en management en pleine croissance et de grandir avec nous.
  • Vous recherchez un esprit d'entreprise, qui prend le plaisir au sérieux, et une organisation à visage humain, alors vous êtes au bon endroit !

Title: Junior Data Engineer – NL mandatory
Description:
At DXC Technology, we act as an independent, trusted advisor in digitizing the client’s business. Our employees are responsible for optimizing our customer’s industry processes in many different market domains as well as developing, implementing and managing their IT data related mechanisms.

DXC Luxoft advises, develops, and implements modern analytics and AI solutions by applying industry expertise, technology and business solutions and services, proven methodologies, and experienced people. With our offerings, capabilities, and global reach, organizations accelerate digital transformation and confidently produce repeatable, AI-powered business outcomes. We work with our customers to convert data to information, information to insights and insights to better business outcomes.

In our DXC Analytics team we are currently looking for a Data Engineer. Typical areas where you will work in are: Analytics Solutions and Services, Big Data Platforms, Artificial Intelligence and IoT.




Essential Job Functions:

· Designing and implementing batch and real-time data ingestion pipelines for Azure Data Lake or similar cloud based (e.g. AWS/GCP) data warehouse or data lake solutions

· Implementing data quality checks

· Implementing data lineage and reconciliation mechanisms (including monitoring dashboards and alerts)

· Implementing data cataloguing, archiving and disaster recovery

· Working with data source and data consumption teams to align on data structures and schemas




Mandatory Skills:

· Familiarity with modern, cloud-based data/BI technologies (data lakes, data warehouses, ETL/ELT, Spark)

· Experience with implementing data ingestion pipelines / ETLs / ELTs

· General knowledge of Azure or comparable platform and ecosystem - Storage Account, CosmosDB (SQL & Gremlin API), Event Hub, App Services

· Experience with at least 3 of following Azure data technologies, or similar technologies for competitive Cloud technologies:

· Azure SQL

· Azure Data Lake

· Azure Databricks (SQL or Python, Delta Lake)

· Azure Data Factory

· Azure Analysis Services

· Experience with SQL, Python

· Bachelor or higher degree in Informatics, Business Engineering, Computer Science or related technical discipline

· 1 to 3 years of field experience in a similar role

· Fluency in Dutch and English. French is considered an additional benefit




What you’ll get:

· A motivating salary package, including fringe benefits and flexible working hours, and possibilities to work from home

· Being part of an ambitious and growing team.

· On-the-job training and access to our online platform “DXC-University”

· Opportunities to work with the latest technologies for a top range of customers

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer

Data | AWS | Snowflake | Python | Apache Airflow




Fully remote Data Engineer based in Europe required by a UK based fintech to make an impact in a growing business on a mission to change the face of the consumer finance industry forever. This Data Engineer should have excellent knowledge of Redshift/Snowflake, AWS, Python and Apache Airflow. This role is fully remote and they are looking for someone to start as soon as possible




Location: Remote in Europe.

Salary: Up to £80,000 per annum




Data Engineer Requirements:

Strong AWS experience
Knowledge of Snowflake
Experience building data pipelines, using tools such as Airflow.
Proficient coding in Python and Apache Spark




Data Engineer Desirables:

Experience of financial services or consumer finance
Understanding of SCRUM and Agile principles
IaaC such as Terraform or AWS CloudFormation




Keywords:

Data | AWS | Snowflake | Python | Apache Airflow

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer - Up to €85,000 DOE – Azure, Python/PySpark, ETL

Belgium (Remote)




Must be fluent in English AND Dutch




Company:




This company is one of the biggest global data consultancies in existence. They provide data solutions and empowerment through data for a wide variety of their clients. They have over 100,000 employees in over 60 countries, and are looking to add some new data engineers to their expanding European function.




Role:




As a Data Engineer, you will be:




Designing and deploying both batch and real-time data pipeline for Azure Data Lakes
Implementing data quality checks
Creating and improving data lineage mechanisms (such as monitoring dashboards)
Work on data archiving and data recovery projects
Communicating and working with stakeholders and non-technical employees.




Requirements:




Solid experience with Azure and its microservices (preferred) AWS and GCP also accepted
Hands on coding experience with coding with Python
Exposure to BI technologies like ETL/ELT, data warehousing, data lakes
Hands on experience with other essential technologies such as SQL and Spark




Benefits:




Highly competitive salary with full benefits package
Flexible working hours with the opportunity to work from home
Being part of an elite team of experts in a collaborative environment
Tailored training and development with access to a wide range of online resources
Working with modern technology with industry leading firms




If you're a Data Engineer wanting to work on exciting, high-value projects who values a strong and progressive culture, please do not hesitate to apply!




***SPONSORSHIP IS NOT AVAILABLE FOR THIS ROLE***

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
As a Data Engineer, you will be in charge of:



Designing solutions following architecture guidelines
Contributing to data engineering-related developments: development activities consist in building and maintaining efficient, reusable, and reliable solutions, as per high standard of software quality, design and testing principles while delivering solutions on-time and on-budget
Supporting continuous improvement of the services and applications. Identifying bottlenecks and bugs, and defining solutions to these problems
Delivering production ready services to users with the highest level of satisfaction
Writing and updating technical documentations in English and making them available to the team and partners.
Providing effective and timely communication to all relevant teams











Qualifications



You must have extensive experience of 3 years minimumin addition to excellent analytical skills, accuracy, and good listening and communication skills.



You must have extensive experience in the activities outlined below in addition to:



Ability to collect information focusing on the Why.
Ability to solve problems creatively and effectively
Be open to receiving objective criticism and improving upon it.
Fluent in English and French.
Familiar with reliability engineering approaches (Dev/Sec/Ops, SRE, etc.) for regularly ingested data workloads

Skills required



Knowledge of data management, data engineering, and data governance
Knowledge of data architecture, data security, protection, and privacy
Proficient with SQL (DDL and DML)
Experience building data pipelines and data processing systems
Knowledge of data lake, database, and/or data warehouse architectures for analytical workloads (e.g. OLAP)
Strong understanding of design principles, algorithms, data structures, and software engineering best practices
Experience with modern data warehousing solutions such as Snowflake, RedShift, Databricks

Nice to have



Strong problem solving and analytical skills
Proficient in Python and/or other modern languages used for batch data processing
Experience with data ingestion, transformations (ETL/ELT), data modeling, data analysis and data mining
NoSQL experience
Familiarity with DevOps concepts, CI/CD pipelines, and orchestrating/scheduling/maintaining data workflows (e.g. developed and/or monitored with Apache Airflow)
Experience building data visualizations (data dashboards e.g. with PowerBI) and producing data-driven reports
Experience supporting BI analytical and/or data science workloads in production


Additional Information



The team is located in Brussels but occasional travels to Paris can be expected.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Greetings from Ampstek!!!




Hope you are doing well!




This is Robert, Recruiter at Ampstek.




We have multiple openings for Data Engineers working fully remote.




I would like to have a quick chat with you and discuss in detail our open roles.




If we got you attention please share your updated resume with robert.t@ampstek.com.




Kindly Find the Job Description Below :




Job title: Data Engineer

Type: Contract - Full Remote

Location: Europe




These are the mandatory skillsets – Python, Spark, SQL, Kafka, Airflow, AWS
Should have strong Python development experience.
8+ years of software engineering experience. 5 years of relevant experience.




Data Architecture using Parquet, Avro, and Star Scheme
Data Ingestion design pattern
Ability to design application components and evolve architecture including UI, API/Services, Data Access, Integration, Application components, etc.
Build tools to automate the monitoring or workload and take proactive measures to scale the platform or to fix the problem.
Research and develop a proof of concept on integrations to new platforms.
Develop technical tools and programming that leverage big-data techniques to cleanse, organize and transform data and to maintain and update data structures and integrity on an automated basis.
You have experience leading a high-performing team that solved challenging technical problems.




Thanks and Regards,

Robert.T

IT Recruiter | Europe

Ampstek Services Limited

Title: Data Analist - Regio Zaventem
Description:
Beschrijving onderneming




Interesse of vragen bij onderstaande vacature? Contacteer me dan zeker op i.rottier@madison.be of +32 4 98 76 11 66




Deze internationale organisatie is sinds jaar en dag een gekende speler op vlak van op maat aangebode business consulting. Vandaag de dag kijken ze uit om hun intern data team te laten groeien met een extra aanwinst!




In deze rol als Data Analist sta je in voor het optimaliseren van bedrijfsprocessen met sterke focus op het data analyse gedeelte.




Als Data Analist ondersteun je data integraties naar alle andere mogelijke business units binnen de organisatie!




Je zal de huidige systemen verbeteren en de tools verder automatiseren om zo efficiënter en doeltreffender te werk te kunnen gaan.




Met Andere Woorden




Als Data Analist hou je je bezig met het verzamelen en controleren van gegevens om deze te verwerken tot informatie. Deze informatie wordt vervolgens geanalyseerd en omgezet in kennis. De verkregen kennis kan weer door het bedrijf in de besluitvorming worden gebruikt om de juiste keuzes te maken en een strategie te bepalen.




Verzamelen en ordenen van relevante data.
Controleren van de data op correctheid.
Het ontwikkelen van datamodellen, rapporten en statistieken.
Uitbrengen van advies aan het management.
Het bouwen van KPI gerelateerde dashboards.




Profiel




Je hebt reeds enkele jaren ervaring in soortgelijke functie
Sterke kennis van Excel is een vereiste, ervaring met QlikSense is mooi meegenomen
Al als gebruiker met SAP gewerkt? Dit is een pluspunt maar zeker geen must!
Je bent analytisch ingesteld en weet zelfstandig te werken
Timemanagement heb je goed onder de knie, schrik om een presentatie te geven heb je zeker niet!




Aanbod




Je kan je verwachten aan een marktconform loon in lijn met je ervaring en expertise.
Maaltijdcheques.
Groeps- en hospitalisatieverzekering.
Een nettovergoeding.
Opleidingsdagen.
32 vakantiedagen.

#IT

Title: Functional Analyst Data
Description:
Over het bedrijf: Wie we zijn




Onze klant is een Belgisch Insurtech bedrijf. Hun missie is om hun diepgaande zakelijke kennis en diepgaande technologische expertise te combineren om digitale oplossingen op maat te bedenken, te bouwen en te integreren voor bedrijven in de verzekeringssector. Ze leveren ook technologiegerelateerde advies- en projectmanagementdiensten en helpen zo hun klanten sterk te staan, en zelfs sterker te worden, in een sector die momenteel een complete transformatie ondergaat....




Functieomschrijving




Heeft u een passie voor data en analyse? Werkt u graag aan grote digitale transformatieprojecten?




Wat dacht u ervan om ons goed presterende team te versterken en uitzonderlijke waarde te leveren via analytics en inzichten die onze projecten ondersteunen en uitvoeren.




We zijn op zoek naar een enthousiaste Functional Analyst die zal gedijen in ons data core team. We garanderen dat u geen tijd hebt om u te vervelen en u zult zeker interessante projecten vinden die bij u passen.




Als functioneel data-analist bent u:




Als functioneel analist bent u de schakel tussen de business en IT. U verzamelt en analyseert business requirements en behoeften om functionele analyses te leveren.




Verantwoordelijk voor het analyseren van business requirements, het beschrijven en vertalen ervan in oplossingen voor datamigratieprojecten.
Deze vereisten omzetten in functionele en niet-functionele vereisten met behulp van user stories of use cases, en logische datamodellen.
Nauw samenwerken met business analisten en engineers om tot een gedragen en realistische oplossing te komen.
Oplossen van analytische en ontwerp problemen om de stabiliteit en goede werking van de applicaties te garanderen.
Bijdragen aan het verduidelijken van de prioriteiten van de verschillende vereisten.




Bent u iemand die




Een sterke passie heeft voor data en functionele analyse in de verzekeringssector - Datamodellering, datamigratie, datawarehousing, data-analyse en SQL business oriented zijn je grootste talenten.
Een volledig begrip heeft van de processen van datamigratie, datakwaliteit, data cleansing en datatransformatie
Boordevol ideeën zit en bespreekt deze graag met collega's.
Communicatief is en, en hebt een zeer grondige kennis van het Nederlands of Frans, en het Engels
Graag werkt in een Agile team




Wat kunt u van ons verwachten?




Een dynamisch bedrijf op mensenmaat waarbinnen u zich snel kunt profileren.
Een toegankelijk management, dicht bij het personeel en een warme werksfeer.
Een team vol hoogopgeleide en gekwalificeerde verzekeringsexperts die u gedurende uw hele carrière zullen ondersteunen.
Een vaste arbeidsovereenkomst met een uitzonderlijk jaarlijks compensatie- en voordelenpakket, bestaande uit een bovengemiddeld salaris en een motiverende bonusregeling
Een arbeidsrelevante opleiding: wij geloven sterk in een menselijke benadering en vinden jouw ontwikkeling erg belangrijk. Wij bieden u tal van opleidingen aan om u tijdens uw loopbaan te ondersteunen in uw groei en ambities.
Een harmonieus evenwicht tussen werk en privéleven dankzij royale vakantiedagen, flexibele werktijden en 2 tot 3 dagen thuiswerk per week.
Een kans om bij een snelgroeiend managementadviesbureau te werken en samen met ons te groeien
Op zoek naar een ondernemersgeest, die plezier serieus neemt, en een organisatie met een menselijk gezicht, dan ben je bij ons aan het juiste adres!
Show more Show less

Wat kunt u van ons verwachten?


  • Een dynamisch bedrijf op mensenmaat waarbinnen u zich snel kunt profileren.
  • Een toegankelijk management, dicht bij het personeel en een warme werksfeer.
  • Een team vol hoogopgeleide en gekwalificeerde verzekeringsexperts die u gedurende uw hele carrière zullen ondersteunen.
  • Een vaste arbeidsovereenkomst met een uitzonderlijk jaarlijks compensatie- en voordelenpakket, bestaande uit een bovengemiddeld salaris en een motiverende bonusregeling
  • Een arbeidsrelevante opleiding: wij geloven sterk in een menselijke benadering en vinden jouw ontwikkeling erg belangrijk. Wij bieden u tal van opleidingen aan om u tijdens uw loopbaan te ondersteunen in uw groei en ambities.
  • Een harmonieus evenwicht tussen werk en privéleven dankzij royale vakantiedagen, flexibele werktijden en 2 tot 3 dagen thuiswerk per week.
  • Een kans om bij een snelgroeiend managementadviesbureau te werken en samen met ons te groeien
  • Op zoek naar een ondernemersgeest, die plezier serieus neemt, en een organisatie met een menselijk gezicht, dan ben je bij ons aan het juiste adres!

Title: Audit & Data Analytics Consultant
Description:
Your Story




Can’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.




Your Journey with us




Absolute numbers are useless. It is only when we ask the question ‘so what?’ that we can give meaning to data. We are passionate about what we do. We know our role as auditors goes far beyond checking figures and financials. We focus on quantitative analysis, explanatory and predictive modelling, fact-based management as well as data quality and integrity. Simply put, we bring data to life and we create insights to help our clients properly manage business risk and turn these risks into opportunities. As an Audit and Data Analytics Consultant, you will have a key role within our audit team.




Become an expert in data mining, optimization, modelling, data extraction, data validation and reporting
Extract, clean and sample data to get suitable output for further analysis
Integrate, validate and manipulate data using SQL
Support audit teams with your expertise to build bespoke analytics
Create compelling data stories to help make CXO-level decisions
You will manage multiple projects and report to management
As you grow in your job, you will be responsible for quality of end-deliverables
You will be the point of contact for clients, audit teams and guide other consultants
You will develop your audit and data analytical capabilities and skills as you will be exposed to top specialists who will share their experience
You will work on a variety of interesting and challenging assignments
You will expand your network as you work with professionals who will coach you




Let’s Talk About You




You have a Bachelor or a Master degree, a first working experience is a plus
You are proficient in English (Dutch and/or French is a plus)
You have experience working with databases and writing SQL statements
You have experience with BI applications (Power BI, Qlick, Tableau,...)
You have basic knowledge of programming and scripting (knowledge of VBA is a plus)
You believe your analytical mind and your curiosity are your greatest assets
You love data in all its forms and you continue to see the big picture
You work out the why and have a structured approach to problem solving
You are a great communicator and you are not afraid to ask questions
You enjoy working closely with clients
You enjoy helping clients understand how data is relevant to their business
You are not afraid of a technical challenge
You are creative and know how to turn raw data into actionable visuals




Our Story




Deloitte Audit & Assurance is about much more than just the numbers. It’s about attesting to accomplishments and challenges, and helping to assure strong foundations for future aspirations. Deloitte illuminates the what, how, and why of change so you’re always ready to act ahead. We do this by performing audits of financial figures and other data, reviewing the efficiency and effectiveness of processes, procedures, systems, and organizations as well as solving problems and offering expert insights.




Who is Deloitte? World-leading professional services firm, we offer value added services in audit & assurance, risk advisory, accounting, tax & legal, consulting and financial advisory.




+6000 dedicated professionals, active in +10 offices throughout the country, take great pride in supporting our clients with multidisciplinary expertise, industry knowledge, and innovative solutions. We offer services to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.




Why Deloitte?




Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.




Never stop growing! Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.




We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.




Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:




My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities
Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte
Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents@Deloitte
Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities




Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangements remains essential in today's reality:




Hybrid workplace: combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).
Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.




Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

Title: Data Analytics Consultant
Description:
Line of Service
Advisory



Industry/Sector
Not Applicable



Specialism
Managed Services



Management Level
Associate



Job Description & Summary

We guide. We support. You grow.

PwC Advisory is a network of multiple possibilities - where you want to make an impact is always up to you. Working in PwC Advisory services offers a roadmap of possibilities, and you’re in the driver’s seat. With the full support of our Advisory teams, you’ll delve into the inner workings of companies to find the best solutions for any challenge they may be facing. You’ll provide the core expertise and insights required to help transform our client’s business into future-proof organizations. A career within Managed Services, will provide you with the opportunity to help our clients face their big complex and operational problems. We focus on understanding the forces shaping their business and developing industry tailored solutions that support our clients through the entire lifecycle. As a (senior) associate within the Data Analytics Support Team, you'll get the opportunity to help our clients solve their complex business issues from strategy to execution and beyond. 

Are you looking for a challenging job in a dynamic and innovative environment? You are about to find the perfect match!

Are you a data and IT enthusiast who also talks the language of business? Do you have a passion for solving complex data-based problems, creating and developing reports, dashboards and troubleshooting data errors and issues? 
 

What you will do and learn:

You help our clients in the support and execution of their data and analytics of it.



Act as point of contact to collect, clean, transform and analyze data for efficient decision making to meet business expectation

Report and modelize key insights from performed analysis to be shared with key stakeholders.

Participate in the data analytics tool selection process (RfX, etc.) 

Working closely with different teams to ensure issues and requests are addressed timely

Identify and make suggestions for improvements when problems and/or opportunities arise

Share and collaborate effectively with others

Communicate confidently in a clear, concise and articulate manner – verbally and in the materials I produce

Build and maintain an internal and external network

Use creative problem-solving methods and work in an international, multidisciplinary team

Uphold the firm's code of ethics and business conduct

Seek opportunities to learn about how PwC works as a global network of firms

 
Who you are 

A bachelor/master in IT (management) or IT technology-related programmes or Business Administration/Management, Economics, Computer and Information Science, or any other relevant degree that showcases your capabilities

You have a strong interest in data analytics, IT tools and the opportunities they offer as well as a good understanding of how to leverage them

You have a strong ability to leverage and turn your key findings into clear and outstanding presentations

Extensive experience developing and deploying reports, dashboards, and metrics using PowerBI (affinity with Tableau is a plus)

Ability to code in Python or SQL for Data related purposes is a plus

0 to 5 years of experience in data analytics

The ability to express yourself fluently in English and Dutch and/or French 

Strong verbal communication skills 

Strong interpersonal skills

Excellent time management skills under tight deadlines

The ability to work independently and as part of a team

Keep upskilling yourself via training and on the job learning


 

You have an interest, experience and/or technical expertise in several of the following:

Alteryx, PowerBI knowledge 

SQL and Tableau knowledge is a plus

Project management certification is a plus (e.g. Prince II, PMI, Agile/Scrum etc.)


What we offer

Valuable professional experience at the ‘best business school in the world’

Continuous learning with classroom training (both technical and soft skills) in Belgium and abroad 

A workspace where everyone feels respected, valued and free to be themselves

Inspiring and awesome colleagues

Team events such as Last Friday Drinks, team-building days and celebrations, as well as time spent on community days and charity activities

Forward-looking and very accessible leadership hosting inspirational lunches 

A flexible working schedule including homeworking and the possibility to conveniently make use of various holiday schemes 

An interesting salary and benefits package

And much more!


Looking for a career where you’ll really make a difference? Then we look forward to meeting you!





Education (if blank, degree and/or field of study not specified)
Degrees/Field of Study required:

Degrees/Field of Study preferred:



Certifications (if blank, certifications not specified)

Required Skills

Optional Skills



Desired Languages (If blank, desired languages not specified)



Travel Requirements
Up to 20%



Available for Work Visa Sponsorship?
No



Government Clearance Required?
Yes



Job Posting End Date

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Passionné de systèmes informatiques et de Data Management ? Doué dans l’analyse de processus et dans la gestion de base de données ? Avec vos collègues, vous intervenez sur des projets à haute valeur ajoutée chez les grands leaders de l’industrie en Wallonie

Actemium, marque de Vinci Energies Belgium, recherche un Data Engineer pour renforcer son équipe basée à Gosselies. Ce poste requiert la capacité d’identifier, de lire et d'écrire des requêtes complexes, la capacité de créer des objets de base de données (tables, vues, procédures stockées, fonctions définies par l'utilisateur) et de modifier le contenu de rapport existant.




Votre fonction




Compiler les exigences et les spécifications des utilisateurs pour les rapports
Concevoir et mettre en place les mécanismes de collecte et stockage des données
Concevoir et développer des rapports Microsoft SQL reporting services (SSRS)
Répondre aux utilisateurs pour dépanner et/ou améliorer les rapports existants
Collaborer avec le service qualité client pour définir les tests d'acceptance et les exécuter




Votre profil




Bachelor/Master orientation IT idéalement Industrial IT
Min. 3 années d’expérience réussie dans une fonction similaire, vous êtes à l'aise avec des processus industriels complexes
La gestion de base de données de type Microsoft SQL ou Oracle n'a plus de secrets pour vous
Vous êtes à l'aise avec les outils de Reporting (Microsoft SQL server Reporting Services, Crystal report, ou Dream Report)
Un fort esprit d'analyse/critique et une capacité naturelle à travailler en autonomie et à prendre des initiatives,
Un esprit d'équipe fort et une excellente communication




Vos atouts




Des connaissances en gestion de la maintenance ou en gestion de l'énergie constituent un sérieux atout
Connaissance d’outils de Dashboarding (Power BI, Qlik Sense...)
Connaissance de OSISOFT (PI, PI AF, PI Vision,…) et/ou PTC

Choisir de travailler pour Actemium, c'est opter pour:




Un cadre de travail innovant, avec des collègues passionnés
Un grand groupe 'VINCI Energies' tout en travaillant dans une structure de la taille d'une PME
Un cadre (formations et coaching) et les opportunités nécessaires pour donner un élan à votre carrière
Un plan de développement basé sur vos ambitions et vos atouts
Un package salarial complet accompagné d'une voiture de société
Un système de bonus ainsi qu'un système de congé intéressant, des horaires de travail flexibles et d'autres avantages extra-légaux
Une série d'activités sportives, culturelles et/ou familiales

Show more Show less

Title: Data Engineer (Remote in Europe)
Description:
Role Description




We’re looking for a data engineer to help us power the data of Prezi, the virtual collaboration tool that's changing how our customers work together in the hybrid office. As part of the Prezi Engineering community, you will collaborate with other teams, mentor less-experienced engineers, and advocate for clean, maintainable, and testable code in a work environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive and grow. Your impact will help millions of people build and deliver moving stories.




Prezi is a virtual first company and has hubs in Berlin, Budapest, Riga, and San Francisco. For this position, we are looking for someone in the EU and UK time zones, so you’ll have the flexibility to work remotely. The best part: you’ll be part of an awesome team that highly appreciates visual communication, believes that together we are greater than the sum of our parts, and cares deeply about those around us. At Prezi, we celebrate the diversity of our customers and our employees. We employ people from all backgrounds to build a product for everyone. We’re looking for people who can bring in their different perspectives and help us on our mission to reinvent how people share knowledge, tell stories, and inspire audiences to act.




Data @ Prezi




We believe that data analytics should be easy for both technical and non-technical people. We aim to create the tools, build the data platform and train our users to make this possible.




To better understand our users we collect data from all parts of our product and push it to a Kafka cluster and ingest data to Amazon distributed storage S3. We then use open source tools like Apache Gobblin to further process and analyze our data. We collect around 1TB data/day. Analysts who are interested in the data can crunch the data using Zeppelin or can schedule jobs with our ETL system to process the data with Spark/Trino. Data is then exposed through Hive tables for further analyses and reporting.




See more from our talk at Big Things .




In this role you will...
Keep petabyte-scale data flowing through our pipeline. We have hundreds of data-analytics jobs running every day.
Define best practices.
Work closely together with our Data Analytics Team
Design and build data architecture and related tooling including:
Logging framework
ETL and batch processing infrastructure
Realtime data systems, data pipelines, pub/sub interfaces
Future proof our system to enable new business opportunities e.g. real-time notifications, product insights platform
Partner with Data Analysts, provide tools and guidance on schema modeling, query optimization
Oversee data lifecycle, understand it’s current and future use cases and build a scalable, maintainable solution
Automate data quality assurance and provide best practices to teams.
Work together with Product Teams and provide them simple APIs to push and pull data
You have...




Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Sciences or related field
Minimum 3 years of experience in software engineering
Fluency in a scripting language (e.g. Python, Bash)
Familiarity with *nix environment and tooling (e.g. bash, ssh, git)
Up-to-date knowledge about big data tools and techniques
Experience developing and working with ETL pipelines
Experience in SQL
Strong interpersonal and communications skills; ability to consult, partner and work effectively with business partners and technical partners across functions
Enthusiasm for DevOps: we build it, we run it!
Excitement for building on open sourced tools as well as contributing to existing products
Get it done behavior: you are smart and quick with a focus on delivery
Bravery to try, pilot and eventually productise new technologies
You might also have...




Experience with Amazon Web Services or similar cloud provider
Experience with kubernetes (k8s)
Experience with continuous integration, configuration management
Experience with data warehouse design and maintenance
Experience with any flavor of Infrastructure as Code
then we would love to talk to you!
Show more Show less

  • Up-to-date knowledge about big data tools and techniques
  • Experience developing and working with ETL pipelines
  • Experience in SQL
  • Strong interpersonal and communications skills; ability to consult, partner and work effectively with business partners and technical partners across functions
  • Enthusiasm for DevOps: we build it, we run it!
  • Excitement for building on open sourced tools as well as contributing to existing products
  • Get it done behavior: you are smart and quick with a focus on delivery
  • Bravery to try, pilot and eventually productise new technologies
You might also have...


  • Experience with Amazon Web Services or similar cloud provider
  • Experience with kubernetes (k8s)
  • Experience with continuous integration, configuration management
  • Experience with data warehouse design and maintenance
  • Experience with any flavor of Infrastructure as Code
  • then we would love to talk to you!

Title: Manager Data Analyst Reward
Description:
As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. This is what makes us different, and renders working here a unique, lifetime experience.




When you join our People Advisory Services department, you'll help local and global clients navigate the complex, ever-changing world. You’ll be working closely with colleagues across borders, using EY tools and networks to solve complex problems.




At EY you can expand your skills and learn about all aspects of data. We’ll provide the global scale, personal support, inclusive culture and technology to help you grow, lead and learn.




The opportunity




As a Manager Reward Data Analyst you will help the team and clients rethinking their reward and remuneration strategy based on the current available data and how to link them to the best solutions available in the market. Next to that you will also be involved in the implementation and the deploy of the new solutions with the required supporting technology and data analysis. We are flexible regarding the work location.




Your Key Responsibilities




If you are convinced that ‘Data is King’, then you are the new Manager Reward Data Analyst we are looking for. You will be part of our truly multidisciplinary team of remuneration experts, technology geeks and data wizards. You will be dragged into projects answering client questions such as:




How can we give extra insights to companies regarding their employees (Dynamic Dashboards regarding Compensation & Benefits, Salary Evolutions, Pension Build up, possible savings, Absenteïsm, Turnover…)
Smart scans of remuneration packages (fe payoll data) to look for optimizations (better cost-net relationship, Tax and Social Security savings, market comparison, legal constraints…)
How can we optimize the current remuneration package of the employee population based on the current data?
How can we align remuneration packages of one or more companies being in a M&A?
How can we create a lasting People Experience in the mobility strategy?
What are the new trends in the market?




Skills And Attributes For Success




You have 5 to 8 years of experience as a Data Analyst
You have an innovative and collaborative mindset
You can work with data analysis programs or are eager to learn how to work with them (e.g. Excel, Alteryx, R, Python, Spotfire, Power BI,…)
You are enthusiastic to work with your colleagues and to deliver the exceptional experience to our clients
Curious, innovative nature that strives to solve client problems in a new way
You are fluent in Dutch or French and English




What Working At EY Offers




Attractive remuneration package - We offer an attractive remuneration package; including a company car and fuel card, iPhone plus subscription, health insurance, pension plan, meal vouchers and eco vouchers. Thanks to our flex plan, you can choose what you value most; extra days off, leasing an electric bike, etc.
Flexible working arrangements - We are proud of our flexible working arrangements. We will actively support you in building a successful career and delivering excellent client service without sacrificing your personal priorities. We offer flexible working hours and working from home multiple days per week is possible.
Inspiring work environment - At EY we are dedicated to providing you with an inspiring work environment. A work environment which allows you to further develop your skills and enables you to fulfill your true potential.
Personal growth - You will receive numerous trainings and will be coached by a counselor. We offer a clear career path tailored to your unique skills.
Fun - By joining our EY- teams, you can participate in team activities, family days, summer and winter events, sports events and enjoy a drink during our monthly Thirsty Thursday happy hour.
Sustainability – we have a fleet of hybrid and electric cars. Our flex plan makes it possible for people that don’t want a company car to choose a more sustainable option.
Diversity & inclusion - At EY we are passionate about the inclusion and support of individuals of all groups; we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, or disability status.
Location: all of our offices are easily accessible by public transport or by car and have parking space




It’s yours to build. Apply now.

Title: Job | Customer Data Analytics | Brussel
Description:
Bedrijf : Belfius Insurance

Solliciteren

Wat doe je precies?

Ben jij geboeid door data? Wil je een cruciale rol spelen in een data-driven cultuur en het beslissingsproces ondersteunen met jouw analyses? Ben jij nieuwsgierig en wil jij weten hoe data kunnen worden omgezet in toekomstvisies? Dan ben jij de ideale kandidaat om te komen werken bij ons Data & Analytics Insurance-team!

De afdeling Data & Analytics Insurance omvat een multifunctioneel team dat met name bestaat uit data scientists, data engineers, data analysts en data managers, die de organisatie ondersteunen bij de ontwikkeling van advanced analytics & AI, data management, customer analytics en reporting. Belfius heeft een duidelijke visie en strategie op het vlak van data door er een centrale plaats aan toe te kennen binnen de organisatie.

In dat verband zijn wij op zoek naar een nieuwe gemotiveerde collega om ons team te versterken. Als Customer Data Analyst ben jij verantwoordelijk voor de insights, de selectie & evaluatie van de marketingcampagnes en de reportings over het klantengedrag. Je haalt je gegevens vooral uit sociaal-demografische bronnen, uit cijfers over het bezit van producten, de online customer journey, CRM en verkoopgegevens. Jij wordt verantwoordelijk voor de ondersteuning van het beslissingsproces door kostbare informatie te verstrekken aan je collega‘s.

Rol :

Samenwerken met het Marketing & Digital sales-team voor het tot stand brengen van doelgroepen, en de juiste selectiecriteria voorstellen op basis van data.
De nodige inlichtingen verschaffen voor de enquêtes en de recurrente reportings over onze klanten en hun producten beheren.
De behoeften van de business omzetten in data-oplossingen: insight analyses uitvoeren ter ondersteuning van de beslissingen op basis van een open vraag van de business. De kennis over onze klanten uitdiepen om het antwoord te vinden en de key insights toelichten door middel van een heldere story line.
Gebruik van analysetools en talen om de gegevens te verwerken en te analyseren; grondige kennis verwerven van de beschikbare gegevens over de klanten en hun verzekeringsproducten.
Ad-hocverslagen opstellen over digitale data met behulp van tools zoals Adobe Analytics.
Ondersteuning bieden aan de andere Data-teams en hun projecten (bv. samenwerken met de Data Scientists voor het benutten van de Propensity To Buy-modellen en ze omzetten in leads).
KPI’s uitwerken en de selectie en evaluatie van de marketingcampagnes of andere reportings automatiseren door ook dynamische dashboards te ontwikkelen in QlikSense.

Via al die taken draag jij actief bij tot de commerciële en strategische uitdagingen van Belfius Insurance.

Wat mag je van ons verwachten?

Bij Belfius willen wij Meaningful & Inspiring zijn voor de Belgische samenleving, en jij kan ons helpen om het verschil te maken.

Wij hechten veel belang aan het evenwicht werk-privé voor elke medewerker. Onze bedrijfscultuur is dan ook in de eerste plaats gestoeld op vertrouwen en autonomie. Wij voerden een hybride manier van werken in die berust op een gezond evenwicht tussen telewerk en “onsite” werken op kantoor. Concreet betekent dit dat jij 2 tot 3 dagen per week thuis werkt, in combinatie met 2 tot 3 dagen aanwezigheid op de werkplek, naargelang van de noden van de dienst en met het oog op de instandhouding van een goede samenwerking met je chef en je collega's.

De hoofdzetel en de regionale zetels zijn gemakkelijk bereikbaar met het openbaar vervoer. Kom je op kantoor werken? Begin dan je dag met een trainingssessie in de Belfius Workout, de fitnessruimte made@belfius, gebruik ‘s middags een gezonde lunch in een van onze bedrijfsrestaurants of in The Village, waar je eveneens informele vergaderingen kan organiseren met collega’s rond een koffie en een tussendoortje.

Neem je loopbaan in eigen handen en maak gebruik van de individuele ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden die je worden aangeboden door de Belfius Academy. Als werkgever investeren wij in de ontwikkeling van leadership. Bovendien hechten wij veel belang aan diversiteit en gelijkheid van kansen.

We bieden je bovendien een aantrekkelijk loonpakket aan dat je voor een deel zelf kan samenstellen volgens je eigen behoeften, met daarbovenop tal van extralegale voordelen zoals een groepsverzekering, een hospitalisatieverzekering, maaltijdcheques, een abonnement op het openbaar vervoer, een korting op bank- en verzekeringsproducten enz.

Wat verwachten we van jou?

Je bent geboeid door data ;
Je hebt ervaring in een vergelijkbare functie, liefst in een bank- en/of verzekeringsomgeving ;
Uitstekende analytische en reportingvaardigheden, zin voor synthese, het vermogen om structuur te brengen in complexe situaties ;
Je maakt je de jouw toegewezen taken eigen en je bent in staat de stakeholders te overtuigen en te beïnvloeden op basis van de analytische resultaten. Je bent in staat nieuwe ideeën en oplossingen aan te brengen ;
Het vermogen om in een dynamische omgeving autonoom, georganiseerd en flexibel te werken ;
Zin voor samenwerking en initiatief, snel kunnen leren, resultaatgerichtheid.
Programmeerervaring met SQL & SAS is vereist ;
Ervaring met Adobe Analytics en visualiseringstools (QlikSense, PowerBi) is een voordeel. Belangstelling voor Digital Analytics is ook een pluspunt ;
Goede kennis van de beide landstalen en van het Engels is vereist ;
Universitair diploma of gelijkwaardige ervaring.

Belfius, Meaningful and Inspiring for Belgian Society. Together.

Bij Belfius zetten we resoluut in op de kracht van diversiteit. Gender, seksuele geaardheid, afkomst, geloof, leeftijd of een beperking spelen bij ons geen rol. Als we jou kiezen, dan doen we dat voor je kwaliteiten en vaardigheden. Bovendien zorgen wij er ook voor dat je je vaardigheden en talenten bij ons optimaal kan ontplooien.

Belfius, een inclusieve werkgever

Bij Belfius gaan we radicaal voor de kracht van diversiteit. Het maakt ons niet uit wat je gender, seksuele geaardheid, afkomst, geloof, leeftijd of handicap is. Als we je kiezen, doen we dat voor je kwaliteiten en vaardigheden. Bovendien zorgen we ervoor dat je je vaardigheden en talenten bij ons optimaal kan ontwikkelen en benutten.

Solliciteer snel

Solliciteer nu en ga aan de slag bij een 100% Belgische bank die maximaal investeert in zinvolle en duurzame projecten op eigen bodem.

Solliciteren

Title: Data Engineer - QuantumBlack
Description:
Qualifications

Degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics, or equivalent field
Business level fluency in French or Dutch as well as English (verbal and written) mandatory
Ability to write clean, maintainable, and robust code in Python and SQL. Familiarity with Java and Scala is a plus
Knowledge of software engineering concepts and best practices
Familiarity with the latest OSS, cloud, container, query and database technologies as well as query languages
Experience with big data tools such as Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, Hive is a plus
Previous commercial experience in a data-driven role
Confirmed experience building data pipelines in production and ability to work across structured, semi-structured and unstructured data
Experience preparing data for analytics and following a data science workflow
Commercial client-facing or senior stakeholders management experience is a plus


What You'll Do

As a Data Engineer you will...

Partner with our clients, from data owners and users to C-level executives, to understand their needs and build impactful analytics solutions
Design and build data pipelines to support data science projects following software engineering best practices
Use state of the art technologies to acquire, ingest and transform big datasets
Map data fields to hypothesis, curate, wrangle and prepare data to be used in advanced analytics models
Create and manage data environments in the cloud or on premise
Ensure information security standards are maintained at all time
Contribute to cross-functional problem-solving sessions with your team and deliver presentations to colleagues and clients
Be flexible to travel to our clients' offices to deliver presentations, gather information or share knowledge
Have the opportunity to contribute to R&D and internal asset development projects


Our tech stack

While we advocate for using the right tech for the right task, we often leverage the following technologies Python, PySpark, SQL, Airflow, Databricks, our own OSS called Kedro, container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes, cloud solutions such as AWS, GCP or Azure, and more!

What You'll Benefit From

Real-World Impact – No project is ever the same. We work with top-tier clients across multiple sectors, providing unique learning and development opportunities internationally.
Fusing Tech & Leadership – We work with the latest technologies and methodologies and offer first class learning programmes at all levels.
Multidisciplinary Teamwork - Our teams include data scientists, engineers, project managers, UX and visual designers who work collaboratively to enhance performance.
Innovative Work Culture – Creativity, insight and passion come from being balanced. We cultivate a modern work environment through an emphasis on wellness, insightful talks and training sessions.
Striving for Diversity – With colleagues from over 40 nationalities, we recognise the benefits of working with people from all walks of life.


Who You'll Work With

You'll be part of a global data engineering community as well as our local QuantumBlack community in Brussels. You will work in cross-functional and agile project teams alongside project managers, data scientists, machine learning engineers, other data engineers, and industry experts.

You'll work hands in hands with our clients, from data owners and users to C-level executives.
