Title: Statistical Analyst
Description:
IDDI (International Drug Development Institute), founded in 1991, is a highly recognized Biostatistical and eClinical data services provider in the field of clinical research, providing agile clinical trials services for pharmaceutical, biotechnology, and medical device/diagnostic companies. Together, we want to achieve one objective: support our clients to accelerate the delivery of their drugs and improve people’s health.




For 30 years, IDDI has successfully supported 1200+ clinical trials for 330+ pharmaceutical companies and biotech companies, as well as academic cooperative groups and CROs worldwide.

Thanks to a scientifically driven culture and close collaboration with KOLs, IDDI also has a fruitful history of Research and Development projects and more than 15% of IDDI’s projects are academic studies. One of these R&D projects has led to the foundation of CluePoints, now leader in the field of data quality assessment in clinical trials.




Today, IDDI is proud to contribute to 4 significant research projects, including the BENEFIT project (Biostatistical Estimation of Net Effects for Individualization of Therapy) for which we are looking for an experienced and dynamic Statistical Analyst who will support its success!

With the Benefit project, IDDI focuses on an innovative solution dedicated to personalized medicine based on a novel statistical method called GPC (Generalized Pairwise Comparisons) – See M Buyse, Generalized pairwise comparisons of prioritized outcomes in the two-sample problem, Statistics in medicine, 2010, 29 3245–3257DOI: 10.1002/sim.3923.




While classical statistical design and analysis of clinical trials are based on a sole primary endpoint; the GPC method allows studying the combined multidimensional impact of several endpoints thereby maximizing statistical power and limiting the trial sample size. The flexibility of GPC allows involving patients and clinicians in the analysis and place patients at the center of the therapeutic decision. This is illustrated in this video:




https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0Oyo5qBv94s




GPC will lead to application dedicated to industry statisticians, clinicians, and ultimately patients, allowing the analysis of randomized clinical trials studies through an innovative approach permitting advanced Benefit-Risks assessments.




To reinforce our team and support one of our innovative projects in Research & Development, we are actively looking for a Statistical Analyst for Ottignies-Louvain-la-Neuve (hybrid office/ homeworking).




Your role:

As a Statistical Analyst you are responsible for the analysis of clinical trials data, specifically using the innovative statistical methodology of Generalized Pairwise Comparisons – GPC.

You will be responsible for the use of the methodology and its application, and the presentation of the results. You will be in contact with the development and research teams, and you will also discuss results with clients.




Your responsibilities:

Prepare datasets for analyses by our software including cleaning, administration, and coding activities
If required, you will simulate datasets, based on the statistical signature of the actual data
Liaise with clients or principal investigators to ensure a good understanding of the data specifications
Analyze clinical trials data with Generalized Pairwise Comparisons methodology by using the internal application and other programming languages
Perform sensitivity analyses and report their results with the research team and with clients
Participate in the writing of the specifications of new features and take charge of its implementation and integration into the new application.
Test new features of the application
Assist with writing of the documentation and user training




Your profile:

Master’s Degree in (Bio)Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Physics, or (Bio)Statistics with a deep interest in Statistics required
4 years of experience in Clinical Trials or Academic Research
Strong experience in Statistics (design and analysis of Clinical trials, trial design, understanding of Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP) and protocol)
Strong experience in Data Management, including preparing and cleaning activities
A good understanding of EDC, CRF, CDISC and related programming
Excellent knowledge of Python and R
Knowledge of SAS is an asset
Experience in Software development processes, including Version Control System (GIT) is an asset
Excellent oral and written English
Good communication skills
Be resourceful and motivated to come out of your comfort zone to find information
Accuracy and attention to details
Planning and organizational skills
Problem solving skills
Team player
Fast learner




Our offer:

You will join an international and multi-cultural company that includes over 25 different nationalities (English is the working language) and where employees are the strongest asset.




At IDDI, we offer job stability and growth opportunities through on‑the-job training and mentoring programs. Working at IDDI will bring you an expertise that is widely recognized in our industry.

Our customers value our flexibility, responsiveness, and proactive approach.




A unique opportunity to work in a friendly, team-oriented, and stimulating environment. We regularly enjoy company-wide events, such as BBQs, family-day outings, sports, and charity fundraisers – giving the chance to share time together.




We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, including meal vouchers, full reimbursement for public transport, hospital insurance, etc. as well as flexibility for a better work-life balance (flexible working hours with home-working opportunities, part-time schedules).

Show more Show less
HTML:
IDDI (International Drug Development Institute), founded in 1991, is a highly recognized Biostatistical and eClinical data services provider in the field of clinical research, providing agile clinical trials services for pharmaceutical, biotechnology, and medical device/diagnostic companies. Together, we want to achieve one objective: support our clients to accelerate the delivery of their drugs and improve people’s health.


For 30 years, IDDI has successfully supported 1200+ clinical trials for 330+ pharmaceutical companies and biotech companies, as well as academic cooperative groups and CROs worldwide.

Thanks to a scientifically driven culture and close collaboration with KOLs, IDDI also has a fruitful history of Research and Development projects and more than 15% of IDDI’s projects are academic studies. One of these R&D projects has led to the foundation of CluePoints, now leader in the field of data quality assessment in clinical trials.


Today, IDDI is proud to contribute to 4 significant research projects, including the BENEFIT project (Biostatistical Estimation of Net Effects for Individualization of Therapy) for which we are looking for an experienced and dynamic Statistical Analyst who will support its success!

With the Benefit project, IDDI focuses on an innovative solution dedicated to personalized medicine based on a novel statistical method called GPC (Generalized Pairwise Comparisons) – See M Buyse, Generalized pairwise comparisons of prioritized outcomes in the two-sample problem, Statistics in medicine, 2010, 29 3245–3257DOI: 10.1002/sim.3923.


While classical statistical design and analysis of clinical trials are based on a sole primary endpoint; the GPC method allows studying the combined multidimensional impact of several endpoints thereby maximizing statistical power and limiting the trial sample size. The flexibility of GPC allows involving patients and clinicians in the analysis and place patients at the center of the therapeutic decision. This is illustrated in this video:

  • Strong experience in Data Management, including preparing and cleaning activities

  • Excellent knowledge of Python and R

  • Experience in Software development processes, including Version Control System (GIT) is an asset

  • Good communication skills
  • Be resourceful and motivated to come out of your comfort zone to find information

Our customers value our flexibility, responsiveness, and proactive approach.


A unique opportunity to work in a friendly, team-oriented, and stimulating environment. We regularly enjoy company-wide events, such as BBQs, family-day outings, sports, and charity fundraisers – giving the chance to share time together.

Title: Data engineer EMEA
Description:
Job Description

What’s the scope?

Reporting into the EMEA IT Director EMEA the Data engineer will work as the subject matter expertise (SME) of Kontoor EMEA Reporting & Analytic solutions. In this role you will be responsible for the project implementation and production support in Data analytics and data warehouse solutions within the organization. You will work closely with business teams including commercial, supply chain, planning and Finance teams in understanding their analytic requirements, based on requirement, work on data modelling definition, performing SQL queries, post-live support, etc. You will also work together with regional/global IT colleagues and in some occasions, 3rd party vendors, consultants.

Your responsibilities as our Data engineer;

Gather requirements from the business stakeholders and translate this into data modeling designs, and definitions
Perform SQL queries to optimize data aggregations, test and deploy solution on defined data modelling, datasets and reports
Identify and analyse opportunities in reporting and analytics. Ensure the continuous adoption of Data warehouse solutions by business
Provide regular and on-demand training and facilitation to business teams
Responsible for data warehouse application support, including analysis and resolution of incidents, identification of business requirements for the resolution of incidents, testing and deployment of fixes, and monitoring of related batch processes related to data extraction and collection
Vendor management to 3rd party vendors and outsourcing resources as required

Skills For Success

8 Experience in data analytics, data warehouse project implementation
6 Experience in SSIS, MS Synapse or equivalent
Intermediate level or above on SQL development
Experience in Retail industry especially Fashion, Apparel and Footwear preferred
Experience with connecting data warehouse with SAP application
Experience in Power BI or other frontend reporting applications
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience in business
administration, information systems, computer science or related field preferred
Strong communication, influencing and collaborating skills
Highly analytical and data literate across multiple systems, taxonomies and data flow
Stakeholder management and project management
Ability to work cross-functionally and on all levels of the organization
Demonstrates experience working with complex analytics and reporting business requirement and translating into data warehouse modelling design

We Offer

We value trust and transparency and focus on collaboration and teamwork. We live by our clear Purpose, Mission & Values where we strive for continuous innovation & cutting-edge sustainable technology; We offer competitive benefits, perks and personal development opportunities;

Casual Denim dress code in the office and outside of work
Discount on our brands; Wrangler® & Lee®
Exciting challenges in a dynamic team
Collateral and benefits of a global company
Attractive salary package with fixed and variable components
Development opportunities in a growth-driven environment

Title: Senior Data Analyst Reward
Description:
As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. This is what makes us different, and renders working here a unique, lifetime experience.




When you join our People Advisory Services department, you'll help local and global clients navigate the complex, ever-changing world. You’ll be working closely with colleagues across borders, using EY tools and networks to solve complex problems.




At EY you can expand your skills and learn about all aspects of data. We’ll provide the global scale, personal support, inclusive culture and technology to help you grow, lead and learn.




The opportunity




As a Senior Reward Data Analyst you will help the team and clients rethinking their reward and remuneration strategy based on the current available data and how to link them to the best solutions available in the market. Next to that you will also be involved in the implementation and the deploy of the new solutions with the required supporting technology and data analysis. We are flexible regarding the work location.




Your Key Responsibilities




If you are convinced that ‘Data is King’, then you are the new Senior Reward Data Analyst we are looking for. You will be part of our truly multidisciplinary team of remuneration experts, technology geeks and data wizards. You will be dragged into projects answering client questions such as:




How can we give extra insights to companies regarding their employees (Dynamic Dashboards regarding Compensation & Benefits, Salary Evolutions, Pension Build up, possible savings, Absenteïsm, Turnover…)
Smart scans of remuneration packages (fe payoll data) to look for optimizations (better cost-net relationship, Tax and Social Security savings, market comparison, legal constraints…)
How can we optimize the current remuneration package of the employee population based on the current data?
How can we align remuneration packages of one or more companies being in a M&A?
How can we create a lasting People Experience in the mobility strategy?
What are the new trends in the market?




Skills And Attributes For Success




You have 3 to 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst
You have an innovative and collaborative mindset
You can work with data analysis programs or are eager to learn how to work with them (e.g. Excel, Alteryx, R, Python, Spotfire, Power BI,…)
You are enthusiastic to work with your colleagues and to deliver the exceptional experience to our clients
Curious, innovative nature that strives to solve client problems in a new way
You are fluent in Dutch or French and English




What Working At EY Offers




Attractive remuneration package - We offer an attractive remuneration package; including a company car and fuel card, iPhone plus subscription, health insurance, pension plan, meal vouchers and eco vouchers. Thanks to our flex plan, you can choose what you value most; extra days off, leasing an electric bike, etc.
Flexible working arrangements - We are proud of our flexible working arrangements. We will actively support you in building a successful career and delivering excellent client service without sacrificing your personal priorities. We offer flexible working hours and working from home multiple days per week is possible.
Inspiring work environment - At EY we are dedicated to providing you with an inspiring work environment. A work environment which allows you to further develop your skills and enables you to fulfill your true potential.
Personal growth - You will receive numerous trainings and will be coached by a counselor. We offer a clear career path tailored to your unique skills.
Fun - By joining our EY- teams, you can participate in team activities, family days, summer and winter events, sports events and enjoy a drink during our monthly Thirsty Thursday happy hour.
Sustainability – we have a fleet of hybrid and electric cars. Our flex plan makes it possible for people that don’t want a company car to choose a more sustainable option.
Diversity & inclusion - At EY we are passionate about the inclusion and support of individuals of all groups; we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, or disability status.
Location: all of our offices are easily accessible by public transport or by car and have parking space




It’s yours to build. Apply now.

Title: Data Engineer Traineeship
Description:
Studeer je binnenkort af? Of heb je al een eerste werkervaring achter de rug? Ben je op zoek naar een uitdagende job als consultant? Dan is ons Young Professional development programma iets voor jou! Als Young Professional doorloop je in ons hoofdkantoor in Mechelen een intensief opleidingstraject van tien weken en word je persoonlijk begeleid. Binnen dit traject krijg je de kans om jouw opleidingsvaardigheden te vertalen naar de praktijk en word je klaargestoomd voor een eerste opdracht als consultant.

Tijdens het programma wordt er stilgestaan bij onder andere Data Modelling, Azure, Python, AWS en behaal je meteen ook je eerste certificaten. Nadien ga je meteen aan de slag met je eerste IT-consultancy opdracht bij één van onze klanten.

Als Data Engineer ben je in staat om onze klanten te helpen met het beheren van hun masterdata en het in kaart brengen van hun datastromen. Je denkt samen met de klant na over de beste implementatie van data, zodat de verschillende datateams nog beter kunnen samenwerken en de kwaliteit steeds centraal blijft staan. Ook dan sta je er niet alleen voor, je wordt er omringd door senior collega’s.

Wil je je carrière als Data engineer starten? Dan is dit de job voor jou!

Wie we zoeken


Je hebt een bachelor- of masterdiploma in IT
Je bent gefascineerd door nieuwe trends en best practices
Je lost graag complexe (data) problemen en stellingen op
Je wilt je kennis in datamodellering en dataprivacy versterken
Je wilt bijleren over monitoring en logging van data
Je hebt een sterke interesse in onder andere Azure, SQL, Python en AWS
Je werkt zorgvuldig, zelfstandig, oplossings- en resultaatgericht
Je communiceert vloeiend in het Nederlands en Engels, kennis van het Frans is een plus


Wat we bieden

Vanaf dag één van je opleiding ben je een échte Ordinees met een vast contract. Na het young professional programma krijg je het volste vertrouwen om meteen aan een boeiend, concreet project te werken. Met de nodige ondersteuning van je managers en collega’s, uiteraard. Die ondersteuning garanderen we gedurende je hele loopbaan, want Ordina hecht ontzettend veel belang aan opleiding en ontwikkeling. Voor je het weet evolueer je zo misschien naar een experten rol.

It’s not all about work! Je komt terecht in een bedrijf met een heel open, transparante cultuur dat zijn mensen – jou dus – echt centraal zet. Je leert snel bij, dankzij onze opleidingen, competence centers en je collega’s. En je ontdekt snel dat we bij Ordina ook graag wat stoom aflaten op verschillende get-togethers, onze jaarlijkse familiedag of gewoon met een Open Bar om het weekend in te zetten. Tenslotte wordt dit alles aangevuld met een aantrekkelijk salaris met extralegale voordelen zoals een bedrijfswagen, laptop, verzekeringspakket, maaltijdcheques, ecocheques, en onkostenvergoeding.

Title: Data engineer
Description:
Jouw nieuwe functie

Als Data Engineer ben je verantwoordelijk om de wereldwijde afdeling voor proces- en digitale ontwikkeling te versterken, die verantwoordelijk is voor het verbeteren van bestaande en het ontwikkelen van nieuwe processen en de realisatie van investeringsprojecten voor digitale productie.

In jouw rol maak je op een slimme manier gebruik van de productie van big data om extra proces- en zakelijk inzicht te krijgen en betere beslissingen te nemen door middel van data. Je zult innovatieve proof of concept-projecten en de bijbehorende KPI’s beheren in zeer nauwe samenwerking met procesingenieurs en interne klanten die alle lagen van het bedrijf omvatten (productie, controle, continue verbetering, QA ...).

Je bent in staat om de volledige datastroom te managen, van dataverzameling-integratie tot data-exploratie-voorbereiding. Begrijp, catalogiseer en documenteer nieuwe gegevensbronnen en creëer gegevenspijplijnen. Pas statistische analyse- en visualisatietechnieken toe, genereer en test hypothesen en toon drive en nieuwsgierigheid om het productieproces tot in de kern te begrijpen.

Je geeft leiding aan het opzetten van tools voor gegevensanalyse door de zakelijke vereisten van interne gebruikers op elkaar af te stemmen en functionele vereisten te definiëren. Samen met een data scientist zorg je voor de evolutie van descriptieve en diagnostische analytics naar predictive en prescriptieve analytics. Je werkt vanuit ons kantoor in Wieze of Halle in België en bent bereid om wereldwijd projecten aan te nemen. Door het internationale karakter van onze projecten kunnen wij flexibiliteit bieden op het gebied van werktijden en werklocatie.




Jouw profiel

In jouw functie van data engineer heb je een Master diploma in de ingenieurswetenschappen, computerwetenschappen, biowetenschappen, scheikunde, economie of elektromechanica met ervaring (2-5 jaar of meer) in fabricage. Verder ben je geïnteresseerd om domeinexpert te worden en te beschikken over goede vaardigheden en informaticavaardigheden. Je hebt ervaring in data-engineering om toegang en gebruik van gegevens mogelijk te maken en bent bekend met databasesystemen, ETL-tools en andere. Ervaring met Python en/of R is vereist.

Hiernaast ben je een goede communicator en in staat om complexe problemen te visualiseren en denk je procesmatig. Ervaring in de levensmiddelen- of procesindustrie, ervaring in de productie is een must. Je spreekt Engels, Nederlands en/of Frans worden als een plus gezien. Verder is flexibiliteit vereist voor deze functie (tot 20%). Je bent een resultaatgerichte teamspeler en je modereert de verschillende betrokken partijen (klanten, gebruikers, leveranciers en aannemers).




De arbeidsvoorwaarden

In ruil voor jouw inzet als Data Engineer, kan je rekenen op een marktconform loonpakket samengesteld op basis van jouw kennis en ervaring. Naast het brutoloon worden extralegale voordelen voorzien. Bovendien wordt er rekening gehouden met work-life balance, zo is er een flexibel urensysteem & is het mogelijk om enkele dagen per week van thuis uit te werken.




Over de organisatie

Je vervoegt een ervaren IT-team, die verantwoordelijk is voor de IT ondersteuning van een groot levensmiddelenbedrijf. Als Data Engineer kom je terecht in een uitdagende omgeving waar ingezet wordt op nieuwe technologieën en innovatie. Je krijgt de kans om te groeien in jouw rol dankzij heel wat opleidingsmogelijkheden.

Show more Show less
HTML:
Jouw nieuwe functie

Als Data Engineer ben je verantwoordelijk om de wereldwijde afdeling voor proces- en digitale ontwikkeling te versterken, die verantwoordelijk is voor het verbeteren van bestaande en het ontwikkelen van nieuwe processen en de realisatie van investeringsprojecten voor digitale productie.

In jouw rol maak je op een slimme manier gebruik van de productie van big data om extra proces- en zakelijk inzicht te krijgen en betere beslissingen te nemen door middel van data. Je zult innovatieve proof of concept-projecten en de bijbehorende KPI’s beheren in zeer nauwe samenwerking met procesingenieurs en interne klanten die alle lagen van het bedrijf omvatten (productie, controle, continue verbetering, QA ...).

Je bent in staat om de volledige datastroom te managen, van dataverzameling-integratie tot data-exploratie-voorbereiding. Begrijp, catalogiseer en documenteer nieuwe gegevensbronnen en creëer gegevenspijplijnen. Pas statistische analyse- en visualisatietechnieken toe, genereer en test hypothesen en toon drive en nieuwsgierigheid om het productieproces tot in de kern te begrijpen.

Je geeft leiding aan het opzetten van tools voor gegevensanalyse door de zakelijke vereisten van interne gebruikers op elkaar af te stemmen en functionele vereisten te definiëren. Samen met een data scientist zorg je voor de evolutie van descriptieve en diagnostische analytics naar predictive en prescriptieve analytics. Je werkt vanuit ons kantoor in Wieze of Halle in België en bent bereid om wereldwijd projecten aan te nemen. Door het internationale karakter van onze projecten kunnen wij flexibiliteit bieden op het gebied van werktijden en werklocatie.


Jouw profiel

In jouw functie van data engineer heb je een Master diploma in de ingenieurswetenschappen, computerwetenschappen, biowetenschappen, scheikunde, economie of elektromechanica met ervaring (2-5 jaar of meer) in fabricage. Verder ben je geïnteresseerd om domeinexpert te worden en te beschikken over goede vaardigheden en informaticavaardigheden. Je hebt ervaring in data-engineering om toegang en gebruik van gegevens mogelijk te maken en bent bekend met databasesystemen, ETL-tools en andere. Ervaring met Python en/of R is vereist.

Hiernaast ben je een goede communicator en in staat om complexe problemen te visualiseren en denk je procesmatig. Ervaring in de levensmiddelen- of procesindustrie, ervaring in de productie is een must. Je spreekt Engels, Nederlands en/of Frans worden als een plus gezien. Verder is flexibiliteit vereist voor deze functie (tot 20%). Je bent een resultaatgerichte teamspeler en je modereert de verschillende betrokken partijen (klanten, gebruikers, leveranciers en aannemers).


De arbeidsvoorwaarden

In ruil voor jouw inzet als Data Engineer, kan je rekenen op een marktconform loonpakket samengesteld op basis van jouw kennis en ervaring. Naast het brutoloon worden extralegale voordelen voorzien. Bovendien wordt er rekening gehouden met work-life balance, zo is er een flexibel urensysteem & is het mogelijk om enkele dagen per week van thuis uit te werken.


Over de organisatie

Je vervoegt een ervaren IT-team, die verantwoordelijk is voor de IT ondersteuning van een groot levensmiddelenbedrijf. Als Data Engineer kom je terecht in een uitdagende omgeving waar ingezet wordt op nieuwe technologieën en innovatie. Je krijgt de kans om te groeien in jouw rol dankzij heel wat opleidingsmogelijkheden.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About The Job




Do you want to work at a company with real social impact? On top of that you value a healthy work-life balance? Say no more! I have THE right place for you ;)




As a data engineer, you and your team are responsible for the entire infrastructure of the organization and contribute to the efficiency within the company. Your duties include developing and maintaining technical applications, managing servers and containers, and setting up continuous integration.




Additional your tasks




You will be able to manage the entire data flow, from data collection integration to data exploration preparation.
Understand, catalog and document new data sources and create data pipelines.
You apply statistical analysis and visualization techniques, generate and test hypotheses, and demonstrate drive and curiosity to understand the production process to its core.
Ensure data collection, integrity and consistency;
Contributing to the implementation of a Data Warehouse using open source technologies.
Implementing & designing Master Data Management & ETL solutions.




Your profile




You have a bachelor or master degree in Computer Science (or related), and at least 3 years of experience in a similar position
In-depth SQL, Data warehousing knowledge is a must
You have experience with Python
Excellent problem solving skills
Excellent oral and written communication skills in French and English
Hands-on mentality




We're offering




A fixed contract within a high-growth scale-up;
The opportunity to grow within the role and the company ;
A competitive salary supplemented with extra legal benefits (hospitalization insurance, group insurance, company car, teleworking, etc.).
Diversity & inclusion - We are passionate about the inclusion and support of individuals of all groups; we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, or disability status.




Want to know more? I'm one message away :)

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Line of Service
Advisory



Industry/Sector
Technology



Specialism
Advisory - Other



Management Level
Associate



Job Description & Summary

Contribute to creating a better tomorrow

The only way we can tackle the challenges of this fast-changing world is with passionate people. Led by our purpose of building trust and solving important problems, we come together at PwC to address the biggest issues facing the world in a way that drives positive impact. Are you eager to join a team fueled by open and curious minds, who are passionate about their work and create new solutions for a new day? Then you’re at the right place.

As a technology enabled innovator, PwC is building out a digital first delivery model for and with our clients. This digital delivery model isn’t just about the technologies, it’s about new ways of solving complex problems, creating unique experiences and accelerating business while leveraging our core expertise.

PwC’s Digital Services team is at the heart of this vision by designing, developing & scaling products to help our internal & external clients lead the next phase of their digital evolution. We support the PwC business specialists to build products connected to a purpose. Process improvement, business transformation, effective use of innovative technology and data & analytics, and leveraging alternative delivery solutions are key components of our products that tackle the very real challenges our clients face today, and unlock new opportunities for growth in the future. 

Our digital product teams aim to reimagine the possible based on client centricity, agile delivery & startup thinking.

What you will do

As a Data Engineer, you will be part of the Data Management Team within our Digital Factory whose main goal is managing the integration flows with internal & external partners, as well as preparing data for reporting & analytics. The complete data & solution lifecycle from architecture, design, implementation & operation of custom built solutions is managed within the team.

Additionally the team is also responsible to support the different business units with technical data training, advice, tools & platforms as part of the larger overall Firm’s digital & data strategy.

Are you ready to work with us? Ideally you have the following skills within your data DNA :


Experience on projects with different technology stacks, integration aspects (with packages or external solutions) & infrastructure aspects

Experience as BI & ETL developer on the Microsoft stack

Experience as a SQL Server database developer (T-SQL, complex queries, functions, stored

procedures)

Experience on Power BI

Experience on Azure Integration Services (Logic Apps, Data Factory, …)

Experience on Microsoft Azure Data Platform

Fluency with appropriate tools including Visual Studio, SQL Management Studio & Profiler

Knowledge & hands on SQL Server performance tuning & index management



Preferable: experience as technical designer on SQL Server solutions projects


Please note that excellent verbal and written English, together with good knowledge of French and/or Dutch are required.

Life at PwC Belgium

Our culture and workplace are something we’re proud of. Here’s a sneak peek at some of the benefits you can look forward to:


Flexibility: flexible working hours with Work@PwC Reimagined so you can decide your most effective working pattern

Infinite learning and growing: broad opportunities to learn every day and exciting career pathways that help you explore different disciplines or areas of expertise

Rewards that matter to you: A flexible rewards plan gives you access to a wide range of benefits so you can make the choices that best fit your personal circumstances and lifestyle.

Diversity: We believe that diversity makes PwC stronger. It helps us solve problems and deliver added value to our clients. We encourage an inclusive culture where people can get the best out of themselves.

A sustainable mobility offer: we offer a wide range of sustainable mobility options. 

Wellbeing: An extensive health programme that includes access to an online wellbeing platform, yoga and pilates courses, sports communities and mental resilience workshops

International PwC network: broad access to industry expertise, both locally and through our wider global network of member firms

Supporting you in every phase of your life, including Teddy Care (childcare in the event of illness) and family friendly work schemes


Let’s build something great together. What are you waiting for?

Degrees/Field of Study required:

Degrees/Field of Study preferred:



Certifications (if blank, certifications not specified)

Required Skills

Optional Skills



Desired Languages (If blank, desired languages not specified)



Travel Requirements
Up to 20%



Available for Work Visa Sponsorship?
Yes



Government Clearance Required?
Yes



Job Posting End Date

Title: Datawetenschapper
Description:
Wij zijn momenteel op zoek naar een Data Scientist ter versterking van het Smart Maintenance Team.




Functiebeschrijving:




De Data Scientist analyseert grote hoeveelheden ruwe informatie, op zoek naar patronen en inzichten die de organisatie helpen efficiënter te werken en data-gedreven beslissingsnemen.

Hij/zij gebruikt zijn analytische, statistische en programmatorische vaardigheden om ruwe gegevens te vertalen in kant-en-klare informatie. Het einddoel is waarde te halen uit ruwe gegevens.

De focus ligt hierbij in eerste instantie op onderhoud, maar is niet gelimiteerd. De Data Scientist zal eerst werken aan de grootste opportuniteiten (rekening houdende met besparingsmogelijkheden, veiligheid, productkwaliteit en productie efficiëntie).




Verantwoordelijkheden:




Vertalen van noden van stakeholders (ingenieurs, operatoren, management) in digitale oplossingen.
Fungeren als evangelist in de mogelijkheden van de digitale wereld.
Productie expertise en digitale expertise samenbrengen en gebruiken als hefboom om nog beter te doen.
Proactief zoeken naar opportuniteiten om verliezen weg te werken (of zichtbaar te maken) d.m.v. digitale oplossingen.
Ontwerpen, creëren, testen en implementeren van algoritmes en predictieve modellen om de organisatie te ondersteunen.
Collega’s helpen in het genereren van inzichten uit data.
Identificeren van relevante datapunten, vereist voor data modellering.
Creëren van data visualisaties om de output van modellen intuïtief duidelijk te maken voor operationele teams.
Data validatie methodes ontwikkelen en integreren.
Beoordelen van de accuraatheid van ontwikkelde datamodellen.
Stakeholders trainen in het correct gebruik van de vrijgekomen informatie.




Profiel:




M.Sc. in de ingenieurswetenschappen, industriële wetenschappen, computerwetenschappen of gelijkwaardige wetenschappelijke afstudeerrichtingen.
Geen specifieke werkervaring vereist, wel een grondige kennis van digitale systemen en een toekomstgerichte mindset om mee te bouwen aan een Smart Factory.
Statistische computertalen (R, Python, SQL)
Machine Learning algoritmes
Statistiek
Data cleansing
Data visualisatie
Power BI
Affiniteit met databases en data pipelines




Specifieke competenties:




Goede kennis van Nederlands en Engels (schriftelijk en mondeling) zijn een must.
Professionele werkethiek en de nodige integriteit.
Probleem-oplossend vermogen met een digitale mindset.
Analytisch denken en data gedreven beslissingsvermogen.
Innovatief en steeds op zoek naar verbetermogelijkheden.
Bewust van een zekere ‘sense of urgency’ om flexibel om te gaan met voortschrijdend inzicht.




Aanbod:




Diverse opportuniteiten om je horizontaal en verticaal te ontwikkelen.
Een aangename, vlotte familiale sfeer waarbij elke medewerker voor ons uniek is.
Een aantrekkelijk salarispakket, aangevuld met tal van extralegale voordelen (diverse verzekeringsplannen, fietslease, maaltijd- en ecocheques, etc..)

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
What if you joined Apside Belgium to work on the challenging projects of tomorrow?




ABOUT YOU ?




You are used to work in data transformation program
You have very good communication skills, and enjoy working in a team




This Data Engineer position is made for you!




THE MISSION




As Data Engineer you will interact with the business and IT people (architects, functional analysts, project managers, data scientists, developers) and participate in the data transformation program.

As part of this program, we are re-engineering our enterprise data platform and machine learning solutions and moving to a CDP technology stack (Cloudera Data Platform). In this re-engineering and migration, you will design and develop solutions for real-time data ingestion, processing and serving in a highly available environment. You will also be working on several generic frameworks e.g. framework for logging, for access management.




YOUR PROFILE




You are an IT professional with a minimum of five years of experience with proven experience in big data engineering.

You have experience with the Cloudera products (HDFS, Ozone, Hive, Impala, Spark, Oozie, Atlas, Ranger, …).

Experience in real-time technologies is mandatory (Nifi, Kafka, Flink, Spark Streaming, High Availability setup …).




Specifically on Kafka :

• Design and implement broker and partition architecture

• Develop consumable topics and corresponding API/microservices to render data consumable.

• Configure Producers and Consumers

• Mastering all core components required in a Kafka eco-system, like Zookeeper, YARN

• Integration with Flink and Nifi

• Stream processing knowledge Kafka with Flink

• Know-how of a Kafka administration profile is a plus




Skills




Experience in NoSQL databases (CouchBase, MongoDB, …) is an advantage.

You have experience with CI/CD (Git, Jenkins / Gitlab CI, Ansible, Nexus)

You have experience in Java and/or Python programming languages.

Experience in PowerBI, Scala, Docker and Kubernetes are an advantage.

You can work autonomously, you can cooperate effectively with different teams onsite and offshore, you are eager to learn new technologies, and you like sharing knowledge and documenting solutions with the right level of detail.

You are fluent in English and rench, both spoken and written.

Knowledge of Dutch is an advantage.

Title: Power BI Specialist
Description:
“Ik heb nog nooit in een team met zoveel Microsoft BI specialisten gezeten.” – Saar Gillis, Data Intelligence Architect. Kent Power BI voor jou geen geheimen meer? Ga jij complexe Power BI vraagstukken niet uit de weg en volg jij alle technologische wijzingen omtrent Power BI op de voet? Dan zou jij wel eens onze nieuwe Power BI specialist kunnen zijn.

Als Power BI specialist zal je het gesprek voeren met de klant om te komen tot de beste Power BI oplossingen. Je transformeert de functionele en technische requirements in de BI oplossingen van de toekomst.  
Jij bent hét aanspreekpunt voor meest complexe vragen omtrent uiteenlopende Power BI topics zoals dashboarding, modellering, governance & security.
Je bent in staat om onze klanten optimaal gebruik te laten maken van de ongekende mogelijkheden van Power BI. Jouw overtuigingskracht en passie komen hierbij goed van pas.
Door jouw coachende stijl weet je andere projectleden naar een hoger niveau tillen.
Innovatie en kennisdeling staat bij ons hoog op de agenda. We zijn altijd op zoek naar vernieuwing en verbetering bij onze klanten en we zijn actief met uitdagende innovatieprojecten. Je krijgt volop kansen om hierin actief deel te nemen.
Je komt terecht in een hecht, gedreven en gepassioneerd team waarin het aangenaam én leuk werken is. We hebben zelfs een eigen Data Solutions Fun Team.


Wat breng jij mee?

Je gelooft sterk in Power BI als BI tool en je wilt je nog verder verdiepen in deze materie. Bijgevolg heb je hierin ook al veel ervaring opgebouwd.
Je krijgt energie van het ontrafelen van de meest complexe Power BI vraagstukken en je wil steeds op de hoogte zijn van de laatste technologische ontwikkelingen.
Je kan jezelf een ware expert noemen in verschillende Power BI onderdelen zoals Power BI dashboarding, modellering, governance, Power BI embedded, Power BI RLS, …
Je hebt (of wenst) een Microsoft Certified Professional certificaat.
Je beschikt over een flexibele, zelfstandige en collegiale instelling.
Je beheerst de Nederlandse en Engelse taal. Spreek je ook Frans? Dat is een grote plus!


Wat hebben wij jou te bieden?

We vragen heel wat (talenten) van jou. Gelukkig krijg je er ook heel wat voor terug! Een krak zoals jij verdient immers het allerbeste!
Teamwerk in een open en dynamische sfeer met ruimte voor nieuwe, frisse ideeën en initiatieven.
Je komt terecht in een enthousiast team met veel expertise in business intelligence, data analyse, data science, data governance en data-engineering.
Je krijgt de kans om te werken aan uitdagende opdrachten voor gerenommeerde opdrachtgevers.
Projecten, groot en klein, waar je echt een stempel op kunt drukken.
Begeleiding op maat! Jij geeft aan waar je interesses liggen. We bieden verschillende carrièrepaden aan, en kijken samen hoe we je verder kunnen helpen ontplooien.
Bijleren en kennisdeling staan centraal.
Naast het competitief brutosalaris, een (elektrische) bedrijfswagen of mobiliteitsbudget, maaltijdcheques, ecocheques groeps-en hospitalisatieverzekering, gsm-abonnement, forfaitaire onkostenvergoeding en krachtige laptop, bieden we jou flexibele werkuren en een mooie work/life balans.
Dankzij ons Flex Reward Plan kunnen we een verloning op maat aanbieden.
Je vaste werkplek is het Cegeka kantoor dichtst bij je woonplaats (Antwerpen, Gent, Hasselt of Leuven) of vanuit je home office in combinatie met verplaatsingen naar de klant.
Show more Show less
HTML:
“Ik heb nog nooit in een team met zoveel Microsoft BI specialisten gezeten.” – Saar Gillis, Data Intelligence Architect. Kent Power BI voor jou geen geheimen meer? Ga jij complexe Power BI vraagstukken niet uit de weg en volg jij alle technologische wijzingen omtrent Power BI op de voet? Dan zou jij wel eens onze nieuwe Power BI specialist kunnen zijn.
  • Als Power BI specialist zal je het gesprek voeren met de klant om te komen tot de beste Power BI oplossingen. Je transformeert de functionele en technische requirements in de BI oplossingen van de toekomst.  
  • Jij bent hét aanspreekpunt voor meest complexe vragen omtrent uiteenlopende Power BI topics zoals dashboarding, modellering, governance & security.
  • Je bent in staat om onze klanten optimaal gebruik te laten maken van de ongekende mogelijkheden van Power BI. Jouw overtuigingskracht en passie komen hierbij goed van pas.
  • Door jouw coachende stijl weet je andere projectleden naar een hoger niveau tillen.
  • Innovatie en kennisdeling staat bij ons hoog op de agenda. We zijn altijd op zoek naar vernieuwing en verbetering bij onze klanten en we zijn actief met uitdagende innovatieprojecten. Je krijgt volop kansen om hierin actief deel te nemen.
  • Je komt terecht in een hecht, gedreven en gepassioneerd team waarin het aangenaam én leuk werken is. We hebben zelfs een eigen Data Solutions Fun Team.

Wat breng jij mee?
  • Je gelooft sterk in Power BI als BI tool en je wilt je nog verder verdiepen in deze materie. Bijgevolg heb je hierin ook al veel ervaring opgebouwd.
  • Je krijgt energie van het ontrafelen van de meest complexe Power BI vraagstukken en je wil steeds op de hoogte zijn van de laatste technologische ontwikkelingen.
  • Je kan jezelf een ware expert noemen in verschillende Power BI onderdelen zoals Power BI dashboarding, modellering, governance, Power BI embedded, Power BI RLS, …
  • Je hebt (of wenst) een Microsoft Certified Professional certificaat.
  • Je beschikt over een flexibele, zelfstandige en collegiale instelling.
  • Je beheerst de Nederlandse en Engelse taal. Spreek je ook Frans? Dat is een grote plus!

Wat hebben wij jou te bieden?
  • We vragen heel wat (talenten) van jou. Gelukkig krijg je er ook heel wat voor terug! Een krak zoals jij verdient immers het allerbeste!
  • Teamwerk in een open en dynamische sfeer met ruimte voor nieuwe, frisse ideeën en initiatieven.
  • Je komt terecht in een enthousiast team met veel expertise in business intelligence, data analyse, data science, data governance en data-engineering.
  • Je krijgt de kans om te werken aan uitdagende opdrachten voor gerenommeerde opdrachtgevers.
  • Projecten, groot en klein, waar je echt een stempel op kunt drukken.
  • Begeleiding op maat! Jij geeft aan waar je interesses liggen. We bieden verschillende carrièrepaden aan, en kijken samen hoe we je verder kunnen helpen ontplooien.
  • Bijleren en kennisdeling staan centraal.
  • Naast het competitief brutosalaris, een (elektrische) bedrijfswagen of mobiliteitsbudget, maaltijdcheques, ecocheques groeps-en hospitalisatieverzekering, gsm-abonnement, forfaitaire onkostenvergoeding en krachtige laptop, bieden we jou flexibele werkuren en een mooie work/life balans.
  • Dankzij ons Flex Reward Plan kunnen we een verloning op maat aanbieden.
  • Je vaste werkplek is het Cegeka kantoor dichtst bij je woonplaats (Antwerpen, Gent, Hasselt of Leuven) of vanuit je home office in combinatie met verplaatsingen naar de klant.

Title: Data & AI engineer
Description:
Lieu : Tubize, Belgium

Thales people architect solutions at the heart of the defence-security continuum. Interoperable and secure information and telecommunications systems for defence, security, and civil operators, are based upon innovative use of radiocommunications, networks, and cybersecurity. We are ground breaking new digital technologies such as 4G/5G mobile communications, cryptography, cloud computing and big data for use in physical protection systems, and critical information systems.

Thales Belgium SA, Belgium competence center of Thales, is a company located on 2 sites, one in Tubize (near Brussels) and the other one in Herstal (near Liège). Thales Belgium, which employs more than 280 collaborators, is specialized in the design, development and supply of critical information systems for customers in the sectors of Defense, Security (including Cyber) and Aerospace.

Mission

You will be part of the Innovation team of the company. You will be developing Proof-of-concepts in the context of various R&D projects. In particular, you will deploy data processing framework & develop artificial intelligence algorithms (Deep learning, Reinforcement learning). You will also contribute to the development of AI within Thales Belgium. You will be included in a team of both internal colleagues & external partners.

The working language is English, French is an asset.

Main Responsibilities & Profile

The data & AI scientist will be involved in a series of Proof-of-Concepts aiming at demonstrating the feasibility of introducing Artificial Intelligence (AI) in the development of various capabilities for future products. Your task will be:

to collect &/or emulate data;
to develop software allowing to process these data and make them usable by our AI;
to elaborate and train AI models and share this expertise with Eurocontrol by coaching junior data scientists within the team.
to participate in the development of AI within Thales Belgium, e.g. by building & operating an AI lab.
to write technical reports.

The following qualifications and skills are relevant and desirable for this role:

Technical

Experience and good knowledge of Python (tenserflow/keras, pandas, numpy, scipy, scikit-learn, matplotlib),
Experience and good knowledge of SQL querying.
A good knowledge of common statistical models and machine learning algorithms used in data science.
Understanding of HADOOP/Cloudera framework, inclusive HDFS, HIVE, IMPALA, SPARK ,…
Experience and good knowledge of Linux OS and scripting techniques (Bash/Ksh)

General

Excellent presentation and communication skills.
Experience with writing reports and publications related to AI topics in MS Word and/or LateX.
Ability to understand business needs and analyze data
A Master’s degree or PhD in data science with option AI, or relevant experience
Fluency in English is mandatory.

Required Abilities

Stress resistant, autonomy, sense of initiative
Versatility and flexibility
Customer driven and quality oriented
Interdisciplinary and creative, end-to-end commitment, focused and persistent
Team player, listening and communication skills

At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now!

Interested?

Apply now! Click on the button below to upload your profile and show your interest.

Diversity Statement

We actively support a working pattern that suits your lifestyle and helps you reach your ambitions. That means that equal opportunities, inclusion and an informal culture are integral to our success. It also means that your well-being and happiness matter to us! That’s why we offer you the flexibility to do what’s important to you; whether that’s part time hours, job sharing, remote working, or the ability to flex your start and finish times.

Title: Senior Data Analyst Reward
Description:
As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. This is what makes us different, and renders working here a unique, lifetime experience.




When you join our People Advisory Services department, you'll help local and global clients navigate the complex, ever-changing world. You’ll be working closely with colleagues across borders, using EY tools and networks to solve complex problems.




At EY you can expand your skills and learn about all aspects of data. We’ll provide the global scale, personal support, inclusive culture and technology to help you grow, lead and learn.




The opportunity




As a Senior Reward Data Analyst you will help the team and clients rethinking their reward and remuneration strategy based on the current available data and how to link them to the best solutions available in the market. Next to that you will also be involved in the implementation and the deploy of the new solutions with the required supporting technology and data analysis. We are flexible regarding the work location.




Your Key Responsibilities




If you are convinced that ‘Data is King’, then you are the new Senior Reward Data Analyst we are looking for. You will be part of our truly multidisciplinary team of remuneration experts, technology geeks and data wizards. You will be dragged into projects answering client questions such as:




How can we give extra insights to companies regarding their employees (Dynamic Dashboards regarding Compensation & Benefits, Salary Evolutions, Pension Build up, possible savings, Absenteïsm, Turnover…)
Smart scans of remuneration packages (fe payoll data) to look for optimizations (better cost-net relationship, Tax and Social Security savings, market comparison, legal constraints…)
How can we optimize the current remuneration package of the employee population based on the current data?
How can we align remuneration packages of one or more companies being in a M&A?
How can we create a lasting People Experience in the mobility strategy?
What are the new trends in the market?




Skills And Attributes For Success




You have 3 to 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst
You have an innovative and collaborative mindset
You can work with data analysis programs or are eager to learn how to work with them (e.g. Excel, Alteryx, R, Python, Spotfire, Power BI,…)
You are enthusiastic to work with your colleagues and to deliver the exceptional experience to our clients
Curious, innovative nature that strives to solve client problems in a new way
You are fluent in Dutch or French and English




What Working At EY Offers




Attractive remuneration package - We offer an attractive remuneration package; including a company car and fuel card, iPhone plus subscription, health insurance, pension plan, meal vouchers and eco vouchers. Thanks to our flex plan, you can choose what you value most; extra days off, leasing an electric bike, etc.
Flexible working arrangements - We are proud of our flexible working arrangements. We will actively support you in building a successful career and delivering excellent client service without sacrificing your personal priorities. We offer flexible working hours and working from home multiple days per week is possible.
Inspiring work environment - At EY we are dedicated to providing you with an inspiring work environment. A work environment which allows you to further develop your skills and enables you to fulfill your true potential.
Personal growth - You will receive numerous trainings and will be coached by a counselor. We offer a clear career path tailored to your unique skills.
Fun - By joining our EY- teams, you can participate in team activities, family days, summer and winter events, sports events and enjoy a drink during our monthly Thirsty Thursday happy hour.
Sustainability – we have a fleet of hybrid and electric cars. Our flex plan makes it possible for people that don’t want a company car to choose a more sustainable option.
Diversity & inclusion - At EY we are passionate about the inclusion and support of individuals of all groups; we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, or disability status.
Location: all of our offices are easily accessible by public transport or by car and have parking space




It’s yours to build. Apply now.
Show more Show less

Title: Web & Analytics Specialist (automotive)
Description:
Are you a multi-tasking sensei, with a black belt in handling various web-related projects? Do you know how to knock out all the devils in the details? Is your secret weapon your flair for languages? And are you ready to show off your web-martial skills in a premium environment? Then please read your following secret mission.




We are seeking a Web and Analytics Specialist for one of our clients. Do you match the description? You are a Web and Analytics Specialist and …

you have a minimum of 3 years of experience.
you have a basic knowledge of web techniques, preferably CMS systems.
you speak Dutch or French as your mother tongue and English is your second or third-best language.
you have a great affinity with languages, and understand the client’s tone of voice without any problem.
you think solution- and customer oriented.
you are familiar with Google Analytics and SEO.
you thrive in a premium environment.
nothing gets by you, the devil is in the details.
you are at ease in the e-commerce and innovative world.




As a Web and Analytics Specialist …

you keep an overview of incoming tasks and write briefings for stakeholders, including agencies, who follow up on other languages.
you proactively monitor the website and guide your colleagues both domestically and internationally.
you confirm the information and ask for input from internal and external colleagues. • you work on a project from start to finish and keep stakeholders informed.
you work proactively on the website, from reviewing to analyzing to optimizing. • you create new (campaign) pages (local market) and check them (global level).
you use your feeling for language to suggest adjustments and improve pages.
you regularly provide the website with thorough content checks.
you analyze the performance of the website and suggest improvements.




But your job is not just limited to the above.

You become part of our client’s incredible team.

You are able to choose when you work from home or the office in agreement with your manager. You partake in company drinks, outings, dinners, trips, and team building. You get an attractive salary package including meal vouchers (Sodexo), hospitalization insurance, and smart mobility solutions.




Interested? Send your CV to hello@indiandribble.com and tell us why you are the missing link and why you want to join our team

Title: BI Qlik Consultant
Description:
Position Purpose

We are looking for a BI Consultant to strengthen the IQVIA Business Intelligence and Data Science team.

But wait;

Are you up for the challenge;

To change the world where you live in?

To have an impact on life?

To have an impact on the way how pharmaceutical drugs are developed and released to you and your family?

To design dashboards and solutions that have a direct impact on the end to end delivery of projects that are key for our pharma customers?




If you are, read on!




As a team player, you will be integrated into the flex pool that delivers high quality analytical projects following the established standard & guidelines framework set in place.

Teamwork, good communication and hands on mentality are key for a successful integration into our team, are you the professional we are looking for?




Principle Accountabilities:

Your main focus will be situated on the analysis and design of relevant solutions as well as the technical development of these solutions.
Interface with different parties to understand their business requirements, which you will translate into solutions & applications;
You will be involved in all phases of the project, from requirement gathering to delivery, as well as defining best practices and building innovative solutions; You are able to demonstrate creativity, flexibility, autonomy and efficiency, within a dynamic, evolving environment;
You will work as a consultant of IQVIA on the Belgium market




Education, Experience, Soft skills & Specialized Knowledge Required:

A Bachelor’s or Master degree with minimal 5 years of relevant work experience;
Languages: Dutch or French and English
Experience in gathering and challenging requirements and translating these into a design and/or solution;
Hands-on front-end development experience in Business Intelligence projects.
A customer-oriented personality with positive drive and a pragmatic, innovative approach
High interest in qualitative and quantitative data analysis and interpretation;
You are curious and pragmatic;
You are able to work as part of a team or independently;
You are self-motivated & proactive;
Stress-resilient with the ability to juggle multiple priorities




Any of the following elements are considered as a big plus:

Affinity with the healthcare sector
Data modelling skills
Knowledge of Data Warehousing, Scorecarding and performance management solutions.
Knowledge of Qlik Sense / QlikView / PowerBI, Denodo and other BI/DWH Tools
Working in Agile mode
General project management skills




We offer you:

Possibility to follow trainings to keep evolving
Possibility to work from home or from one if the IQVIA offices on multiple days per week.
company car and fuel card
Meal vouchers
A great team to work in and to count on
Challenging projects and challenging customers
The possibility to work in a sector that is now more than ever so important to you, your family and your friends
Show more Show less

Title: Analyst/Associate, Infrastructure Sector
Description:
Analyst / Associate, Infrastructure Sector




Your work environment




We are looking for our next colleague to join our Brussels based Infrastructure Sector team within Wholesale Banking.




Our team is part of ING’s global Infrastructure franchise located in Brussels, London, Madrid, New York and Sydney. We cover primarily infrastructure funds, as well as infrastructure companies (e.g. airports, regulated utilities, ferries) and contractors active in infrastructure projects.




Our Brussels team acts as a centre of excellence, thus our geographical scope is the wider EMEA region, so you will work primarily on international transactions.




We aim to provide creative multi-product solutions through a broad range of services (from debt capital markets, to a.o. sustainability linked products), and our team is expert in delivering acquisition financing, traditional project finance, whole business securitisation and fund financing structures.




Our ambition is to leverage on ING’s key three pillars:




Our global reach, with local experts
We are sector experts
We are sustainability pioneers




Key words for the work are creativity, complexity and international focus which makes this environment an area particularly suited for candidates with strong analytical skills, tenacity, eye for detail and high commercial drive.




Your Key Responsibilities




Working in the front office, you will be involved in the origination, structuring, negotiation, execution and monitoring of transactions. Depending on experience, job level and background, the role includes a.o.:




Assist with pitching, origination and execution of new transactions
Run sensitivity analysis on complex financial models and occasionally develop our own models
Draft new business proposals, credit modifications and annual reviews
Perform client and credit administration primarily through timely, complete and correct data input and data management in the relevant support systems in line with internal procedures and guidelines
Participate in client and bank calls/meetings
Side projects such as internal reporting and business development




We look for




A colleague with a talent for taking it on and making it happen, enthusiasm for helping others to be successful and a knack for always being a step ahead.




As an Analyst/Associate within the Infrastructure sector team, you will also need:




Strong academic record, with relevant master’s degree in business economics, financial engineering or law
Interest for the Infrastructure sector and/or structured finance
A true team player with good communication skills
Entrepreneurial and commercial drive
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and in Dutch
Strong quantitative, financial and analytical skills
Strong eye for detail in all deliverables
Eager to learn and share knowledge with colleagues
Ability to work independently on various transactions/projects at the same time, often under pressure, and to prioritize resources accordingly




We offer you




A clear purpose, a unique offer and a range of benefits:




Personal growth & challenging work with endless opportunities to realise your ambitions
Informal, dynamic environment with innovative colleagues supporting your endeavours
Experience an international environment and collaborate with colleagues across the globe
On-the-job training to translate theory into practice, learning from highly experienced professionals
A flexible hybrid way of working, subject to team’s arrangements




We are committed to the principle of equal opportunity in employment. The Company is opposed to any form of less favourable treatment, whether through unfair, inconsistent direct or indirect discrimination, accorded to employees and applicants for employment on the grounds of sex, sexual orientation, marital or parental status, disability, race, religion or belief, age, creed, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin.

Title: Digital Analyst
HTML:
We are looking for talented and dedicated Digital Analyst to join the newly formed Digital Commerce / Web Platforms technology organization which powers TUI’s global e-commerce services and solutions across all European markets.


About The Job


  • Work with the Optimisation & Insight Lead and the Product Manager to support and shape strategic product initiatives through the application of data and insight, drawing on knowledge from other teams (e.g. customer analytics, commercial analytics, Digital Research, and Digital Experience) where applicable;
  • Monitor the live performance of your digital product, and produce meaningful regular reports on that to share with the rest of the team;
  • Generate new ideas from your data observations and understanding of the strategy and objectives of the pod, ensuring the constant evolution and improvement of the digital product;
  • Use your analytical tools and understanding to help inform MVP and defect prioritization, ensuring that these decisions have a basis in data and customer understanding;
  • As ideas approach build you will actively promote the benefits of split-testing, which is a growing programme with the wider objective of embedding a test and learn culture in our business. You will be comfortable in A/B and multivariate test hypotheses and then presenting your insights, scientifically proven to the appropriate stakeholders;
  • As part of A/B testing and analysis, you will: be an active participant in ideation sessions for your pod, work with the architecture team to maintain data integrity and raise user stories to specify data needs from a business perspective, build a measurement plan, and produce insightful analysis and reports.


About You


  • Digital analytics experience, ideally in a product optimisation/ agile scrum environment;
  • Experience in using enterprise level digital analytics solutions, ideally Adobe Analytics, Target, GA 360, Firebase and BQ. You're also an established advanced user of Microsoft Excel;
  • A/B and multivariate testing experience, with an understanding of statistical concepts like sample size calculation, significance, Type I and Type II errors;
  • Appreciation and/or implementation experience of digital analytics data collection methods;
  • Numerate and analytical mind set with a focus on the commercial benefits of making changes;
  • Good communication and presentation skills, including ability to communicate complex data effectively to a variety of audiences via a variety of means (visual, verbal and written);
  • Highly organized and process-driven, with a passion for data and delivering meaningful insights. You also have an understanding of digital data collection techniques and limitations;
  • Good stakeholder management abilities with ability to educate and drive change. You also have strong interpersonal skills and teamwork focus, and strong learning agility with enthusiasm to learn and develop new skills;
  • Wider knowledge of digital technology (outside of analytics) preferable.


About Our Offer


  • Working in an international team who are working with forward thinking methodologies like Lean and Agile.
  • Become a valued team member of TUI, the No.1 global and socially aware travel company.
  • Develop yourself by working as part of an international team and through our free global learning and development programme including free language lessons and various Management Development Programmes.


We love to see your uniqueness shine through and inspire the future of travel. If you would like to read more about what Diversity & Inclusion means to us simply visit Our DNA..

Title: Internship Big Data analysis for Future Vehicles
Description:
Company Information

TOYOTA is one of the world’s largest automobile manufacturers and a leading global corporation. Founded in 1937, Toyota now sells vehicles in 170 countries and employs over 300.000 people. As a company, Toyota Motor Europe focuses on sustainability and future generations and strongly promotes diversity, inclusion and gender equality. We are highly interested in receiving the applications from professionals of all backgrounds and genders looking to build their career in either scientific, engineering or corporate positions.

Based in Brussels, Belgium, and staffed by 2.700 people and more than 60 nationalities, Toyota Motor Europe (TME) handles the wholesale marketing of Toyota and Lexus vehicles, parts & accessories, and manages Toyota’s European R&D, manufacturing and engineering operations.

For Toyota, Quality is a way of life. Nothing is so good that it cannot be made better, that is why we strive for continuous improvement in everything we do. This basic principle for us is called: “KAIZEN” and is what guides us in our pursuit of best Quality and the delivery of unparalleled customer’s satisfaction.

Check Out

https://www.linkedin.com/company/toyota-motor-europe

https://www.linkedin.com/company/kinto-mobility/

We offer a dynamic multicultural work environment and the opportunity to be part of a highly motivated team where collaboration, creativity, courage, and curiosity play an important role. You will be working on exciting projects and benefit from a thorough on the job development, coaching and training.

Your commitment will be rewarded with a renumeration package. We provide flexibility to take care of both your career and your personal life by providing hybrid work environment with structural possibility to both work from home & collaborate in the office. You can also take your work abroad for up to 20 days/year.

At Toyota Motor Europe, we are committed to providing equal employment opportunity to all. All of our recruitment decisions are based on the individual and their qualifications along with the job requirements. The selection process is without regard to nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, religion, ethnicity, disability or other personal characteristics. We do not tolerate harassment or discrimination as our individual experiences and overall diversity is our key strength. Together we have the power to make a positive change and go beyond the ordinary.

If you need any specific consideration for the interview process due to disability or any other reason, please let the recruiter know.

Your Profile

Student in last year of master study (can be PhD), data science, automotive or computer engineering
Highly skilled in Python
Excellent profieciency of machine learning techniques and algorithms (ML model develpment lifecycle)
Good knowledge in parallel computing using DASK or SPARK
Experienced in time series data and signal processing
Experienced working with JupyterHub and Git
Proficiency in using query languages such as SQL
Experienced in python-based visualization tools like Dash and Streamlit
Good knowledge in IT and software development
Good knowledge and interest in automotive, software, Big Data
Knowledge in technology, connectivity, digital economy
Fluent in English (reading; writing; speaking) and flexible team player
Seek facts before making recommendations or decisions, have strong planning and organizing skills
Communicate in a clear and timely manner
Multi-tasking and ability to work in various projects

Place of employment

Toyota Motor Europe (Brussels)

Duration

6 months, start date March 2023

Confidentiality

Due to business requirement, not all performed projects can be reflected in the internship report. This issue needs to be discussed with candidate/school in advance.

It is mandatory that applicants are students for the entire period of the internship. Interested in this internship, please apply online via www.toyotajobs.com

You Have a Toyota DNA, This Means You Show

Courage: you are ready to let go of the easy path to reach challenging targets
Collaboration: you are a team player, respectful and inclusive in your style and you take a customer-oriented approach
Creativity: your passion drives you to explore innovative ideas and challenge the impossible
Curiosity: you combine imagination and fact-based observation
Coaching: you share knowledge and feedback with your colleagues and celebrate each other’s success

Team/division Description

Your team and your responsibilities

In the R&D Group, the Technical Planning & Incubation (TPI) has the mission to pick up key future technologies and to get them included in the internal agenda.

To support the moving towards becoming a Mobility Company, the competencies on handling Big Data is now a key asset and a transversal team lead by TSP has been setup.

Your project

As intern you will be supporting the Big Data team to:

Perform data analysis on large amount of structured and unstructured data
Develop pipelines for data cleaning and pre-processing particularly on signal data
Develop custom data models, prediction systems and machine learning algorithms for various data projects
Collaborate with business and IT team to design and develop the end-to-end data analytics solutions/tools
Present and communicate the outcomes in a clear manner for both technical and non-technical audiences
Create self-contained documentations and reports for data projects assigned
Provide support and assist on-demand for governance of the multiple big data analytics projects

We can only accept students with an EEA or Swiss citizenship (not requiring a work permit or visa to be eligible to perform an internship in Belgium)

Title: BI Azure Analyst
Description:
Ontex is a leading international producer of personal hygiene solutions for babies, women and adults. We distribute in more than 110 countries through leading retailer private labels, as well as under our own brands. The group employs over 10,000 employees, spread around the world. Ontex is listed on Euronext Brussels.




Our people are our most valuable asset. To support and reinforce our IT team we are looking for a BI Azure Analyst.




Mission and Key Tasks




Are you passionate about how data and analytics enable fact-based decision making and drive business success? Then you might be the ideal Business Intelligence Azure analyst Ontex is looking for!




We are looking for a business oriented Azure professional who acts as the BI-sherpa for the business stakeholders, based upon his/her experience and passion for data and analytics. You will work on our BI Azure stack which is integrated with the Enterprise BI environment (SAP BW on Hana). In this way, you will have a crucial role in the successful realization of Ontex’ Analytics strategy.




The Business Intelligence Azure analyst is responsible for performing advanced data analytics at scale and incorporating advanced analytics capabilities. They are the sherpa of the business on their journey from the traditional table-focused business intelligence reports towards state-of-the-art business intelligence applications (user friendly, qualitative and performant). As well as self-service BI capabilities, enabling them to gain quicker business insights and guide them in making factual based decisions.




Main Tasks




Act as a true business partner on Business Intelligence, fulfilling an essential bridge function between the business stakeholders and IT on multiple business domains. You focus on maximizing the user adoption of the available BI solutions in order to realize the business value they can bring.
Collect the business requirements and describe these in clear functional specifications.
You are responsible to extend our Azure Data platform.
Design the BI data model and reports/visualizations and guarantee these apply to the BI best practices in terms of architecture, data quality, performance and security (in collaboration with the Azure Data Engineer)
Realize the successful technical implementation, to deliver data driven insights.
Participate actively in the day-to-day operations
Drive the Self-Service Analytics as a key complimentary BI capability next to Enterprise BI, both from a solution as well as from a People & Processes point of view.
Assist colleagues by thinking in terms of “combining strengths” and “team”.
Follow up the technical and functional evolutions on Business Intelligence.




Background and Experience




University degree in Business Engineering, Business & Information Systems, Economics or equivalent based on experience
Minimum 5 years of experience with Power BI
Good Business Intelligence and data modeling know-how
Strong business acumen, with a specific focus on how Business Intelligence leads to better business insights as an enabler for improved business results
Minimum 3 years of experience with Azure and able to understand common data components like Data Lake, Data Factory, Synapse, Time Series, IoT Hub, Stream Analytics,...
Experience with Databricks is a plus
Experience with Self-Service Analytics is a plus
Experience with Digital sources like Google Analytics, Facebook, … is a plus
Analytical mind and a flexible, pro-active and result driven attitude
Team player with excellent communication skills
Efficient planning and organizational skills
Excellent knowledge of English




Interested in a job at Ontex, but want additional information? Contact our HR manager (tatiana.izmaylova@ontexglobal.com).
