Title: Data Analyst
Description:
WIN Reality was founded with a simple goal in mind: to give softball and baseball players the tools to succeed. To provide hope and opportunity in a game where even the greats fail frequently. WIN Reality is changing how baseball and softball players across the world train to get better. Our team is full of world class developers changing the VR landscape, former professional ballplayers dedicated to improving the way the game is played, and people passionate about creating a one of a kind experience.

Data Analyst

Location: Austin, TX.

WIN Reality has an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst to join our growing Finance Team!

We are looking for a Financial Data Analyst to build complex datasets that deliver insights for internal stakeholders across a number of business units at WIN Reality.

Responsibilities

Manipulate complex datasets to deliver business insights and drive incrementality to stakeholders by utilizing multiple platforms and languages (SQL, Python, VBA).
Develop and sustain dynamic, self-serve dashboards for stakeholders (all hands, specific teams, executive team, and board of directors).
Identify opportunities to drive growth and profitability through analysis and research.
Execute qualitative and quantitative analysis (e.g., customer segmentation, market sizing, competitor analysis, pricing strategy, product mix, etc) to support the formulation and validation of strategic recommendations.
Lead customer, segment, and competitive intelligence gathering and strategic interpretation.
Support the go-to-market business planning, resource, and performance reporting across the enterprise and consumer divisions.
Consult with key business stakeholders throughout the organization to understand and support business challenges with data-driven insights, proactively uncover potential risks, and identify productivity improvements for scaling.
Create what-if analyses and supporting presentations, through data collection and review, to assess the impact of business opportunities on our financial goals, providing insightful decision bases for senior management.
Explore and recommend new data sources (internal and external) and perform secondary research using a variety of sources (e.g., analyst reports, market research reports, and news articles).
Challenge and improve our existing business intelligence and analytics tools and processes.


Qualifications

A Bachelor's or master's degree in Finance, Economics, Information Systems, Statistics, or Physics related field
2 - 5 years of professional work experience in a data analysis or finance-related field
Experience with Business Intelligence tools (Tableau, DOMO, etc) and data visualization
Proficient in data processing, including analysis of big data using Excel, SQL, Python, or R
Experience with regression analysis
Ability to work cross-functionally and independently
Reliable, academically rigorous, and coachable


WIN Reality offers:

Competitive Base Salary, Benefits (Health/Dental/Vision), 401K, generous PTO, Paid Holidays, and a Beautiful Office Space overlooking Ladybird Lake and Downtown Austin w/ Onsite Fitness Center and Nature Trail access.
WIN Reality swings for a Fun & Energetic Culture that knocks it out of the Park.
Awarded Best Places to Work in Austin 2022!


WIN Reality is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements

  • 2 - 5 years of professional work experience in a data analysis or finance-related field
  • Experience with Business Intelligence tools (Tableau, DOMO, etc) and data visualization
  • Proficient in data processing, including analysis of big data using Excel, SQL, Python, or R
  • Experience with regression analysis
  • Ability to work cross-functionally and independently
  • Reliable, academically rigorous, and coachable

WIN Reality offers:
  • Competitive Base Salary, Benefits (Health/Dental/Vision), 401K, generous PTO, Paid Holidays, and a Beautiful Office Space overlooking Ladybird Lake and Downtown Austin w/ Onsite Fitness Center and Nature Trail access.
  • WIN Reality swings for a Fun & Energetic Culture that knocks it out of the Park.
  • Awarded Best Places to Work in Austin 2022!

WIN Reality is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements

Title: Data Analyst Remote
Description:
Job Description Will work with the management team to design and maintain effective reporting, analyses and presentation of performance data. The successful candidate will be able to listen to business needs and create systems to identify and track business trends across multiple systems and put them all together. The data analyst will provide regular performance and production information in detailed format for internal review and analysis and in dashboard form for stakeholder review and overview.

Responsibilities

Acquires and presents data from all collected data sources
Designs and schedules reports in Chronicall, Crystal Reports and additional proprietary software
Develops and implements data analyses, data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Works with management team and board staff to develop and implement automated quality control plans
Monitors performance and quality control plans to identify areas for improvement and reports exceptions
Develops measurement plans and dashboards, monitors metrics
Collaborates with management team on ad-hoc analysis to uncover root cause of trends to help predict future resource needs
Responds to management requests to extract data, design and produce reports



Required Skills

Expertise with SQL queries and Crystal Reports Designer
Proven work experience as a data analyst
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets
Experience with the following preferred: Excel, Crystal Reports, Crystal Dashboard, MSSAQL, SSRS, Chronicall, DocuWare and Relational Database Management Systems
Professional certification: MCSA: SQL would be a plus
Excellent written, verbal skills and math skills

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
1106220_RR00071767 Job ID: 1106220_RR00071767

NYU Langone Health is a world-class, patient-centered, integrated academic medical center, known for its excellence in clinical care, research, and education. It comprises more than 200 locations throughout the New York area, including five inpatient locations, a children's hospital, three emergency rooms and a level 1 trauma center. Also part of NYU Langone Health is the Laura and Isaac Perlmutter Cancer Center, a National Cancer Institute designated comprehensive cancer center, and NYU Grossman School of Medicine, which since 1841 has trained thousands of physicians and scientists who have helped to shape the course of medical history. At NYU Langone Health, equity, diversity, and inclusion are fundamental values. We strive to be a place where our exceptionally talented faculty, staff, and students of all identities can thrive. We embrace diversity, inclusion, and individual skills, ideas, and knowledge. For more information, go to nyulangone.org, and interact with us on LinkedIn, Glassdoor, Indeed, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube and Instagram.

Position Summary

We have an exciting opportunity to join our team as a Data Analyst.

In this role, the successful candidate is responsible for supporting the day to day operations of the vendor management team as well as activities across data management. The Data Analyst will be responsible for key vendor management activities including the day to day operations of the vendor master third-party software as well as PeopleSoft vendor maintenance. This including invites, sanctions and financial validation, updates and service ticket resolution or other production tasks as assigned. The Data Analyst will also support analytics, ongoing projects and business process improvements related to data management activities in PeopleSoft and other sub-systems.

Job Responsibilities

Establish documentation, including onboarding of vendor through our third-party solution as well as through PeopleSoft.
Manage hospital locations and related account numbers across systems (PeopleSoft, GHX).
Implement data management best practices to ensure the integrity of the data, quality of data processes, and deliver analyzable data to various internal and external parties.
Collaborate with Supply Chain users to solicit feedback on the onboarding process for continuous improvement.
Create reports and dashboards based on business needs.
Document, implement, maintain and recommend operating methods to improve processing, distribution, and data flow.
Identify and implement additional opportunities to automate data flow.
Partner with fellow Supply Chain data owners to monitor and resolve data issues at the root-cause.
Conduct financial analyses including impact of price changes and utilization as needed.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications

To qualify you must have a Bachelor's degree. Strong experience and expertise in Excel. Has a high level of accountability, inquisitive in nature, detail-oriented and able to work both independently and within a team on multiple projects simultaneously. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Experienced in creating documentation and establishing policies and procedures. Must have a strong background in vendor management or procurement operations, technology or supply chain.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience with SQL, Alteryx and any other supply chain management technologies are preferred.

Qualified candidates must be able to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization.

NYU Langone Health provides its staff with far more than just a place to work. Rather, we are an institution you can be proud of, an institution where you'll feel good about devoting your time and your talents.

NYU Langone Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer committed to diversity and inclusion in all aspects of recruiting and employment. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration without regard to race, color, gender, gender identity or expression, sex, sexual orientation, transgender status, gender dysphoria, national origin, age, religion, disability, military and veteran status, marital or parental status, citizenship status, genetic information or any other factor which cannot lawfully be used as a basis for an employment decision. We require applications to be completed online.

If you wish to view NYU Langone Health's EEO policies, please click here. Please click here to view the Federal "EEO is the law" poster or visit https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm for more information.

NYU Langone Health provides a salary range to comply with the New York City Law on Salary Transparency in Job Advertisements. The salary range for the role is $53,457.10 - $83,200.00 Annually. Actual salaries depend on a variety of factors, including experience, specialty, education, and hospital need. The salary range or contractual rate listed does not include bonuses/incentive, differential pay or other forms of compensation or benefits.

To view the Pay Transparency Notice, please click here

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job TitleData Analyst

Job Description

Effective Tuesday, January 4, 2022, all U.S.-based employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID as a condition of employment at Philips*.  Employees may request a reasonable accommodation. *Montana employees are currently excluded from this requirement at this time.

If you are a Colorado resident and this role is a field-based or remote role, you may be eligible to receive additional information about the compensation and benefits for this role, which we will provide upon request.  You may contact 888-367-7223, option 5, for assistance. 

Philips is a global leader in health technology, committed to improving billions of lives worldwide and striving to make the world healthier and more sustainable through innovation. Driven by the vision of a better tomorrow.

But it’s not just what we do, it’s who we are. We are 80,000, wonderfully unique individuals, with two things in common: An unwavering sense of purpose and a relentless determination to deliver on our customers’ needs. It’s what inspires us to create meaningful solutions – the kind that make a real difference – when it matters most.

The world and our customers’ needs are changing faster than ever before and while we are proud of what we do already, we know we can do more. That’s why we need you, to help us tackle increasingly complex challenges posed by ever evolving health and well-being needs.

In this role, you have the opportunity to make life better

Looking at the challenges the world is facing today Philips’ purpose has never been more relevant. So, whatever your role, if you share our passion for helping others, you’ll be working towards creating a better and fairer future for all.

Develop project management, leadership and interpersonal skills by driving metric activities and process improvements for Philips’ Image Guided Therapy Device (PIGT-D) business unit. The role will be responsible for working with individual data owners to ensure effective, timely metric submissions and regularly providing data to upper leadership as well as focusing on individual career growth.

You are responsible for




Ensuring timely delivery of reports, analytics, and insights to all functional areas of IGTD, including but not limited to Quality Norms, and KPI reports.

Working with cross functional teams to compile the Quality System Trending and Corporate Quality Management Review presentations, tracking action items, and working with data owners on formatting and content.

Releasing Management Reviews and Trending reports in the documentation system.

Compiling, analyzing, and delivering quality and safety performance trending reports to identify product issues.

Manipulating large data sets using innovative tools as well as proven techniques to disseminate complex raw information into a clear and concise format for presentations to large cross functional groups.

Building custom data queries and standardized reports by collaborating with internal customers to understand their needs.

Cultivating credibility and strong relationships with business partners to provide resolution or alternate solutions to business segments.

Contribute and support improvements to procedures and work instructions to ensure reliable, repeatable results.

Support ongoing compliance improvement initiatives, including CAPAs, product recalls, product recertification and license renewal, audits, and Regulatory/Clinical.



You are part of

A company in which solutions combine navigational tools such as catheters and guide wires with advanced software to help confirm the optimal treatment at the point of care: measurement technology, procedure-specific application support and on-board imaging and monitoring with improved anatomical and functional information to optimize therapy delivery. ​​ The IGT Devices organization consists of three segments: Coronary, Peripheral Vascular and Electrophysiology.

To succeed in this role, you’ll need a customer-first attitude and the following


US work authorization is a precondition of employment. The company will not consider candidates who require sponsorship for a work-authorized visa.

Bachelor’s degree in an engineering, mathematics or scientific-related field or equivalent demonstrated strong technical competence

Strong Project Management skills, including ability to project manage all trending and reporting activities.

Experience with MS Office - Excel, Word, PowerPoint.

Experience with Windchill PDLM System, CATSWeb System, Oracle and Agile databases a plus.

Experience with SQL Server databases and creating SQL Queries a plus.

Demonstrated ability to partner with the business and effectively interact with and influence employees, and managers on all levels.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Working knowledge of appropriate global regulations, requirements, and standards such as 21 CFR Parts 820, ISO 13485, and ISO 14971.

Related experience in medical device or other regulated industry a plus.



In return, we offer you

Our benefits can be found here:  https://www.careers.philips.com/na/en/total-rewards-at-philips

How we work at Philips

Our newly adopted hybrid work concept fuses flexibility with collaboration to deliver great outcomes for our people and our customers. We are embracing an approach wherein we spend more time together than apart – which for full-time employees translates to an average of at least 3 days working from the office and up to 2 days from home – for our hybrid roles.​

Hybrid work flexibility means people can meet the changing demands of work and home in the most balanced, productive, and healthy way. 

Our hybrid working model is defined in 3 ways:​

We believe in the importance of impactful collaboration: There's a certain energy when everyone’s in the same room that can heighten idea generation and creative friction needed for problem-solving.

We embrace flexibility: Choosing where, when, and how to work can vary according to task and team schedules. Flexibility isn’t office or online, it means choosing the space that works best for you, your teams, and our customers on a case-by-case basis. ​

We want to be at our best: The way we work, and our workspaces are designed to support our well-being, offer career advancement opportunities, and enable us to be at our best. ​

Why should you join Philips?

Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on innovative, customer-first health technology solutions. Help us improve the health and well-being of billions of people, every year. Ultimately creating a career that no one could have planned for. Even you.

Visit our careers website to explore what it’s like working at Philips, read stories from our employee blog, find information about our recruitment process and answers to some frequently asked questions.





It is the policy of Philips to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all colleagues and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, pregnancy/childbirth, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability or perceived disability, genetic information, citizenship, veteran or military status or a person’s relationship or association with a protected veteran, including spouses and other family members, marital or domestic partner status, or any other category protected by federal, state and/or local laws.

As an equal opportunity employer, Philips is committed to a diverse workforce. In order to ensure reasonable accommodation for individuals protected by Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Vietnam Veterans' Readjustment Act of 1974, and Title I of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990, applicants that require accommodation in the job application process may contact 888-367-7223, option 5, for assistance.Equal Opportunity Employer/Disabled/Veteran

Philips maintains a drug-free workplace

Title: Investment Data Analyst
Description:
Summary of Responsibilities:

Primarily responsible for maintenance of Fort Washington's data governance and data management platform. Implements data governance processes to ensure data integrity by developing efficient processes and controls. Analyzes and provides business requirements for database design, data models and data movement. Understands methodologies and technologies that depict the flow of data within systems and the business requirements and processes that need to be supported. Partners with business users and IT to document business requirements and translates into actionable data modeling, data movement and translation programs. Develops and supports Ft. Washington's data dictionary and plays major role in data governance activities. Works under minimal supervision and escalates to manager when appropriate.




Position Responsibilities:

Responsible for daily maintenance of Fort Washington's data governance and data management platforms.
Maintains data integrity to ensure compliance with data governance process.
Works with business users and IT to develop data requirements, including movement and transformation requirements between systems.
Serves as liaison and consults with ETL developers, data modelers and IT programmers related to business- specific technical specifications and mapping documents.
Documents business processes and data flow diagrams.
Supports technical aspects of Varden eReportal, including constructing SQL queries to support report creation.
Develops statistical models to support risk and custom analytics practices.
Performs lead business role and partners with IT in selection and development of business intelligence tools.
Performs lead business role in data visualization projects (heat maps, charting, trending, etc.).
Supports development of Varden data validations and workflows.
Supports data management software, develops necessary logic to support data validation and quality assurance.
Targets opportunities to minimize risk and eliminate data redundancy.
Develops data hierarchies where appropriate.
Performs lead role in identifying additional data sources and automation opportunities.
Performs lead business role and partners with IT in development of data governance programs.
Creates and maintains FWIA data dictionary.
Performs other duties as assigned by management.




Selection Criteria:

Demonstrated project management skills, especially pertaining to technical projects and vague or unknown initial requirements.
Proven excellent relationship-building skills regarding IT functions (e.g., programmers, data modelers, data architects, etc.).
Proven experience creating effective business requirement documents and communicating them to the appropriate parties.
Possesses and displays excellent verbal and written communication skills with ability to convey information to internal and external customers in a clear, focused and concise manner.
Must have the ability to record and deliver information, to explain procedures, to follow oral and written instructions; and to communicate effectively and efficiently.
Must have the ability to read a variety of correspondence, reports, and forms. Must have the ability to prepare correspondence, reports and forms using prescribed formats and conforming to proper rules of punctuation, grammar, diction, and style.
Proven strong analytical skills, including demonstrated experience identifying and quantifying problems and providing effective resolutions with the ability to conceptualize and use new methodologies. Must have the ability to apply principles of logical thinking to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
Proven experience working with complex programs that require identifying complex data and analyzing the quality of the output provided.
Superior data access skills; access, transform and manipulate internal and external data in its base form.

Educational Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree.

Computer skills and knowledge of hardware & software required:

Demonstrated experience with BI tools (Microstrategy, Tableau, etc.), statistical software tools, or SQL in a business environment.
Demonstrated knowledge of data-related tools and industry standards (ETL, business intelligence, report writing, SQL reporting services, Crystal Reports, etc.).
Integration tools (DTS, SSIS, Informatica, etc.) preferred.
Microsoft Office suite of products.

Certifications & licenses (i.e. Series 6 & 63, CPA, etc.):

Data-related certifications a plus.

Position Demands:

Must be able to remain in a stationary position 50% of the time.
Extended hours required during peak workloads and special projects.

  • Proven excellent relationship-building skills regarding IT functions (e.g., programmers, data modelers, data architects, etc.).
  • Proven experience creating effective business requirement documents and communicating them to the appropriate parties.
  • Possesses and displays excellent verbal and written communication skills with ability to convey information to internal and external customers in a clear, focused and concise manner.
  • Must have the ability to record and deliver information, to explain procedures, to follow oral and written instructions; and to communicate effectively and efficiently.
  • Must have the ability to read a variety of correspondence, reports, and forms. Must have the ability to prepare correspondence, reports and forms using prescribed formats and conforming to proper rules of punctuation, grammar, diction, and style.
  • Proven strong analytical skills, including demonstrated experience identifying and quantifying problems and providing effective resolutions with the ability to conceptualize and use new methodologies. Must have the ability to apply principles of logical thinking to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
  • Proven experience working with complex programs that require identifying complex data and analyzing the quality of the output provided.
  • Superior data access skills; access, transform and manipulate internal and external data in its base form.

Educational Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree.

Computer skills and knowledge of hardware & software required:

  • Demonstrated experience with BI tools (Microstrategy, Tableau, etc.), statistical software tools, or SQL in a business environment.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of data-related tools and industry standards (ETL, business intelligence, report writing, SQL reporting services, Crystal Reports, etc.).
  • Integration tools (DTS, SSIS, Informatica, etc.) preferred.
  • Microsoft Office suite of products.

Certifications & licenses (i.e. Series 6 & 63, CPA, etc.):

  • Data-related certifications a plus.

Position Demands:

  • Must be able to remain in a stationary position 50% of the time.
  • Extended hours required during peak workloads and special projects.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Salary: DOE




Job Summary:




Pacific Southwest Container, LLC is a world-class, ISO 9001 manufacturer of custom packaging. We are a market leader in the design and conversion of corrugated, folding carton, single-face lamination, foam protective packaging and point-of-purchase displays. Our facilities in Modesto and Visalia serve a wide variety of end use customers who value creativity, flexibility, speed to market and best total system cost.




Our company is growing rapidly and is looking for a highly skilled Data Analyst to identify and communicate data-driven insights to maximize efficient operations and other initiatives. You will turn raw data into information, information into insight, and insight into business decisions.




You should be passionate about finding insights in large datasets, synthesizing, and communicating results to drive business results and growth. You will work cross-functionally with Product Management, Engineering, Plant Quality, Sales, and Finance Departments. This position requires successful candidate to be a self-starter, managing and providing consistent and reliable reporting and analysis, in addition to utilizing primary and secondary research methods.




Competitive salary and benefits package, including health, dental, vision and generous 401K match.




NOTE: Sponsorship not provided.




Job Functions & Core Responsibilities:

Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code patterns.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends and patterns in complex data sets.
Acquire data from primary and secondary data sources and maintain databases and data systems.
Provide analytical, statistical, and programming to identify key market trends focused on insights, user growth and content by performing market and competitive analyses.
Work with the management team to prioritize business data and information needs.
Monitor performance and quality controls plans to identify improvements.
Perform other tasks as assigned.

Skills:

Technical expertise regarding data models, databases design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
Strong knowledge of reporting packages (business objects etc.), databases (SQL etc.), programming (SML, JavaScript, or ETL frameworks).
Strong knowledge of statistics and statistical packages for analyzing datasets using visualization tools such as Python, R, Excel, and Tableau.
Extensive knowledge of programming language.
Strong data analytic skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of raw data into reports.
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings.
High attention to detail and accuracy.
Creative and critical thinking skills.
Strong problem-solving, presentation and graphical skills.
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills required.
Excellent organizational and project management skills.
Great interpersonal and communication skills, both oral and written.




Education/Experience & Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Information Technology, or related field required.
Master’s degree in Analytics or Data Science preferred.
3-5 years proven work experience as a data analyst or business data analyst.
Proven experience in data extraction, data cleaning, data loading, statistical data analysis, exploratory data analysis, and predictive modeling.
Experience using SPSS, SAS, Power BI, and Tableau.

Title: Data Entry Analyst
Description:
Data Entry Analyst

Located On-Site in Annawan, IL

6-Month Contract

Our Fortune 100 Agriculture client is looking for a Data Entry Analyst to join their team. They are in the process of migrating data from one system to a new Asset Management tool. In this role, you would be working with other team members to make sure information is accurately transferred.

Day-to-Day Responsibilities:

Transcribing and inputting data from one system to another
Working with team members to complete tasks as assigned
Maintaining a high level of accuracy when transferring data




Minimum Qualifications:

Data Entry
MS Office
Detail oriented
Willing to wear proper PPE




Preferred Qualifications:

SAP Experience

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Innova Solutions has an immediate need for a Data Analyst with experience in the Health Insurance Industry. This is a 3 months contract opportunity and is a Onsite role located in Philadelphia, PA. Our client is a leading Health Insurance company.




Please Review The Job Description Below




Top Skills: Data Analysis Power BI, SQL, Tableau




Key Responsibilities: The Sales Reporting Analyst will be responsible for gathering, analyzing, and publishing standard and ad hoc reports for Senior Leadership.




In this role, the Analyst will work with various areas within organization to accurately report current data and forecast for upcoming year.




The candidate should be self-motivated, flexible, have strong problem-solving and time management skills, and able to work individually as well as in a team environment.




The individual should have strong Microsoft Excel skills and experience with Power BI and SQL. Duties include, but are not limited to:Create and publish reports in Power BI, Excel, PowerPoint, and PDF Gather and synthesize information to provide explanations for variances in data, such as membership changes Collaborate with senior management and prepare accurate membership forecast for multiple lines of business Prepare presentations for senior management Ensure data received from various sources, such as Informatics, Actuarial and Finance is accurate Create/run SQL reports in data warehouse Manage reporting needs based on reporting requests and workload Performs other duties as assigned RequirementsBachelor degree in Business, Accounting, Finance or related field preferred plus a minimum 1-3 years of relevant experience Microsoft Excel and Access experience (intermediate to advanced user) highly preferred Power BI experience highly preferred SQL experience, including writing new queries, and using existing queries, highly preferred Customer Relationship Management (CRM) tool experience preferred, but not required Demonstrated ability to prepare reports, presentations and executive summaries for senior management meetings Proven statistical and analytical experience in corporate environment Strong written and verbal communication skills required, to include the ability to communicate with all levels of management Ability to build relationships across all management levels as well as internal and external constituents Strong work ethic and ability to work independently with little supervision required Strong use of judgment and ability to work in ambiguous situations with little direction Takes initiative to solve issues with minimal guidance Ability to collaborate and influence a process Ability to work under tight deadlines required Skill/Experience/EducationMandatory Excel Desired Preferred but not required: SQL, Tableau, Power BI




If it creates an interest for you, please email me the latest copy of your resume, through this posting.




Thanks And Regards, Gangotri Chakraborty ABOUT Innova Solutions.




Innova Solutions is a global provider of information technology solutions, talent solutions and workforce management services. Our Industry vertical based domain expertise, passion for innovation, combined with the power of technologies in cognitive sciences, cloud computing, data sciences, product engineering, robotic process automation, machine learning, and block chain, helps clients envision, build and run their businesses more efficiently. Headquartered in the US, Innova Solutions has grown to over $1.2 BN. Innova Solutions is a Certified MBE by the Georgia National Minority Supplier Development Council.




Innova solutions has multiple subsidiaries, each focused on the unique area of business: Analysts international Corporation (Staff Augmentation Services) The Ascent Services Group Inc. (Life Sciences Talent Solutions) HireGenics, (Payrolling, IC Compliance, & MSP Services) DATA Inc. (Information Technology- staffing)




Recent Awards and Recognitions: 6th largest IT staffing firm in the US. (Staffing Industry Analysts (SIA) 2019) Largest Minority IT Staffing Firm in the US. (SIA 2019) ClearlyRated® 2020 Best of Staffing award winner for providing remarkable service quality to our clients. This is our ninth consecutive win.




IT and Industry certifications: Microsoft Gold Partner: Application Development, Cloud Platform, Data Analytics, Data Center, DevOps, Data Platform AWS Managed Services Partner Google Cloud Partner ISO 27001:2013 Certified for Data Security ISTQB Gold Partner ISMS (ISO 27001:2017) SOC2 Type II Compliant

Title: Supply Chain Data Analyst
Description:
Stella & Chewy’s is looking for an experienced Supply Chain Data Analyst who will be responsible for the integrity of master data and development of related business processes at Stella and Chewy’s. This position will lead efforts to align business targets with ERP requirements, implement best practices in regards to data management and report on progress toward goals. This position is also responsible for training users and troubleshooting exceptions. Reporting to the Business Process Manager, the ideal individual will have 3+ years of experience managing Master Data and ERP projects in a manufacturing environment, with a record of demonstrated and sustained improvements. This individual must have an eye for continuous improvement opportunities and possess communication skills to develop and execute solutions with large teams from varying parts of the business. Previous experience with MRP implementation preferred.




Description:

Ensure master data integrity in key systems
Own, maintain, consult and execute on master data related topics including new item setup and development of processes
Lead cross-functional teams to gather required information from multiple areas (IT, quality, procurement, finance, supply chain, operations, sales, and/or outside parties), reconcile conflicts and present information in a manner that stakeholders can review to make informed decisions
Prepare and conduct mass and/or manual data updates in ERP
Analyze and articulate business requirements and translate them into functional requirements
Process map existing product creation/ update/ discontinuation flow and use workflow tools to systematically steer the process.
Monitor and correct data processing exceptions and clean-up opportunities
Properly record and maintain requirements and process documentation
Develop standards and guidelines to consistently address recurring strategic enterprise master data issues
Create/ maintain standardized reporting in Power Query/ BI in different areas on supply chain to support growing business need
Serve as Key User to educate users and problem solve exceptions
Actively seek and adopt best practices in data reporting by learning new tools and platforms.
Support ad-hoc internal customer requests and business systems projects

Requirements




3+ years previous job-related experience required, strong knowledge of Enterprise master data and how it applies to business
Bachelor's Degree, OR 4 additional years of related experience beyond the minimum required may be substituted in lieu of a degree
Previous experience with Microsoft Dynamics or other major ERP software
Prior experience in set up and launch of MRP preferred.
Prior experience in process mapping and setting up workflows.
Must possess strong knowledge of relational databases and reporting tools like Excel, Power Query and Power BI
Accurate data entry skills, attention to detail and follow-up abilities
Experience gathering requirements, functional design and documenting business processes
Must be highly disciplined, organized, self-starter with the ability to execute assignments independently in agile environment
Well-developed analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong written and oral communication skills
Responds strongly and positively to challenging work and deadlines







All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status, or any other status protected by law.

Title: Junior Data Analyst (Contract)
Description:
Our client, a global investment bank, provides financial advice and solutions to wealthy, institutional and corporate clients worldwide, as well as private clients in Switzerland.

Your New Role

The main focus of this role is the data management of data sources for Hedge Fund of Funds analysis and data entry in Alternative Investment Solutions proprietary database. Particular focus on working alongside the research team and hedge fund managers to develop and implement exposure and attribution information across invested and non-invested funds. This position will require strong communication skills, good problem solving skills, and the ability to quickly learn the terminology and data consumed by the Hedge Fund of Funds business.

Maintaining the data integrity of hedge fund data feeding the Fund Database.

Maintain open channels of communication between various internal groups.

Maintain and develop relationships with external hedge funds.

Identify and initiate areas of automation and development within existing processes.

Proactively identifying and resolving potential problems and risks before they arise and know when to escalate issues.

Gain knowledge and help support the flow of information between the database and applications used by the Fund of Funds Team and clients.

Quickly learning the terminology and vocabulary of Hedge Funds and products.

Ability to prioritize time and work in a fast paced environment.

Excellent team player, continually reviewing processes and communicating problems and fixes with global counterparts.

Participate in the implementation of new system flows.

What Youll get in Return

You will get the chance to work for a very well-respected global brand as well as start a contract position with a chance of extension.

Interested?

If youre available and interested in this role, please apply directly as soon as you can attaching your updated resume and hourly rate requirement.

Title: Data Analyst - Strategy, Transformation & Capabilities
Description:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.

At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way.

When you join Team Amex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we champion your meaningful career journey with programs, benefits, and flexibility to back you personally and professionally. Every colleague shares in the company’s success.

Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to our customers, communities, and each other every day. And, we’ll do it with integrity and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they truly belong.




Description

The Data Analyst role on the Strategy, Transformation & Capabilities team will be responsible for providing analytical support in the delivery of breakthrough innovation and transformational initiatives for American Express Global Servicing Network. The key focus of this role is on improving the economics and efficiency of operational inbound contact center processes globally, thus delivering improvements in the customer experience and achievement of aggressive expense reduction targets.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

Query and analyze large sets of data to draw conclusions and make recommendations to the business using statistical models and data mining techniques combined with business and operational knowledge.
Conducting various analyses and providing thought leadership to identify new ideas that lead to improved efficiency and customer experience in our Inbound Contact Center.
Support the business with process mapping, identification of process improvements opportunities, feasibility studies, demand management efforts, and defect eliminations for the purposes of generating cost-savings and improving customer satisfaction.
Work closely with Operations leaders and Project Managers to further develop existing ideas, prioritize them, and implement them.
Develop cost-benefit analyses and prepare business presentations to share with leadership and gain buy-in.

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor Degree in Analytics or Process Improvement or Computer Science related is required
Working experience with database includes Microsoft SQL, Teradata
Experience in using advanced data analytics tools to perform analysis and uncover the insights.
Knowledge on big data technology
A creative and innovative professional with strong analytical background
Self-starter and naturally curious about finding transformational and customer experience improvement opportunities
Critical skills include proficiency with analytical and process improvement tools and techniques, strategic thought leadership and execution skills, strong negotiation skills and data mining skills to generate rich insights
Excellent written/verbal communication skills and the ability to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment are required

Preferred Qualification:

Master Degree in Analytics or Process Improvement or Computer Science related fields
Industry Experience as Project/Data Analyst with a track records of pulling , manipulating, processing and developing meaningful insights from large datasets
Coding proficiency in R or Python
Understanding or experience with Data Mining and Machine Learning Algorithms
Query performance tuning skills using SQL
Experience with using Big Data Technology including Hadoop and Hive

Salary Range: $70,000.00 to $135,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits

The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.

Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for this position.

American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.

We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

US Job Seekers/Employees - Click here to view the “Know Your Rights” poster and supplement and the Pay Transparency Policy Statement.

If the links do not work, please copy and paste the following URLs in a new browser window: https://www.dol.gov/agencies/ofccp/posters to access the three posters.

  • Critical skills include proficiency with analytical and process improvement tools and techniques, strategic thought leadership and execution skills, strong negotiation skills and data mining skills to generate rich insights
  • Excellent written/verbal communication skills and the ability to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment are required

Preferred Qualification:

  • Master Degree in Analytics or Process Improvement or Computer Science related fields
  • Industry Experience as Project/Data Analyst with a track records of pulling , manipulating, processing and developing meaningful insights from large datasets
  • Coding proficiency in R or Python
  • Understanding or experience with Data Mining and Machine Learning Algorithms
  • Query performance tuning skills using SQL
  • Experience with using Big Data Technology including Hadoop and Hive

Salary Range: $70,000.00 to $135,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits

The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.

Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for this position.

American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.

We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

If the links do not work, please copy and paste the following URLs in a new browser window: https://www.dol.gov/agencies/ofccp/posters to access the three posters.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
TITLE: Data Analyst




Location:




Compensation Range : $125,000-$135,000




Global law firm looking for an experienced Data Analyst. The Analyst will have responsibility for providing support to data analytics, process improvement, and process automation efforts within the firm's Finance & Accounting functions.




What You'll Do




Support the finance team by leveraging the firm's existing data and financial systems infrastructure to develop our data strategy and business insights capability, including dynamic modeling, utilizing state-of-the-art automation tools
Identify and suggest improvements when problems or opportunities arise.
Assist in designing and developing complex data models and workflows to measure the firm's KPIs
Provide dynamic data design, analytics, and process automation support for cross-functional projects (e.g., Business Development; Partner Affairs, etc.)
Support the automation of periodic financial reports using the latest data management, projection, and analytics tools (e.g., Alteryx, Tableau, Power BI, UiPath, etc.)
Collaborate with a cross-functional team of financial professionals to identify process inefficiencies and design and develop solutions that reduce time to completion, enhance the pace of business insights, and eliminate repetitive and redundant processes
Provide analytics and business process support for global financial operations
Keep up-to-date with developments in the area of process automation.




Skills / Experience You Will Need




Knowledge of Alteryx, Tableau, Power BI, UiPath and other data analytics and process automation platforms
Proficient in SQL a must
Proficient in Python a plus
Excellent analytical skills
Strong communication skills
Solid interpersonal skills
Comfortable managing large sets of data and driving data driven solutions and insights
Excellent organizational and time management abilities
Good judgment and planning skills
Ability to meet deadlines




About Infinity Consulting Solutions




At Infinity Consulting Solutions our mission is to cultivate successful long term relationships with candidates and clients matching the right candidate with the right client. We believe technology cannot replace the real personal relationships we cultivate. We reject the notion that technology alone is the answer to staffing which is why we our successful partnerships rely on collaboration NOT automation. ICS has been providing flexible staffing solutions for over 20 years in Information Technology, Compliance, Accounting / Finance and Corporate Support. Our staffing solutions include Contract, Temp to Perm and Permanent Placement.




ICS is an Equal Opportunity Employer.




W2 employees of ICS are offered comprehensive benefits including health, dental and vision.

Title: Supply Chain Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description:

We are hiring for a Reverse Logistics Specialist to work at NAPA Centralized Purchasing. The Reverse Logistics Specialist plays an important role on our team by ensuring the return of excess inventory from our NAPA Distribution Centers.




We are looking for a team player, with strong communication and analytical skills, who is customer oriented to help us make NAPA the #1 choice in the automotive aftermarket.




Responsibilities:

• Works with company employees (Operations Managers, distribution center, etc.) facilitating factory returns to ensure targeted inventory turnover and excess inventory reduction goals.




• Research and review outstanding factory returns weekly. Partner with Distribution Center Management to understand underlying factory return exception factors and modify accordingly.




• Manages the factory return process for assigned product lines. Produces factory return reviews as scheduled and reviews factory return authorizations or approves returns based on situation.




• Manages the inventory and submits factory return requests to our vendors for our distribution centers. Updates the system with new information and maintains and upholds the NAPA Stock Obsolescence and Protection Policy.




• Works with others in supply chain to identify areas of improvement, develop new processes and procedures, and meets regularly to discuss current status and troubleshoot. Partners with demand planners to discuss trends and forecasts, address inventory issues, and enact process improvements. Builds relationship with customers by instilling confidence in the customers that concern will be addressed properly and with urgency.




• Serves as point-of-contact to answer questions, handle requests, and address concerns. Researches issues and resolves to customer satisfaction in timely manner.




Qualifications

• 1-3 years of purchasing and inventory management experience preferred.




• Aftermarket automotive experience a plus




• Bachelor degree in a business or supply chain field, or equivalent experience




• Excel (vlookups, pivot tables, index matches, formulas and macros)




• Access proficiency desirable Manhattan IO and ERP experience helpful.




• Experience with Oracle and SAP a plus.




• Highly analytical, proactive, ability to resolve conflicts quickly and amicably, able to groom and develop future leaders in the organization.




• Strong written and verbal communication skills




• Demonstrated ability to collaborate, manage conflict, and resolve issues.




• Strong customer focus and orientation.




• Self-motivated, detail-oriented and organized.




• Work is performed in a typical office environment.

Title: Supply Chain Data Analyst
Description:
Title: Supply Chain Planning Data Analyst




***Alteryx experience REQUIRED***




Must Haves:

3+ years of Supply Chain Planning experience with experience using one or more of the following: SAP / OMP+ / JDA (preference for SAP)
Experience managing large data sets using with Tableau
Alteryx experience
Hands-on experience building data visualizations into dashboards in accordance to business requirements




Plusses:

APICS certification
Python
Master’s degree
LEAN and/or Six Sigma Certifications




Day to Day:

Insight Global is recruiting for Senior Supply Chain Planning Data Analyst for their client’s Supply Chain Planning Data group within the Vision PEx organization. This resource will act as the Subject Matter Expert and will ensure OMP Master Data and Plan Specific ERP/ EMS Data is of high quality and consistency utilizing Data Quality Reports and Analytics, collaborating with the planning partners for resolution. They will be working on a team which is split into two - data on one end and analytics on the other. The data focused, newer group to the team consists of members handling querying, logic, data and validation, while the analytics side is more customer facing, creating visualizations for the organization as needed. This position is hiring for someone on the analytics side, who can work hands-on with the business to create visualizations using their understanding of the planning tools used by the organization. They will be responsible to ensure Vision ERPs have harmonized materials and hierarchy to maintain consistency between EMS and OMP. They will be responsible for ensuring Plan data work instructions are sustained as needed for process changes, and ultimately, they will be responsible for stabilizing the team’s current processes, procedures, challenges, risks, etc. They will be responsible for working with the internal business who may have special requests from the planning tools and be required to develop visualizations accordingly. This person will be responsible for keeping up with the external Supply Chain trends and emerging best practices, and they will be expected to influence and shape the journey for the Planning organization moving forward.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Title: Data Analyst




Location: Southfield, MI




Job Type: Full-time with Benefits




Who We Are




For more than 25 years, MSX International has been a dedicated partner to leading automotive brands around the world. We support them in transforming their businesses and in managing their operations across the areas of Customer Experience, Repair Optimization, Learning and Insights.




We focus on helping our clients generate more value for their customers. With over 5,000 employees based in more than 80 countries worldwide, our teams provide industry leading expertise. We have combined our deep industry expertise with cutting-edge technology solutions to help our automotive clients increase revenue and reduce cost, while enhancing operational efficiency and improving customer satisfaction.  Our goal is to help our customers reach their full potential and to excel as their global partner of choice.




Summary:




This position is responsible for designing, developing and maintaining business data and statistical models that allow for insights into customer data. This is a Technical Data Analyst role. Candidate would be expected to help develop analytic reports and dashboards for existing business and new opportunities.




Essential Duties and Responsibilities:




Develop insightful KPI reporting dashboards to drive decision-making and performance tracking
Develop reports and dashboards via data mining analytics and reporting tools
Prepare analytics reports in presentation form
Assist in developing sound data ETL practices and processes
Conduct research and analyze special studies when needed
Create and update documentation of process flows and business rules
Maintain current reports up to date and process large amounts of data as needed




Minimum Qualifications:




Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics or relevant discipline
1-3 years of automotive operations experience, or similar business (quick-paced environment)
Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI, Kibana, etc.)
SQL skills for querying relational databases
Experience with complex data analysis
Performing data manipulation and statistical analysis
Strong analytical skills with ability to understand and communicate the meaning of the data being presented
Excellent Mathematical/Statistical and Logic skills
Excellent Reasoning skills




Preferred Qualifications:




Multi-dimensional reporting, data correlation, data analytics and data mining
Previous external client facing experience
Experience with ETL tools (SSIS, Alteryx, KNIME, etc.)




Other Competencies and Characteristics:




Knowledge Retention - In order to provide the highest quality of work, analysts must be able to learn and memorize a large amount of information.
Detail Oriented – Analysts must be able to focus on the details in order to identify and isolate issues.
Organizational Skills – Analysts must be organized and able to keep track of multiple projects at once.
Flexibility - Analysts must be able to handle multiple tasks at once and follow changes in priority level.
Speed - Must be able to work quickly and efficiently without sacrificing the quality of their work.
Solutions Oriented - Must be able to find workable solutions for any problems they might face.




Language Skills:




Full Professional Proficiency in English is required




Mathematical Skills:




Able to complete advanced statistical analysis is required




Reasoning Ability:




Job requires analyzing information and using logic to address work-related issues and problems




Physical Demands:




While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to:




Call, video, email, message and communicate with dealers and co-workers




The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.




Work Environment:




Office environment
The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.




The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.




MSXi is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, or disability.




If you are interested in this position apply here




https://careers.msxi.com/job-invite/21556

Title: Business System Data Analyst
Description:
S&P Global - Commodity insights




The Role: Business System Data Analyst




The Location: Houston




The Team: In this ever-changing environment, the Cost & Supply Chain team plays a vital role in major projects decision-making. Based across the globe with over 20 years of industry expertise and considered the industry standard for cost trends and forecasts. Covering supply chain and cost in Upstream, Downstream and renewables.




The Impact: We are looking for someone to support data operations for reporting, analytics, applications, and data science. In this role, you will process large amounts of data and translate business requirements into consumable reports. A detail-oriented individual, with strong communication skills and technical understanding, will be successful in this position.




What’s in it for you:

Opportunity to grow in a fast-paced environment, developing expertise in data in supply chain and development
Interaction with MI teams as well as procurement teams in major operators
Part of an international team with high growth potential as well been able to contribute on an individual basis
Be a key contributor to the development of new services and products




Responsibilities:

Design, build, and deliver custom dashboards and reports through MS Excel and/or Power BI
Update and maintain existing dashboards and reports
Collaborate with stakeholders to determine and address data and reporting needs
Facilitate delivery of ad hoc analysis and data requests
Maintain, improve, clean, and manipulate data using extract, transform and load (ETL) processes.




What We’re Looking For:

Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, economics, statistics, or industry-related fields required; graduate degree is a plus.
Minimum of 1-2 years directly related experience traditionally acquired by working in an analytical role, preferably Upstream operations.
Proficiency in MS Excel and Power BI, Experience with coding and scripting using R, Python, or shell scripts
Knowledge of SQL and ETL techniques
Strong listening, verbal, and written communication skills with a mastery of the English language. And ability to prioritize tasks and work independently.




About Company Statement:




S&P Global delivers essential intelligence that powers decision making. We provide the world’s leading organizations with the right data, connected technologies and expertise they need to move ahead. As part of our team, you’ll help solve complex challenges that equip businesses, governments and individuals with the knowledge to adapt to a changing economic landscape.




S&P Global Commodity Insights enables organizations to create long-term, sustainable value with data and insights for a complete view on the global energy and commodities markets.

  • Part of an international team with high growth potential as well been able to contribute on an individual basis
  • Be a key contributor to the development of new services and products


Responsibilities:

  • Design, build, and deliver custom dashboards and reports through MS Excel and/or Power BI
  • Update and maintain existing dashboards and reports
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to determine and address data and reporting needs
  • Facilitate delivery of ad hoc analysis and data requests
  • Maintain, improve, clean, and manipulate data using extract, transform and load (ETL) processes.


What We’re Looking For:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, economics, statistics, or industry-related fields required; graduate degree is a plus.
  • Minimum of 1-2 years directly related experience traditionally acquired by working in an analytical role, preferably Upstream operations.
  • Proficiency in MS Excel and Power BI, Experience with coding and scripting using R, Python, or shell scripts
  • Knowledge of SQL and ETL techniques
  • Strong listening, verbal, and written communication skills with a mastery of the English language. And ability to prioritize tasks and work independently.


About Company Statement:


S&P Global delivers essential intelligence that powers decision making. We provide the world’s leading organizations with the right data, connected technologies and expertise they need to move ahead. As part of our team, you’ll help solve complex challenges that equip businesses, governments and individuals with the knowledge to adapt to a changing economic landscape.


S&P Global Commodity Insights enables organizations to create long-term, sustainable value with data and insights for a complete view on the global energy and commodities markets.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description




Act as key data lead to leverage versatile technical capabilities to drive the development, evolution, and implementation of data products, which enable self-service by data consumers
Explore industry trends, tools, and techniques in Open Source/Big Data/Digital domain Business Intelligence
Execute and monitor data processes that deliver critical data to partners and regulators
Develop prototypes and implement new business intelligence tools, solutions, and techniques
Assist in development of standards and policies for business intelligence frameworks
Evaluate data management, data quality and data access processes for gaps, inefficiencies and opportunities; provide recommendations for improvement
Implement solutions and processes for management and governance across data quality metrics, metadata, lineage, data access rights, and business definitions
Develop data mapping to enable data end users to more easily transition to using new systems




Required Skills




Degree specialized in a Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics discipline
Experience with Python, SQL, Unix/Linux, Databricks and Github
Experience with AWS products, such as EC2, S3, Redshift, and Snowflake
Desire to learn about external companies (typically Fortune 500) that client partners with for co-brand and private label programs
Bachelor’s Degree
At least 3 years of experience in Python and SQL
At least 1 year of experience with Snowflake, Databricks, and AWS products
At least 3 years of experience in querying, analyzing, and working with data languages and platforms




Desired Skills




Master’s Degree in a Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics discipline
1+ years’ experience working BI reporting tools (i.e. Tableau)
1+ years of experience working with and demonstrating knowledge of data governance, data quality management concepts and data quality tools (i.e. Informatica DQ)
1+ years of experience working with Agile development methodologies




Data Analyst,Python, SQL,Snowflake, Databricks,AWS

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Roy J. and Lucille A. Carver College of Medicine Office of Statewide Clinical Education Programs (OSCEP) Iowa Health Professions Tracking Center is seeking a Data Analyst to performs the administrative activities for the maintenance and management of both the Iowa Dentist Tracking System (IDTS) and the Visiting Consultant Clinic (VCC) database.




Percent Time: 100%




Duties To Include




Manages workflow processes of the IDTS and VCC.
Conducts data integrity audits of the IDTS and VCC information.
Produce, verify and distribute routine and statistical reports generated from the IDTS and VCC.
Produce and verify visualizations from data generated from the IDTS and VCC.
Answers routine inquiries from OSCEP staff members and provides information regarding policies and procedures of the IDTS and VCC.
Serves as liaison with faculty and staff of the University of Iowa College of Dentistry, Iowa Dental Board, and the Iowa Dental Association.
Represent the Carver College of Medicine/Iowa Dentist Tracking Systems at Iowa Dental Board meetings.
Composes correspondence in response to routine inquiries.
Responds to data requests from faculty and staff.
Manages data requests from external clients. Creates, distributes and bills for data products. Maintains billing documentation.
Supervises the data collection activities of student employees and support staff.
Manages the programmer scope of work for internal and external data inquiries, data integrity audits, and workflow.
Explores process improvement opportunities.
Maintains documentation of workflow processes.
Manage data/information in support of the Annual Report of Visiting Consultant Clinics.
Liaise with CCOM IT in database platform development, migration and implementation.
Serve as departmental lead on specialized statistical software R or Tableau. Lead in the design of data drivers dash board and reports.
Serve as OSCEP Webmaster.
Serve as OSCEP SharePoint Administrator.
Serve as OSCEP Master Calendar Administrator.
Troubleshoot software and hardware problems related to Microsoft Office, CorelDraw, Adobe Suite, workstations, laptops, printers, portable devices and networking.
Other duties as assigned by the Division Director.
Demonstrates respect for all members of the university community in the course of performing one’s duties and in response to administrators, supervisors, coworkers, and customers.




Education Required




A Bachelor’s degree or an equivalent combination of education and experience is required.




Required Qualifications




One or more years of administrative experience is required.
Experience with survey research and data collection accompanied by excellent analytical and problem-solving skills is required.
Excellent attention to detail is required.
Ability to communicate effectively by phone and /or through correspondence is required.
Experience with Microsoft Word, Excel and databases are required.
Experience creating Power Point presentations is required.
Excellent interpersonal skills are required.
Public contact/customer service experience is required.




Desired Qualifications




Knowledge of Iowa dental providers and organizations is desired.
Knowledge of health care organizations is desired.
Experience in a medical educational setting or in a medical practice setting or physician relations experience is highly desired.
Knowledge of health care education is desired.
Experience working with web editing software, Drupal is desired.
Experience troubleshooting software, hardware and network problems is desired.
Previous experience generating graphical representations of statistical information using graphics software (i.e. Tabeleau, CorelDraw) is desired.
Knowledge of Iowa geography is desirable.




Benefits Highlights: Fringe benefit package including paid vacation; sick leave; health, dental, life and disability insurance options; and generous employer contributions into retirement plans.




Application Process: In order to be considered, applicants must upload a job-specific cover letter and resume that clearly addresses how you meet the required and desirable qualifications of the position. Job openings are posted for a minimum of 14 calendar days. Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the closing date.




Successful candidates will be subject to a criminal background check and credential check. For questions, contact Theresa Dunkin at theresa-dunkin@uiowa.edu.




Additional Information




Classification Title: Data Analyst
Appointment Type: Professional and Scientific
Schedule: Full-time




Compensation




Pay Level: 3B




Contact Information




Organization: Healthcare
Contact Name: Theresa Dunkin
Contact Email: theresa-dunkin@uiowa.edu

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description




Role Overview:




This is a Data Analyst position where you will support the Onboarding Concierge Service, training team and Strategic Ops-related projects. You will provide day to day support for our onboarding portal, analyze data from the workflow, and manage/create dashboards for our training team. You will also keep track of process improvements and ensure tasks are carried out in a timely fashion.




You Will:




Work with the Application Analyst, Training Technology Specialist, Trainer(s) and project lead(s) to create and implement improved workflows and enhancements for the Onboarding Concierge Service.
Assist in project plans defining deliverables and resources required for successful and seamless execution. Manage tasks to achieve established goals and escalate issues/concerns to project lead. Provide timely updates to the project lead(s).
Sustain project workflows and timelines, ensuring deadlines and milestones are met. Responsible for following up on action items identified by project leads.
Act on inquiries or problems on behalf of the project leadership, e.g., investigating the problem, gathering the necessary information, reaching out to the appropriate internal and external contacts, etc. and resolving independently when appropriate. Develop hypotheses, analyze, validate, and present findings to project leadership.
Continuously enhance our training dashboard using Tableau and PowerApps.
Act as secondary support to our lead application analyst to troubleshoot our onboarding bot/workflow.
Write and/or edit various documents, reports and presentations (i.e., meeting and conference materials, minutes, periodic updates, project summaries, and newsletter articles) for assembly and dissemination to the appropriate parties. Develop content for presentations/slides as assigned by project lead.
Bring forth ideas for improved automation to increase efficiency and optimize Strategic Ops-related projects.


You Are:




Capable of building strong customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions
An individual with strong analytical aptitude, capable of understanding data and using data to tell a story.
Adept at planning and prioritizing work to meet commitments aligned with organizational goals.
A good decision-maker, with proven success at making timely decisions that keep the organization moving forward.
Able to work optimally in an environment notable for complex, sometimes contradictory information.
Adept at building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives and goals.
Adept at learning quickly, applying insights from past efforts to new situations.
Comfortable with end-to-end execution; supervise critical metrics, recognize problems, and find solutions in a fast-paced environment.


You have:




Bachelor's Degree in Healthcare or Information Sciences or Information Systems or Healthcare Business Management (or equivalent experience).
3-5 years in QA for information systems, technical writing, or equivalent position
Experience using Tableau and other data analytic software, PowerApps preferred.
Superb communication, writing, and presentation skills.
