Title: Data Analyst I
Description:
Under direct supervision, provides management and analysis of business data. Ensures data accuracy and integrity, and updates data as needed.




Integrates data from multiple data sources or functional areas, ensuring data accuracy and integrity, and updates data as needed. Manage users and user roles. / Business Line Analysts: Defines business metrics and analyzes data from multiple data sources or functional areas, ensuring data accuracy and integrity.




Translate complex analysis into actionable intelligence and recommendations for management.




Process confidential data and information according to guidelines.




Support targeted business activities, including opportunities for product and process improvement with a focus on driving significant business growth.




Document all data and reporting processes.




Provide appropriate communications and status reports to management, team members and business lines.




Trains end users on new reports and dashboards.




Other duties may be assigned.




Education/Licenses/ Certifications




Associates degree in a quantitative field, like Business Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, Marketing Research, or other similar fields; or 3-4 years of additional relevant experience




Bachelor’s degree preferred




Experience




1+ years Experience extracting data from databases using SQL, using PowerBI or other data BI/visualization tools, preferred




The pay range for this position in Rhode Island is $47,000 - $61,000. Base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Annual bonuses are some of the additional forms of compensation offered. Additionally, employees may participate in our award winning medical, dental, vision, wellness, financial (6% 401k match), and a wide array of other employee and membership benefits.




Skills & Abilities




Think, Act & Be Safe.




Encourage, build, and maintain mutual trust, respect, and cooperation with others.




Ability to listen to, understand, and communicate with others by telephone, in written form, electronically, or in person.




Ability to apply sound judgement to produce appropriate outcomes to a variety of situations, including high volume and challenging situations.




Ability to analyze, model and interpret data.




Ability to maintain confidentiality.




Ability to prioritize, organize, and accomplish work to achieve specific goals.




Ability to use logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.




Ability to determine how a system should work and how changes in conditions, operations, and the environment will affect outcomes.




Ability to adjust actions in relation to others' actions.




Ability to monitor/assess performance of yourself, other individuals, or organizations to make improvements or take corrective action.




Ability to identify complex problems and reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions.




Ability to operate a computer/mobile device with relevant software applications.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position Summary:



The Data Analyst will build queries, reports, and dashboards to support reporting and analytical needs.  The Data Analyst works with Data Warehouse Lead to provide necessary information leveraging AutoNation’s AWS Data Lake and Snowflake Cloud Data Warehouse.  The Data Analyst also works to identify issues with operational data as well as investigate data issues with the Snowflake Cloud Data Warehouse. The position will work collaboratively with a team of data engineers and data architects to support the development of data pipelines, data marts and reports.  We are seeking a talented individual with experience working in a matrix IT organization to deliver enterprise class software projects in a fast-paced environment.



Organizational Relationships:



IT Leadership: Director and Sr. Director positions in IT organization
IT Teams: BI, QA, Security, DevOps, DBA, Architecture, Infrastructure, PMO
Product owners
Product stakeholders
Scrum team members: Developers, QA testers, Business Analysts, Data Analysts, Project Manager

Job Responsibilities:



Gathers and analyzes data to support reporting and ad hoc analysis needs
Participates in reporting requirements sessions led by the Business Analyst
Designs and develops new reports, dashboards, and visualizations
Performs data validations to ensure the quality of the data in the Snowflake Cloud Data Warehouse
Supports continuous improvement of data quality and accuracy by conducting deep analysis on available data and provide direction on findings to team members
Conducts ad hoc analysis and triaging to help project creation, exploration, and progression
Contributes to the development of project plans, identifies key deliverables, and raises project issues

Qualifications:



BA/BS degree in Information Technology or equivalent combination of education and experience
2-4 years of experience developing in SQL
Familiar with of Data Warehouse architecture and design and ETL processes
Good analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication and documentation skills
Experience with relational databases such as SQL Server or Oracle
Experience with cloud-based (AWS and Azure) database systems and environments a plus
Must meet company’s requirements for employment
Valid in-state driver’s license and have and maintain an acceptable, safe driving record

 Physical Requirements



Work with computers and other common office equipment
Work location is in a corporate office environment with no special physical requirements beyond what is normally expected in a typical modern corporate office

 



AutoNation, a provider of personalized transportation services, is driven by innovation and transformation. As one of America's most admired companies, AutoNation delivers a peerless Customer experience recognized by data-driven consumer insight leaders, Reputation and J.D. Power. Through its bold leadership and brand affinity, the AutoNation Brand is synonymous with "DRVPNK" and "What Drives You, Drives Us." AutoNation has a singular focus on personalized transportation services that are easy, transparent, and Customer-centric.



 



Benefits



Click here to learn more about our Benefits.




Join us as we pave the way to moving our company, our communities and our industry forward. Apply today at a location near you or wherever you dream the road will take you.



 



AutoNation is an equal opportunity employer and a drug-free workplace.

  • Supports continuous improvement of data quality and accuracy by conducting deep analysis on available data and provide direction on findings to team members
  • Conducts ad hoc analysis and triaging to help project creation, exploration, and progression
  • Contributes to the development of project plans, identifies key deliverables, and raises project issues

Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree in Information Technology or equivalent combination of education and experience
  • 2-4 years of experience developing in SQL
  • Familiar with of Data Warehouse architecture and design and ETL processes
  • Good analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent communication and documentation skills
  • Experience with relational databases such as SQL Server or Oracle
  • Experience with cloud-based (AWS and Azure) database systems and environments a plus
  • Must meet company’s requirements for employment
  • Valid in-state driver’s license and have and maintain an acceptable, safe driving record

 Physical Requirements

  • Work with computers and other common office equipment
  • Work location is in a corporate office environment with no special physical requirements beyond what is normally expected in a typical modern corporate office

 

AutoNation, a provider of personalized transportation services, is driven by innovation and transformation. As one of America's most admired companies, AutoNation delivers a peerless Customer experience recognized by data-driven consumer insight leaders, Reputation and J.D. Power. Through its bold leadership and brand affinity, the AutoNation Brand is synonymous with "DRVPNK" and "What Drives You, Drives Us." AutoNation has a singular focus on personalized transportation services that are easy, transparent, and Customer-centric.

 

Benefits

Click here to learn more about our Benefits.


Join us as we pave the way to moving our company, our communities and our industry forward. Apply today at a location near you or wherever you dream the road will take you.

 

AutoNation is an equal opportunity employer and a drug-free workplace.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Must Haves :

3+ years supporting an enterprise organization as a Data Analyst
Experience working with digital marketing or e-commerce consumer data
Strong experience with Adobe Analytics
Hands on experience with SQL
Understanding of backend offline data
Experience working in a Scrum or Agile environment
Good communication and hands on with PowerPoint to present to stakeholders

Plusses :

Background with Smartsheets or Google sheets
Background in the telecommunications industry

Day-to-Day :

Insight Global is seeking a Data Analyst to support one of their telecommunications clients. Candidates will be sitting within the Reporting and Insights Consumer group, aligned to the Consumer Data and Analytics level of business. On a day to day basis candidates will be helping to manage, gather, and analyze consumer facing data, support data reporting processes, and work cross functionally to organize data reports that ensure timely project completion. Candidates will be involved in analytics insight management with Adobe Analytics, as well as work with SQL to look at backend offline data and connect it to the proper sources within Adobe. He or she should be able to contribute to requirement sessions with stakeholders, synthesizing data findings and helping to make recommendations for future project alignments. This role will require partnership with the Portfolio and Project management consumer stakeholders as well as potential reporting and presenting to executives on data findings.

Title: Data Analytics - Summer 2023
Description:
Job Number: 53566




Group: Magna Corporate




Division: Magna Services of America (Troy Office)




Job Type: Student




Location: TROY




Group Description




At Magna, we create technology that disrupts the industry and solves big problems for consumers, our customers, and the world around us. We’re the only mobility technology company and supplier with complete expertise across the entire vehicle.




We are committed to quality and continuous improvement because our products impact millions of people every day. But we’re more than what we make. We are a group of entrepreneurial-minded people whose collective expertise gives us a competitive advantage. World Class Manufacturing is a journey and it’s our talented people who lead us on this journey.




Role Summary




In this position, person will have an opportunity to learn basics of business analytics. There will also be an opportunity to learn and execute SAP transactions and also understand relationship with database tables. Prior knowledge of database modelling and OLAP is going to be an added advantage to be successful in this position. Similarly, any exposure to SAP will be helpful but not necessary.




Key Responsibilities




Extract data from various functional areas of the sources systems (SAP ERP) into SAP HANA database on cloud
Create data models (Calculation Views) using best design methodologies in SAP HANA database as per the new projects and demand requests
Develop predictive analytical models in SAP HANA database
Develop visualizations and dashboard using PowerBI and DAX and provide new insights and KPI’s
Apply roles and security in PowerBI as per the data protection policies
Effectively communicate with business users to understand business needs and translate into BI solutions
Learn and utilize SAP transactions in sales and distribution module
Demonstrate created reports to team members and potential users
Perform other duties as required




Key Qualifications/Requirements




Some related experience preferred
An academic background that includes a quantitative focus, such as data science and business analytics
Knowledge of any or all of the following will be an advantage –
databases, database modeling and OLAP
Knowledge of ETL (Extract, Transform and Load) process
Knowledge in creating visualizations, dashboards, reports and queries
Knowledge of data science and predictive analytics
Knowledge of cloud architecture
Strong problem solving and analytical skills
Working knowledge of PowerBI, DAX, SQL and Excel
Knowledge of SAP
High School Diploma
Currently Attending a College or University with declared major related to Computer Science or Information Technology with concentration in Data Analytics
Proficient Computer knowledge and skills, Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Professional Communication skills (written and verbal)




Additional Information




Normal amount of sitting or standing, average mobility to move around an office environment, able to conduct normal amount of work at a computer.




Awareness. Unity. Empowerment.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role Overview: This is a Application Analyst/Data Analyst position where you will support the Onboarding Concierge Service, training team and Strategic Ops-related projects for DigITs. You will provide day to day support for our onboarding portal, analyze data from the workflow, and manage/create dashboards for our training team. You will also keep track of process improvements and ensure tasks are carried out in a timely fashion.




You Will: Work with the Application Analyst, Training Technology Specialist, Trainer(s) and project lead(s) to create and implement improved workflows and enhancements for the Onboarding Concierge Service. Assist in project plans defining deliverables and resources required for successful and seamless execution. Manage tasks to achieve established goals and escalate issues/concerns to project lead. Provide timely updates to the project lead(s). Sustain project workflows and timelines, ensuring deadlines and milestones are met. Responsible for following up on action items identified by project leads. Act on inquiries or problems on behalf of the project leadership, e.g., investigating the problem, gathering the necessary information, reaching out to the appropriate internal and external contacts, etc. and resolving independently when appropriate. Develop hypotheses, analyze, validate, and present findings to project leadership. Continuously enhance our training dashboard using Tableau and PowerApps. Act as secondary support to our lead application analyst to troubleshoot our onboarding bot/workflow. Write and/or edit various documents, reports and presentations (i.e., meeting and conference materials, minutes, periodic updates, project summaries, and newsletter articles) for assembly and dissemination to the appropriate parties. Develop content for presentations/slides as assigned by project lead. Bring forth ideas for improved automation to increase efficiency and optimize Strategic Opsrelated projects.




You Are: An effective communicator, capable of engaging with different audiences, and executing communications based on that understanding. Capable of building strong customer relationships and delivering customer -centric solutions An individual with strong analytical aptitude, capable of understanding data and using data to tell a story. Adept at planning and prioritizing work to meet commitments aligned with organizational goals . A good decision-maker, with proven success at making timely decisions that keep the organization moving forward. Able to work optimally in an environment notable for complex, sometimes contradictory information. Adept at building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives and goals. Adept at learning quickly, applying insights from past efforts to new situations. Comfortable with end-to-end execution; supervise critical metrics, recognize problems, and find solutions in a fast-paced environment. You have: Bachelor's Degree in Healthcare or Information Sciences or Information Systems or Healthcare Business Management (or equivalent experience). 3-5 years in QA for information systems, technical writing, or equivalent position IT background preferred. Experience using Tableau and other data analytic software, PowerApps preferred. Superb communication, writing, and presentation skills.

Title: Equity Data Analyst
Description:
About Bridgewater

Bridgewater Associates is a premier asset management firm, focused on delivering unique insight and partnership for the most sophisticated global institutional investors. Our investment process is driven by a tireless pursuit to understand how the world's markets and economies work — using cutting edge technology to validate and execute on timeless and universal investment principles. Founded in 1975, we are a community of independent thinkers who share a commitment for excellence. By fostering a culture of openness, transparency, and inclusion, we strive to unlock the most complex questions in investment strategy, management, and corporate culture.

Explore more information about Bridgewater on our website here.

Our Culture

Bridgewater's unique success is the direct result of our unique way of being. We want an idea meritocracy in which meaningful work and meaningful relationships are pursued through radical truth and radical transparency. We require people to be extremely open, air disagreements, test each other's logic, and view discovering mistakes and weaknesses as a good thing that leads to improvement and innovation. It is by continually striving together for the highest levels of truth and excellence that we create meaningful work and meaningful relationships. Within this culture, Diversity and Inclusion is a top priority because it is essential to finding the best talent in the world, enabling our idea meritocracy, and creating an environment where all types of people can thrive. We have a full-time team as well as affinity networks that work on these issues - If you would like to learn more, please let your Bridgewater recruiter know.

Explore more information about Bridgewater's culture on our website here.

About The Research Department

Our mission is to understand how the world works — building and compounding our understanding of the timeless cause-and-effect relationships that move global economies and markets. With curiosity, cutting-edge technology, and deep sets of data, we build frameworks and analytical models that explain everything from long-term debt cycles to currency devaluations; and we use that compounded understanding to create the investment strategies that drive Bridgewater.

About The Team

The Data Specialist role is part of the Investment Engineering team. Their mission is to build the core pieces of modeled data which underlie Bridgewater's investment understanding and trading strategies.

About Your Role

As a Data Specialist, your job is to ensure Bridgewater uses the best data possible for our investment goals and our researchers, engineers, and operators deeply understand the data under your purview. This requires, within your area of expertise, a thorough understanding of the investment concepts and their real-world measurements as well as being the person responsible for data availability in the outside world. You will spend your time developing a point-of-view on the external world's data landscape and showing researchers how new content could fit into Bridgewater's understanding of the world. You will work with our investment engineers, who are tasked with turning the outside world of data into datasets usable by the algorithms used to generate Bridgewater's views on markets, to ensure the data is well represented in our investment process. You will work with our investment operations team, which is responsible for the daily validation of our investment models, to answer questions related to the models where you are the expert, including how to validate such data.

Interested in learning more about working at Bridgewater? Hear about the experiences of our employees here.

You will drive the following responsibilities:

Be the expert for data in your area (e.g. corporate financial statements, security market data, analyst estimates, etc.), including both mechanics (i.e. what is captured in the vendor representations of different statement line items) as well as color (i.e. best data providers; up-to-date on market action; in the flow of what is happening in the sector, etc.), and cost
Comfortable investigating data to understand it, doing basic analysis, and synthesizing the impact of various choices on our investment processes and research
Working closely with our data procurement team to bring on the best data available for our internal investment needs
Answer questions from investors about data quality, provenance, release timing, methodology, etc.
Partnering with our technology teams to ensure the best possible data is delivered excellently for internal consumption to meet our investment needs
Note: While the core function of this job does not require building data pipelines you may, from time to time, need to build some for exploratory needs


You will be a click for the role if you:

Enjoying digging into data and understanding what is behind the numbers
Are already or have a strong desire to become an expert in an area of the market
Are analytical and structured in your thinking, and can communicate this well with others of varying degrees of content expertise
Can perceive problems and resolve them by identifying and weighting tradeoffs
Can make practical tradeoffs while ensuring excellent work is done
Enjoy learning about new data tools and programming languages


Minimum Qualifications

Direct experience and demonstrated expertise within a major asset class and with the relevant data providers / data sets (i.e. Bloomberg, Refinitiv, ESG, etc.)
4-year degree from an accredited undergraduate institution with a focus on finance, economics, operations research, or STEM
For common data providers (Bloomberg, Refinitiv, etc.) very familiar with data models, cost models, and access methods (i.e. APIs)
Experience with a broad range of data schemas (e.g., ontologies, taxonomies, etc.)
Proficiency in data modeling for relational and dimensional data platforms
Strong SQL skills
2-3 Years at investment management firm or data provider


Physical Requirements

This role requires individuals to work at our offices in Westport, CT at a minimum of two days (and some cases three) per week with the option to work offsite on other days.

Why Choose Bridgewater?

It takes all types to make Bridgewater great. We seek a diverse group of innovative thinkers and push them to engage in rigorous and thoughtful inquiry. We develop people through an honest examination of their abilities and performance, enabling personal growth and professional development. We strive to provide you opportunities that will challenge you and unlock your potential.

In this role, you will grow with us by:

Undergoing a training program of structured classes and on-the-job apprenticeship.
Taking ownership of increasingly complex systems and processes.
Taking on oversight and mentorship responsibilities to grow talent as you gain experience.
Opportunities to grow your career across Bridgewater depending on your strengths, weaknesses, and experience.


Compensation Band:

The wage range for this role is 200,000 - 250,000 inclusive of base salary and discretionary target bonus. The expected base salary for this role is between 60% - 75% of this wage range.

One of our core priorities at Bridgewater is to enable our employees to build a great life and career, and we believe our benefits are an important extension of that philosophy. As such, currently Bridgewater offers a competitive suite of benefits including:

Health insurance with 100% premium covered and access to additional concierge medical services
401(k) plan with generous employer match
Paid time off, including fully paid parental leave and a competitive PTO package
Workplace flexibility and access to back up childcare
Financial assistance for family building support, including adoption and egg freezing
Workplace wellness, including on-site gyms, free meals and healthy snacks , and meditation rooms
An engaged and active community that includes many company events, affinity networks, and extracurricular interest groups
For a full list of Bridgewater benefits, click here.
For a full list of Bridgewater benefits, click here.


Bridgewater reserves the right to change its current benefits program at any time, in a manner that is consistent with applicable federal and state regulations

This job description is not a contract and confers no contractual rights, privileges, or benefits on any applicant or potential applicant. Bridgewater has the right to change any and all terms of this job description, including, but not limited to, job responsibilities, qualifications and benefits. Nothing in this job description constitutes an offer or guarantee of employment. Please note that we do not provide immigration sponsorship for this position.

Title: Data Analyst I
Description:
Description




IAM Analyst I




Identity and Access Management (IAM) Operations personnel perform operational level support activities on IAM technologies for Boston University. This position will be responsible for using IAM tools and technologies to troubleshoot products, processes, and policies used to control user identities and regulate user access within the University; and work with project teams to ensure that solutions are compliant with university policies and standards. In this role, you will collaborate cross-functionally with the business to improve Identity and Access Management (IAM) processes and support the presence of the IAM programs within the University. Individuals may be assigned as the enterprise-wide administrator, operator, operational manager and/or owner of a specific technology, function or service. May be asked to participate in IS&T leadership committees. Position must provide availability outside of normal hours to make changes during approved enterprise change windows.




Looking for 1-2yrs experience.




Can be partially remote - 2 days on-site Does the position allow for the worker to be virtual/remote? Partially - See Job Description Hours per Day 8 Hours per Week 40 Total Hours 1,040.00
Show more Show less
HTML:
Description


IAM Analyst I


Identity and Access Management (IAM) Operations personnel perform operational level support activities on IAM technologies for Boston University. This position will be responsible for using IAM tools and technologies to troubleshoot products, processes, and policies used to control user identities and regulate user access within the University; and work with project teams to ensure that solutions are compliant with university policies and standards. In this role, you will collaborate cross-functionally with the business to improve Identity and Access Management (IAM) processes and support the presence of the IAM programs within the University. Individuals may be assigned as the enterprise-wide administrator, operator, operational manager and/or owner of a specific technology, function or service. May be asked to participate in IS&T leadership committees. Position must provide availability outside of normal hours to make changes during approved enterprise change windows.


Looking for 1-2yrs experience.


Can be partially remote - 2 days on-site Does the position allow for the worker to be virtual/remote? Partially - See Job Description Hours per Day 8 Hours per Week 40 Total Hours 1,040.00

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

12 months contract to hire

100% Remote

Key Skills: SQL, PowerBI, Reporting, Data visualization, Healthcare exp (HIPAA, medicare, medicaid)

This Data Analyst role will be responsible for end-to-end delivery of assigned product line portfolio, which includes, but not limited to, explore data to form requirements, lead requirements meeting with stakeholders, breaking down requirements, creating user stories and partnering with Data Engineers to deliver data products in bi-weekly sprints.

The Data Analyst candidate is expected to be highly organized, a motivated self-starter, passionate about healthcare, skilled in distilling volumes of information, enjoys working in a fast-paced environment, thrives on ambiguity, and is an avid learner seeking to develop more knowledge about healthcare trends and how to disseminate insights to executive audiences. CCS Data Analysts are proactive and can't help but think five steps ahead. If you don't have the answer, you take the initiative to figure it out.

Builds actionable data visualizations that identify areas of opportunity and help drive Excellence at scale. Our Primary BI platform is Microsoft Power BI
Contributes to the development of custom metrics and reports to support the CCS Operations reporting needs
Writes advanced SQL to extract and model data from multiple databases (Teradata, GCP, SQL, etc.)
Contributes to project deliverables independently with oversight by Manager as needed; spans collaboration with stakeholders to the full product development cycle (data capture to BI integration)
Informs development of data models in the EDW based on data visualization requirements
Maximizes productivity and accountability through effective time management, coordination, and communication
Performs other related duties as assigned to support the Analytics CoE Team
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work with several stakeholders across multiple organizations
Be curious, creative, opinionated thinker with a talent for detecting patterns and elevating through strategy
Ability to facilitate conversations with Business Owners and Stakeholders to understand the problem, rapidly iterate proposed solutions, and clearly present new findings/ solutions.
Embrace and drive a culture of data-driven, continuous improvement and help identify, analyze, and implement improvement opportunities
Follows all Medicare, Medicaid, HIPAA, and Private Insurance regulations and requirements
Results-oriented individual with a demonstrated commitment to do what it takes to get the job done

Title: Data Operations Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Dreamscape is seeking an entry-level Data Operations Analyst to support our business as we continue to grow our US and global operations. The position is focused on data management, third party research, data categorization, data harmonization and data quality assurance.

Starting from the ground up, you will play an important role from the very first day in assuring the Dreamscape data machine is well oiled and properly maintained.




Key Responsibilities

Work as part of cross-functional team structure to manage and deliver monthly published products and global standalone markets
Ability to independently own product release tasks; from file delivery, data harmonization, quality assurance and communication of release schedule and/or potential data issues
Leverage your analytical skills and outstanding attention to detail to create and maintain media and product category trees
Research, input, edit, and organize media vendor information such as advertiser information, media ownership hierarchies, media types, ad formats, etc. based on aggregated agency media buying data
Review and audit market data to find areas of improvement and/or fix potential errors
Contributor to data management roadmap enhancements to improve workflow efficiencies and data quality accuracy
Work closely with SAFe Agile cross-functional teams to resolve data issues, deliver on OKR driven projects, and sync regularly in agile ceremonies




Required Skills & Experience

BA/BS required
Full fluency in English, as well as proficiency in include Chinese, Spanish, Russian, or French
1- 3 years of professional work experience
Solid research and analytical skills: comfortable assimilating, analyzing, dissecting, and categorizing large volumes of alpha-numeric data
Strong organization and attention to detail, and the ability to work independently, managing your own workload
Comfortable working with Microsoft Office and in particular Excel. Intermediate techniques are a plus: Advanced Sorting, VLookup, Match, Text to Columns, etc.
A desire to learn and build your professional skills




Preferred Qualifications

Understanding of the Media and Advertising Industry
Experience working with and categorizing large data sets preferred
We value any previous data analysis experience with enterprise analytics software such as Tableau, PowerBI, Looker, Sisense, Qlik, MicroStrategy, etc.
Experience working in an Agile development organization; SAFe preferred




About Dreamscape

Dreamscape is a technology company whose goal is to build and transform the advertising technology business through the acquisition of incredible data-driven assets to innovate, grow existing capabilities, and use machine learning to offer accurate automated solutions to age-old industry processes.

https://www.pcdreamscape.com/




Equal Opportunity Employer:

Dreamscape is an equal opportunity employer, committed to our diversity and inclusiveness. We will consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, nationality, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, disability or age. We strongly encourage women, people of color, members of the LGBTQIA community, people with disabilities and veterans to apply.

Title: DATA ANALYST
Description:
Managing all of Resorts Digital Gaming data and access point for performance analysis
Ensuring data accuracy across all business teams
Owning relationships with external data source vendors
Liaising with all internal teams and management to produce and analyze our data to turn it into actionable insights
Assisting and providing feedback to platform provider and local IT team with regard to data structures, systems, controls, and storage
Evaluating incoming data vs business requirements (i.e., how the data is structured vs the reporting requirements)
Assisting acquisition and CRM marketing teams in analyzing campaigns
Working with external agencies to provide timely and insightful data
Reviewing new promotions in upcoming promotional calendar with marketing managers to ensure first rate performance and value for money
Ensuring health of existing loyalty program and recommend changes as necessary to reinvest effectively in an evolving customer base
Evaluating technical data requirements for new and existing data feeds
Liaising with 3rd party vendors to maintain data feeds
Reviewing imported and sorted data against the original to ensure that information integrity has been maintained
Using the structured data to build and publish reports (SQL to HTML consumption) for the Business to evaluate. These reports will include Day to Day KPI’s, Promotional Spend, Loyalty Spend, Player Life cycles – Player Churn and retention rate
Automating informational data to the business and 3rd Parties
Working with other third parties to provide player information based on requirements while maintaining security
Resorts is an equal opportunity employer
3 years of data analysis in the gaming sphere. Online experience preferable but not essential
Experience in any SQL-based reporting system preferable
Strong Excel skills
Demonstrable experience in working closely and successfully with external suppliers and providers
Good relationship building skills
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
Strong organizational skills and a high degree of initiative
Highly analytical
Ability to adjust priorities and manage time appropriately and wisely in a fast-paced environment
All applicants must be able to perform the essential functions of this position, with or without reasonable accommodations.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Top-Tier Investment Bank in Midtown, Manhattan is seeking a Senior Data Analyst for a permanent position!




Responsibilities:




Responsible for assisting in reviewing processes and technologies to improve data accuracy, timeliness, and efficiency.
Regularly interact with users of financial data to identify, access, and query series of interest in internal databases, including a third party tick database. These groups include but are not limited to Trading, Global Research, Middle Office, Risk, and Compliance.
For new projects or data-related production changes, the Senior Data Analyst will determine detailed specifications and resource requirements and coordinate prioritization and approval with other groups. Will test content for proper QA and review/approve for production release
When new data services are needed, the Senior Data Analyst will evaluate potential data sources and cost/resources.




Qualifications:




Bachelor's Degree
Knowledge of SQL required; experience with Unix and/or Python a plus
Experience working with Bloomberg, Reuters, DataStream, and/or FactSet terminals and Excel add-ins
Experience with One Tick a plus
Requires strong communication skills, proven ability to plan and execute projects, communicating goals and progress as well as any problems
Strong problem-solving and organizational skills are a must, along with meticulous attention to detail and a goal-oriented work approach in a fast-paced work environment
Show more Show less
HTML:
Top-Tier Investment Bank in Midtown, Manhattan is seeking a Senior Data Analyst for a permanent position!


Responsibilities:


  • Responsible for assisting in reviewing processes and technologies to improve data accuracy, timeliness, and efficiency.
  • Regularly interact with users of financial data to identify, access, and query series of interest in internal databases, including a third party tick database. These groups include but are not limited to Trading, Global Research, Middle Office, Risk, and Compliance.
  • For new projects or data-related production changes, the Senior Data Analyst will determine detailed specifications and resource requirements and coordinate prioritization and approval with other groups. Will test content for proper QA and review/approve for production release
  • When new data services are needed, the Senior Data Analyst will evaluate potential data sources and cost/resources.


Qualifications:


  • Bachelor's Degree
  • Knowledge of SQL required; experience with Unix and/or Python a plus
  • Experience working with Bloomberg, Reuters, DataStream, and/or FactSet terminals and Excel add-ins
  • Experience with One Tick a plus
  • Requires strong communication skills, proven ability to plan and execute projects, communicating goals and progress as well as any problems
  • Strong problem-solving and organizational skills are a must, along with meticulous attention to detail and a goal-oriented work approach in a fast-paced work environment

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We’re looking for people who put their innovation to work to advance our success – and their own. Join an organization that ensures a more secure world through connecting and protecting our customers with inventive electrical solutions.




What You Will Experience In This Position




Partner with the customer care team on implementing lean manufacturing and lean business process efforts. Work with colleagues to help identify, realize and optimize lean solutions within the economic capability of the plant.
Support process for backorder & spike order management, and reduce customer complaints related to order management.
Lead scheduled ship optimization activities.
Develop projects and actions to improve issues relative to customer orders.
Support the promotion of lean culture in the organization by working with business areas to complete events and projects required to implement the Future State Plans.
Support business unit using appropriate tools, methodologies, and timing of improvement activities to achieve business objectives.
Learn and apply lean principles and tools such as those listed for implementing creative solutions for system and process improvements: Value Stream Mapping, Standard work, RCCM, Visual Management - MDI, and 5-S.
Use Lean principles to perform process reviews and aid in establishing standardized work procedures.
Work collaboratively with teammates and support areas in a team environment.
Work effectively in an environment of change and uncertainty.
Coordinate the planning, scheduling and facilitation of future Lean events and improvement projects.
Support open communications and involvement of employees who work in the process.
Perform additional duties as assigned.




You Have




BS or BA degree required.
Past participation in Kaizen events and MDI continuous improvement program
1+ years experience in supply chain or customer service analytics preferred
Basic computer knowledge and willingness to work with different departments within the corporation as part of fulfilling customer service excellence, including - but not limited to - technical support, engineering, sales, product management, and shipping & receiving
Experience with Infor M3 ERP software (preferred)
Excellent interpersonal skills




We Have
A dynamic global reach with diverse operations around the world that that will stretch your abilities, provide plentiful career opportunities, and allow you to make an impact every day
We are a $2.5 billion, high-performance electrical company with a dedicated team of 9,500+ people and trusted brands such as CADDY, ERICO, HOFFMAN, RAYCHEM, SCHROFF and TRACER. Known for innovation, quality and reliability, our products connect and protect, consistently delivering value to industrial, commercial, residential, energy and infrastructure customers.
Commitment to strengthen communities where our employees live and work
We encourage and support the philanthropic activities of our employees worldwide
Through our nVent in Action matching program, we provide funds to nonprofit and educational organizations where our employees volunteer or donate money
Core values that shape our culture and drive us to deliver the best for our employees and our customers. We’re known for being:
Innovative & adaptable
Dedicated to absolute integrity
Focused on the customer first
Respectful and team oriented
Optimistic and energizing
Accountable for performance
Benefits to support the lives of our employees

At nVent, we connect and protect our customers with inventive electrical solutions. People are our most valuable asset. Inclusion and diversity means that we celebrate and encourage each other’s authenticity because we understand that uniqueness sparks growth.

Title: FOIA Junior Data Analyst
Description:
FOIA Junior Data Analyst

Essential Job Functions

The FOIA Junior Data Analyst scope entails supporting our clients with onsite records analysis and administrative support for its Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) operations. Our client receives a large number of FOIA/Privacy act requests annually. We need administrative support to facilitate the reduction of the FOIA and Privacy Act (PA) requests and referrals backlog and processing of current incoming requests. This consists of receipt, entry, distribution, and tracking of incoming FOIA/PA requests; generation of reports; correspondence; cataloging (electronic/paper); retrieving and distribution of incoming/outgoing mail; performing record searches of fingerprint cards and reviewing documents and identifying redactions. In addition, this also includes scanning of documents to the shared drive/SharePoint, entry of responses in the FOIA electronic systems, and filing/archiving records as directed.

Skills

Experience performing initial document reviews
Experience performing reconciliations between the records of the systems as needed
Perform record searches in IDENT using fingerprint cards submitted with FOIA request.
Continuously maintain organized records and reports of work flow in compliance with Department standards.
Scanning FOIA/Privacy Act requests into FOIAXpress or the Shared drive/SharePoint for processing by the FOIA analysts
Experience with data entry and assisting in correspondence preparation services in support of OBIM responses to FOIA and Privacy Act requests/referrals, which result in closure.
Experience organizing, preparing, and taking final action of electronic and physical FOIA Intake receipts.
Experience provide document retrieval, management, cataloging and archiving support associated with FOIA/Privacy Act requests and referrals records
Qualifications:

High School Diploma
Administrative skills that support FOIA Operations
Ability to receive an EOD (Entry on Duty) decision and pass Security Background Investigation in its entirety
Must be U.S. Citizen

IFAS is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status, or any other protected class.

Integrated Finance and Accounting Solutions (IFAS) is a service-disabled veteran, woman owned small disadvantaged business firm that applies integrated finance and accounting solutions to every engagement to help clients build sustain, and maintain a profitable business model. We do this with a corporate commitment to provide on time service that is mission focused and results driven. It is our true belief that finding the right solutions to your business' mission makes doing business less challenging. IFAS' core capabilities include business & Finance operations, IT Support Services, Acquisition and logistics support.

We are an equal opportunity employer.

  • Continuously maintain organized records and reports of work flow in compliance with Department standards.

  • Experience with data entry and assisting in correspondence preparation services in support of OBIM responses to FOIA and Privacy Act requests/referrals, which result in closure.
  • Experience organizing, preparing, and taking final action of electronic and physical FOIA Intake receipts.
  • Experience provide document retrieval, management, cataloging and archiving support associated with FOIA/Privacy Act requests and referrals records
Qualifications:
  • High School Diploma
  • Administrative skills that support FOIA Operations
  • Ability to receive an EOD (Entry on Duty) decision and pass Security Background Investigation in its entirety
  • Must be U.S. Citizen
IFAS is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status, or any other protected class.

Integrated Finance and Accounting Solutions (IFAS) is a service-disabled veteran, woman owned small disadvantaged business firm that applies integrated finance and accounting solutions to every engagement to help clients build sustain, and maintain a profitable business model. We do this with a corporate commitment to provide on time service that is mission focused and results driven. It is our true belief that finding the right solutions to your business' mission makes doing business less challenging. IFAS' core capabilities include business & Finance operations, IT Support Services, Acquisition and logistics support.

We are an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Data Analyst (Looker)
Description:
What you can expect as a Data Analyst at Fortress:

The Data Analyst (Looker) will be responsible for developing and maintaining Looker reports. The ideal candidate will understand BI analytics, reporting, and cloud data warehousing. The individual will be required to analyze, design, and implement looker reports to align with our business needs.

Responsibilities Include

Create and maintain Looker reports
Work with product and engineering teams to define dashboards and reports
Work independently or as a member of a team environment
Anticipate, recognize, report, and help resolve issues


Minimum Qualifications

Active Secret clearance
Expertise in Looker and LookML to build data visualization and execute data exploration
Expertise in building data models and complex SQL queries
Experience with PostgreSQL and MongoDB
Must have ability to explain technical concepts and make decisions with non-technical team members.
Clean and intuitive coding practices
Ability to lead your own projects and operate with a high degree of autonomy in a remote working environment
Persist through difficult problems and independently discover solutions
Know when it is most efficient to ask for help and be willing to do so
Self-motivated, resourcefulness and problem-solving aptitude
Excellent written and verbal communication skills


Additional Qualifications

Experience with Jira
BS/BA in Information Technology, Computer Science, Data Analytics or equivalent degree from an accredited University
Excellent time management skills and proven ability to multi-task competing priorities


Employee Benefits

Remote and Hybrid working environment
Competitive pay structure
Medical, dental, vision plans with employees covered up to 90% with highly progressive options for dependents and families
Company paid life, short- and long-term disability insurance
Employee Assistance Program
401(k) match
Paid time off and holiday pay
Access to thousands of Learning & Development courses that range from mental health and wellbeing, stress, and time management to an array of technical and business-related courses


Employment Perks

We provide each employee with professional growth opportunities through succession planning, up-skilling, and certifications
Tuition and certification reimbursement
Employee Referral Programs
Company Sponsored Events


Fortress is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All employees and applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, disability, gender, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law. Fortress Information Security takes part in the E-Verify process for all new hires.

For positions located in the US, the following conditions apply. If you are made a conditional offer of employment, you will have to undergo a drug test. ADA Disclaimer: In developing this job description care was taken to include all competencies needed to successfully perform in this position. However, for Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) purposes, the essential functions of the job may or may not have been described for purposes of ADA reasonable accommodation. All reasonable accommodation requests will be reviewed and evaluated on a case-by-case basis.

Title: Jr. Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Jr. Data Analyst




Location: Reston, VA




Employment Type: (Full-time or contract)




Duration: 12+ Months




About VLink: Started in 2006 and headquartered in Connecticut, VLink is one of the fastest growing digital technology services and consulting companies. Since its inception, our innovative team members have been solving the most complex business, and IT challenges of our global clients.




Job Description




Vlink has an immediate need for an Jr. Data Analyst to join our financial services team in one of our selected CGI locations. Due to the current COVID-19 status, candidates will not be required to work within the physical work location at this time. When COVID-19 restrictions are lifted, they will be required to be located within the proximity of the assigned CGI location.




Your Future Duties And Responsibilities




This is a consulting position to conduct analysis and Quality Assurance of mortgage data systems that being changed. Position will be part of an Agile team as an analyst/tester on a project to develop and enhance a large complex portfolio pricing application. Position will need to create SQL queries to analyze and understand existing data characteristics. Position will create test plan and test cases to compare data sets before and after data source changes to ensure the data requirements are implemented correctly. Position will validate reports to catch any reporting errors as well. Position may need to provide other analytical and business analysis support as needed support as needed.




Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role




" 5+ years of experience conducting data analysis and testing




" Strong experience with SQL




" Experience in data analysis tools - Micro Strategy




" Knowledge of AWS services required




" Experience with SAS, R, Python a plus




" Excellent communication and interpersonal skills




" Must be self-motivated with strong work ethics




" Must be a quick learner and willing to learn




Desired Skillset




" Experience with software testing and software Agile development process strongly preferred




" Finance/ Mortgage industry experience a pluss




Educational Requirements




B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science, Information Systems, Statistics, Finance or related field




Employment Practices




EEO, ADA, FMLA Compliant




VLink is an equal opportunity employer. At VLink, we are committed to embracing diversity, multiculturalism, and inclusion. VLink does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, or discharge, will be decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, performance, and business needs.

Title: Amazon Data Analyst - Flexible(Remote) Work Location
Description:
DSM – Bright Science. Brighter Living.™ Bring your passion. Build the future.




We seek an Analyst, eCommerce and Omnichannel to help accelerate growth with Amazon and key customers. You’ll be responsible for interpreting and presenting digital KPIs to a variety of stakeholders while providing test measurement, analysis and insights on our brands and competitive set to optimize our business.




You’ll be Responsible for:




Maintain, develop, and present accurate and timely KPI reporting for our business
Identify, analyze, and interpret complex data sets to deliver actionable insights
Monitor brand, category, competitor and industry data to capitalize on emerging trends
Build pre-during-post analysis measurement structures to showcase transparent results
Quickly adapt and enhance measurement approach as needed based on changing market dynamics
Provide pricing and promotion effectiveness recommendations to optimize purchase behavior
Deliver ad-hoc reporting as requested by team to support ongoing business evaluation and analysis
Collaborate with cross-functional Digital Commerce team to share best practices
Recognize areas for further reporting efficiencies - leading to money and time savings
Partner closely within team and with external partners to drive collaboration and business outcomes
Enable an intellectually curious mindset and desire for continuous learning and improvement
Perform other duties as required




What we Like to See in Your Experience:




Bachelor’s Degree required
Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in the CPG industry with a strong background in Digital Commerce and Data Analytics Measurement
Competency in one or more statistical programming language (R preferred, Python is a plus)
Comfortability using one or more data visualization reporting tool (Power BI, Google Data Studio, Tableau, etc.) to present large datasets in readable, actionable ways
Understanding of Digital platforms and data tools such as Amazon Vendor Central, Numerator, Jungle Scout and Nielsen
Enthusiasm in ability to turn data and insights into stories and actionable optimizations
Efficient project management skills to prioritize, multi-task and meet fast paced deadlines
Understanding of Agile team framework, and comfortability working in team pods
Strong team leadership skills, demonstrated in analytical and digital environments
Familiarity within Health & Wellness categories preferred




.




Royal DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 23,000 employees. The company is listed on Euronext. For more information about DSM see http://www.dsm.com or connect on

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
Construction industry firm is seeking a Lead Data Analyst Consultant to manage a small team of Data Analyst who will support all levels of the firm in their use of data. This is a hands on Supervisory role. You must have experience managing a team as well as hands on Data Analysis skills and experience. You must have excellent communication skills and be able to interface with all levels of management.




Responsibilities (perform these tasks and/or manage the team to do so):




• Evaluate sources of information to determine any limitations, in terms of reliability or usability

• Clean, manipulate and analyze large sets of raw data

• Build data models, and checks for inaccuracies, and creates and maintains record of transactions in tools

• Creates reports and dashboards and/or other visualizations to convey results

• Recommend data-driven solutions to key stakeholders

• Establish KPIs to measure effectiveness of business decisions and/or management dashboards

• Create presentations and reports based on recommendations and findings

• Conduct business analysis and research to identify key metrics and opportunities for improvement

• Provide end user training, documentation and support on process and metrics used




Required Skills and experience:




• Demonstrated knowledge of digital skills. Knowledge of and experience using Microsoft Power BI/ Tableau, SQL, ETL Tools

• Prior experience leading a team

• A degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Computer Technology, Computer Programming & Software Development, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or certificate of completion of a coding boot-camp and 2-3 years of experience

• Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively tailor technical concepts for less technical audiences




This is a long term consulting role and is an on-site position. You must be able and willing to work in Queens, NY. It is just a few stops from midtown Manhattan by subway.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description
 
LeadStack Inc. is an award winning, one of the nation's fastest growing, certified minority owned (MBE) staffing services provider of contingent workforce. As a recognized industry leader in contingent workforce solutions and Certified as a Great Place to Work, we're proud to partner with some of the most admired Fortune 500 brands in the world. 
 
Title: Data Analytics
Location: Culver City, CA (2-3 days/week)
Direct Client
Duration: Long term contract (possible extn. Or FTE)
Immediate interview
Job ID: 23-00033
 
Description:
[User Insights] Support the execution of research plans in partnership with Sr PMM & UXR; synthesize key learnings and audience needs, use them to influence marketing and product strategy [Product Influence & Knowledge] Partner with PMM, product, design, strategy and operations, and engineering teams to test, launch, and scale new experience solutions that help Dashers increase their take home earnings, get more out of each dash (shift) and reach better financial wellness.
 
Responsibilities:
Apply expertise in data analysis and visualization to see beyond the numbers
Deliver data support for both short term and long-term development plans from strategic scope                and execution aspects with in-depths analysis.
Build/maintain reports, dashboards, and metrics to monitor the performance of P&O data.
Prepare and present insightful presentations and memos in easy-to-understand and compelling formats, which can be used to summarize analyses, make recommendations, and/or seek cross-functional alignment
Build strong relationships with a broad set of cross-functional stakeholder to streamline operations and workflows 
Qualification:
Bachelor's degree with a background in Math, Economics, Computer Science, Statistics, or other quantitative fields
Expert experience pulling large and complex data using SQL and writing data pipelines.
Experience with a data visualization tool (e.g. Tableau)
Prefer to Have:
Experience doing quantitative analysis
Development experience in at least one scripting language (PHP, Python, Perl, etc.)
Excellent verbal and written English communication skills

To know more about current opportunities at LeadStack, please visit us on https://leadstackinc.com/careers/
Should you have any questions, feel free to call me on (650) 850 - 8282

South San Francisco, CA 94080W.www.leadstackinc.com           ________________

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
3+ years of experience in data modeling principles/methods including conceptual, logical & physical data models and technical architecture experience integrating data protection into data modeling
Or 2+ years acting as an architect (can be concurrent); 2+ years working in privacy or technology policy (can be concurrent); 2+ years working as a data modeler (can be concurrent)

Title: Senior Analyst, Analytics & Insights
Description:
We're transforming the grocery industry

At Instacart, we invite the world to share love through food because we believe everyone should have access to the food they love and more time to enjoy it together. Where others see a simple need for grocery delivery, we see exciting complexity and endless opportunity to serve the varied needs of our community. We work to deliver an essential service that customers rely on to get their groceries and household goods, while also offering safe and flexible earnings opportunities to Instacart Personal Shoppers.

Instacart has become a lifeline for millions of people, and we’re building the team to help push our shopping cart forward. If you’re ready to do the best work of your life, come join our table.

Instacart is a Flex First team

There’s no one-size fits all approach to how we do our best work. Our employees have the flexibility to choose where they do their best work—whether it’s from home, an office, or your favorite coffee shop—while staying connected and building community through regular in-person events. Learn more about our flexible approach to where we work.

Overview

Instacart’s Analytics & Insights Team sits within Business Development, at the intersection of Instacart’s unparalleled grocery industry data and our most important grocery retail partners. Our grocery partnerships are at the core of our business, and this role is focused on leveraging data and analytics to influence business decision making, understand customer behavior, and drive growth of key company goals.

This Senior Analyst will strive to understand the dynamics of the marketplace through descriptive analysis, supporting the team in tackling ambiguous problems using data, and providing the both internal and external teams with the tools to answer “how did the business perform?” and “why did it perform that way?” You will be a subject matter expert on Instacart’s data and tools in order to efficiently answer key business questions and build sustainable solutions to enable stakeholders to progressively answer more and more of these questions on their own.

About The Job

Support Instacart’s largest retail partners in helping them make data-driven decisions
Work closely with internal and external stakeholders to understand their business and develop analysis, dashboards, and reporting to address their needs
Support internal teams with data that will help them best serve their accounts and strengthen the partnership across several key areas:
Identify opportunities for optimization and growth through the analysis of performance relative to peer benchmarks
Develop data-driven business cases to help expand Instacart’s retail partnerships
Monitor operational performance to ensure consistently excellent service for Instacart’s end customers
Help prepare for weekly, monthly and quarterly business reviews
Become a subject matter expert in Instacart’s data and tools:
Immerse yourself in Instacart’s vast database and extract relevant datasets using SQL
Develop low-touch, self-serve reporting for both internal and external teams
Understand the data needs of both internal and external teams and, where appropriate, get those requirements on the roadmap for the scalable solutions being developed by other people on our team

About You

3+ years work experience in a quantitative role. This is a great opportunity for those with experience in Consulting, Banking, Analytics, or similar roles. Experience with retail and e-commerce is a plus
Advanced SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools experience required
Flexible and adaptable; collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to understand their goals and tailor your approach accordingly
Resourceful; ability to find answers to tough questions (especially data-related) by tracking down the right data and stakeholders
Thinking sustainably and building for scale; develop long-term solutions to recurring problems
Strong analytical skills; ability to logically break down complex problems and identify potential pitfalls
Ability to effectively manage multiple key stakeholder relationships, both internal and external, and provide guidance on more efficient approaches as needed

Accommodations & Accessibility

At Instacart, we strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you need assistance submitting an application through our career site due to a disability, please submit an Accommodations Request Form and someone from our team will reach out soon to see how we may be able to assist.

    • Immerse yourself in Instacart’s vast database and extract relevant datasets using SQL
    • Develop low-touch, self-serve reporting for both internal and external teams
  • Understand the data needs of both internal and external teams and, where appropriate, get those requirements on the roadmap for the scalable solutions being developed by other people on our team
About You
  • 3+ years work experience in a quantitative role. This is a great opportunity for those with experience in Consulting, Banking, Analytics, or similar roles. Experience with retail and e-commerce is a plus
  • Advanced SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools experience required
  • Flexible and adaptable; collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to understand their goals and tailor your approach accordingly
  • Resourceful; ability to find answers to tough questions (especially data-related) by tracking down the right data and stakeholders
  • Thinking sustainably and building for scale; develop long-term solutions to recurring problems
  • Strong analytical skills; ability to logically break down complex problems and identify potential pitfalls
  • Ability to effectively manage multiple key stakeholder relationships, both internal and external, and provide guidance on more efficient approaches as needed
Accommodations & Accessibility

At Instacart, we strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you need assistance submitting an application through our career site due to a disability, please submit an Accommodations Request Form and someone from our team will reach out soon to see how we may be able to assist.

Title: Senior Analyst, Business Intelligence
Description:
We're transforming the grocery industry

At Instacart, we invite the world to share love through food because we believe everyone should have access to the food they love and more time to enjoy it together. Where others see a simple need for grocery delivery, we see exciting complexity and endless opportunity to serve the varied needs of our community. We work to deliver an essential service that customers rely on to get their groceries and household goods, while also offering safe and flexible earnings opportunities to Instacart Personal Shoppers.

Instacart has become a lifeline for millions of people, and we’re building the team to help push our shopping cart forward. If you’re ready to do the best work of your life, come join our table.

Instacart is a Flex First team

There’s no one-size fits all approach to how we do our best work. Our employees have the flexibility to choose where they do their best work—whether it’s from home, an office, or your favorite coffee shop—while staying connected and building community through regular in-person events. Learn more about our flexible approach to where we work.

Overview

Instacart’s Analytics & Insights Team sits within Business Development, at the intersection of Instacart’s rich grocery industry data and our grocery retail partners. Our grocery partnerships are at the core of Instacart’s business model, and our retail partners' success is of paramount importance to us. This role is focused on building industry leading market intelligence reporting and analytics to help Instacart and its retail partners make better strategic and tactical business decisions. This is a highly impactful role that will engage in building solutions with visibility to the Instacart Executive team as well as to leading largest North American retailers.

As this Senior Analyst you will be responsible for a wide range of tasks such as defining data requirements, running descriptive analysis, designing and building dashboards, and preparing in-depth “so-what” analysis and business recommendations. You will be able to build high-level and scalable solutions as well as have the ability to dive deeper into the data to uncover actionable insights.

About The Job

Serve as a Subject Matter Expert on the grocery e-commerce industry, developing market intelligence reports by leveraging internal and 3rd party data
Be responsible for the development, maintenance, and documentation of market intelligence metrics, including the understanding and structuring of 3rd party data, creation of new data models and analytics layers, and construction of complex yet concise dashboards
Work closely with cross-functional teams to contribute to the development of periodic market intelligence reports by providing relevant and compelling insights on market and competitive trends
Work closely with the Business Development team to understand their requirements and create compelling visual dashboards, reports, and presentations
Lead data investigations to better understand retailer performance in relation to market trends
Adhere to best practices in reporting and analysis, including data integrity, analysis, validation, and documentation

About You

3+ years of experience in an analytics and business intelligence role
Strong analytical skills and ability to leverage data to identify trends and influence business decisions
Advanced proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools, particularly Tableau
Ability to quickly respond to problems independently, consider all stakeholder needs, and provide clear, concise answers to complex data
Excellent communication skills and ability to manage multiple stakeholder groups
Experience with dbt or other data transformation tools is a plus
Bachelor's degree or equivalent is required

Accommodations & Accessibility

At Instacart, we strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you need assistance submitting an application through our career site due to a disability, please submit an Accommodations Request Form and someone from our team will reach out soon to see how we may be able to assist.

Title: Staff Cloud Developer
Description:
At Kinaxis, who we are is grounded in our common belief that people matter. Each one of us plays an important part in accomplishing our work, building our culture and making a global impact.

Every day, we’re empowered to work together to help our customers make fast, confident planning decisions. This is how we create a better planet – for each other, for our customers and for generations to come. Our cloud-based platform RapidResponse ensures that the products we need – everything from medicine and cars, to day-to-day items like toothpaste – make it to market and into our hands when we need them with minimal ecological footprint.

We make the world better, and you can too.

Staff Cloud Developer, Platform Engineering

Job location: Ottawa-Hybrid, Other Canadian locations- Remote

Additional requirements: Candidates must meet Controlled Goods Program Requirements.

About The Team

Imperative Orchestration, Declarative Automation - The Platform Engineering Team is responsible for building and running a cloud platform that enables delivery teams to self-service deployments with reduced lead time and complexity. We also provide cloud services and tools that enable internal development teams to build, test and deploy their applications using modern platform tooling like Git CI/CD pipelines, Terraform and Kubernetes delivery via ArgoCD. These same tools we leverage to ensure our customer environments are automated and continuously up to date. We are passionate about code and the power of automation to simplify complex processes.

As a Staff Cloud Developer in platform engineering, you will be a part of our team that provides the infrastructure, core capabilities and expertise to enable our product teams to deliver at pace and build a platform for hosting Kinaxis SaaS offerings. We have a strong engineering culture, focused on steady, correct delivery, with a cloud-first approach. We are rapidly growing, supercharging the team that powers our developer & application platform.

What You Will Do

Apply software engineering principles to application and operations challenges with a focus on automation and self-healing.
Collaborate with teams across the enterprise to uncover pain points and formulate ways to accelerate delivery.
Adopt existing Reference Architectures and their implementations; contribute to the design of new Reference Architectures.
Deliver cloud reference architectures to be used by teams across the enterprise as they work to modernize existing technologies and build new capabilities to deliver to Customers.
Provide an exceptional experience to our development and operations teams, with a focus on self-service using modern approaches.
Investigate new system solutions to enhance application delivery experiences through innovative experiments or Proof of Concept.
Build and manage, stable & secure cloud automation using cloud orchestration capabilities, scripting languages and APIs to design, code, test, implement and support Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
Lead team members in achieving professional excellence utilizing industry best practices.
Advise and maintain a feedback loop with development and operations teams to ensure deliveries are in accordance with needs and expectations.
Function as a go-to tech lead for pinpointing challenges and finding creative solutions.
Prioritize projects/tasks according to company needs and expectations.
Lead team code reviews and design reviews.

What We Are Looking For

Bachelor’s/Master's degree in Engineering with specialization in Computer Science or related discipline or demonstrated equivalent experience.
8 years of experience with architecture and deployment of Cloud Services.
5 years of experience with Infrastructure and Platform engineering for high availability and scalable architectures in the cloud.
5 years of experience with public cloud platforms (both console and API) like GCP, Azure or AWS
Strong knowledge of system design to manage operational and reliability trade-offs.
Extensive experience developing in Go, Python and Shell/Bash.
Proven practical experience in building and managing:
Infrastructure as Code (Terraform)
Configuration management tools (Ansible)
CI/CD solutions (Git, GitOps, Argo CD)
Containers and orchestrators (Docker, Kubernetes, Helm)
System monitoring and centralized logging platforms (Datadog, Prometheus, ELK)
Practical understanding of agile methodologies and Scrum.
Ability to share knowledge with others in the company.
In-depth and proactive communication and documentation skills.
Initiative and ability to work independently, and as part of a team.
Ability to use a wide variety of open-source technologies.

What we have to offer

Challenging Work - We love solving highly complex problems. And as the global leaders in our industry, we never stop innovating—our work is never “done. That’s because across our teams and in all roles, every employee is empowered to bring their best ideas forward and to jump in and solve the problems they’re passionate about.
Great People - We take our work seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously! It’s in our DNA to celebrate, laugh, and have fun. We are stronger, together, when we are open, honest, and above all, real. Every person is valued here and plays an important role in our shared success.
Global Impact - As a global team spanning continents, boundaries, and cultures, every day we are inspired by the impact our work has on our colleagues, our customers, our communities, and the world at large.
Diversity, Equity and Inclusion - Diversity, equity and inclusion are more than words to us. They are the guiding principles for building a culture where we celebrate each others’ differences, continuously strive for equality and recognize that inclusion makes us stronger as individuals, a company and a global citizen.

For more information, visit the Kinaxis web site at www.kinaxis.com or the company’s blog at http://blog.kinaxis.com/ .

Kinaxis strongly encourages diverse candidates to apply to our welcoming community. We strive to make our website and application process accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact Human Resources at accommodations@kinaxis.com . This contact information is for accessibility requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.

  • Practical understanding of agile methodologies and Scrum.

  • Great People - We take our work seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously! It’s in our DNA to celebrate, laugh, and have fun. We are stronger, together, when we are open, honest, and above all, real. Every person is valued here and plays an important role in our shared success.
  • Global Impact - As a global team spanning continents, boundaries, and cultures, every day we are inspired by the impact our work has on our colleagues, our customers, our communities, and the world at large.
  • Diversity, Equity and Inclusion - Diversity, equity and inclusion are more than words to us. They are the guiding principles for building a culture where we celebrate each others’ differences, continuously strive for equality and recognize that inclusion makes us stronger as individuals, a company and a global citizen.
